loans.name: Genny Marina

texts.es: Genny de 62 años, vive con su cónyuge y tiene 3 hijos de 17 a 34 años de edad. Ella desarrolla una actividad comercial, con la que genera ingresos para apoyar el sustento de su hogar; vende productos de belleza, ropa y oro golfi principalmente. Su experiencia empresarial inició cundo trabajó para un salón de belleza, una vez se capacitó para ello. De allí su inclinación hacia actividades tendientes al mejoramiento de la imagen personal desde hace 25 años; estas actividades las complementó con la venta de mercancía variada y poco a poco su negocio fue creciendo. Sus compras la realizan de contado, y algunas de las cuales las hace a crédito, en almacenes de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Sus clientes son profesores y amas de casa principalmente, a quienes les ofrece sus productos a crédito, para recuperar su dinero en plazos pactados a la medida de cada cliente. En la actualidad Genny ha recibido 11 créditos, de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con ellos ha logrado aumentar su inversión y  ofrecer diversidad de líneas de productos. Hoy se encuentra está aplicando a un credikiva con el que comprará ropa para dama, perfumería y loza china. Su meta más adelante es tener un local comercial donde exhibir sus productos, para no tener que trasladarse tras su clientela vendiendo  uno a uno.
texts.en:
Genny, age 62, lives with her husband and has three children ages 17 to 34. She has a business which generates an income to help support her household. She sells mainly beauty products, clothing, and imitation gold. She started getting business experience working in a beauty salon, after training to do so. From there her inclination toward businesses involving improving customers' personal images began, 25 years ago. Selling varied merchandise complemented her activities, and bit by bit her business grew.
She makes her purchases in cash, but some are on credit, in stores in the city of Barranquilla. Her customers are mainly teachers and housewives. She offers her products on credit and receives payment based on a schedule tailored to each client. Genny has received 11 loans from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With them, she has succeeded in getting a return on her investments and offering diverse product lines. She is now applying for a Kiva loan with which she will buy women's clothing, perfume, and china. Her goal for the future is to have a storefront to display her products, so that she won't have to go to each customer individually.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing, perfume, and china.

loans.name: Maria Emilia

texts.es:
María, esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque necesita aumentar su inventario de venta, comprandose granos básicos como arroz y los frijoles, también en aceite, azúcar, condimentos, papel higiénico, que son los productos de mayor demanda en el negocio.

El considera que el préstamo anterior le permitió subsistir con su negocio, para poder atender a su clientela de una mejor manera, durante este tiempo el ha prosperado en su situación familiar y a adquirido un terreno el cual está pagando.
texts.en:
María is asking for a new loan because she needs to increase her sales inventory. She needs to buy basic staples such as rice and beans, as well as oil, sugar, condiments, and toilet paper, which are the products in greatest demand at her business.

The previous loan allowed her to get by with her business, in order to be able to attend to her customers better. During this time her family situation has prospered and she has acquired a piece of land, which is paying off.

loans.use: to purchase rice and beans, oil, sugar, condiments, and toilet paper

loans.name: Ayaovi

texts.fr: Couturier de profession,  et cela depuis 2007, Ayaovi exerce son activité dans un atelier. Il est père d’un enfant de 05mois et est âgé de 38ans. Sa femme est coiffeuse. Il coud les habits et à de nombreux clients qui viennent de part et d’autres de la ville de Lomé pour commander.  Ce premier prêt qu’il sollicite lui servira à s’approvisionner en machine et tissus pour bien répondre aux besoins de ses clients. Il veut épargner le profit supplémentaire, créer d’autres points de vente d’habits et fonder une famille financièrement stable.
texts.en: Ayaovi is a clothes designer by profession and has been working from his workshop since 2007. He is 38 years old and father to a 5 month old child. His wife is a hairdresser. He sews clothes and has many customers who come from all over the city of Lome to order clothes. He is seeking his first loan in order to buy a machine and fabrics so that he can best meet the needs of his customers. He wants to save any extra profits, open other clothing stores and ensure that his family is financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a machine and fabric

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
Nita is a 26 year old woman who is married with one child. She runs a business of sewing in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Nita has requested a loan to buy more materials and a new sewing machine and sewing supplies. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy more materials, a sewing machine, threads and needles

loans.name: Eleitino

texts.en:
Eleitino is 24 years old and married with three children. She runs a small business selling snacks, ice pop, etc. in her community and has been doing this for two years. Eleitino  has requested a loan to purchase new food items to sell. 

She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Eleitino  will extend her business and hopefully improve her home building.

loans.use: to purchase new food products for the canteen

loans.name: Faafetai

texts.en:
Faafetai is 56 years old and married, with seven children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as snacks and drinks.  She has been doing this for three years. 

Faafetai needs a loan to purchase more goods and products to restock her canteen. She hopes to use her profits to help her improve her business and also meet her family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: To buy snacks, noodles, flour, soft drinks, and other items to restock her canteen.

loans.name: Liaina

texts.en:
Liaina  is 38 years old and married with ten children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community.  She has been doing this for three years. Liaina has requested a loan to purchase a new fishing net, a canoe, goggles, and spears. 

She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Liaina  will help her family and her kids' education.

loans.use: to purchase a new fishing net, a canoe, goggles, and spears

loans.name: Tiana

texts.en:
Tiana is 59 years old and married with four children. She runs a small business selling fruits and vegetables in her community and has been doing this for three years. 

Tiana has requested a loan to purchase vegetable seeds, barbed wire, a watering hose, a rake and gloves. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tiana will extend her business and help pay for her family's living expenses.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, barbed wire, a watering hose, a rake and gloves

loans.name: Mele

texts.en: Mele is a 38-year-old married woman with four children. She would like to start fishing business to earn a living. Mele has requested a loan to purchase a canoe, fishing net and fishing spears to get her start. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Mele will spend her profits to help her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase a canoe, fishing net and fishing spears

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood for selling tortillas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy primary materials

loans.name: Litia

texts.en:
Litia is a 32-year-old married woman with five children. 

She has a small plantation and grows bananas and taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. Litia has requested a loan to purchase a crowbar, manure, chemicals, a spade and a rake. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. With her profits, Litia hopes to help her kids' education and her family too.

loans.use: to purchase a crowbar, manure, chemicals, a spade and a rake

loans.name: Visilia

texts.en:
Visilia is 58 years old and married with 8 children. She runs a small business selling jam and buns in her community and has been doing this for three years. 

Visilia has requested a loan to pay school fees, buy new uniforms and buy flour for the business. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Visilia will look for another business and help her family.

loans.use: to pay for school fees, buy new uniforms and buy flour for her business

loans.name: Celestino

texts.en:
Celestino is married with four children. He is 37 years old and lives in Kapalaran, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.

Celestino grows rice for sale in the local community to earn a living and his been in this business for five years. Each month, he earns 10,000.

He has requested a loan of 10,000 to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for the next crop. In 2011, Celestino joined GDMPC. In the future, he wants to save a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for the next crop

loans.name: Miriama

texts.en:
Miriama is a 30-year-old married woman with three children. 

She would like to start growing taro and bananas to earn a living. Miriama has requested a loan to buy barbed wire, a wheelbarrow, a spade and a rake to help her develop her plantation. 
 
She has been a member of SPBD since this year. Miriama will spend her profits to help her family's living conditions and give good education to her kids.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire, a wheelbarrow, a spade and a rake

loans.name: Mere

texts.en: Mere is 59 years old and married with five children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to purchase flour, sugar, baking powder and eggs for pancakes. In the future, Mere hopes to extend and improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, baking powder and eggs

loans.name: Oscar Alexander

texts.es:
Oscar, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque necesita mejorar la producción en la panadería, con los fondos prestados se comprara manteca, harina, leña, levadura, huevos, y otros materiales que intervienen en la producción y elaboración de pan, con estos materiales espera poder continuar en su negocio ofreciendo a sus clientes producto de calidad.

El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior en el negocio fue positivo, ya que está mejorando la calidad del producto y aumentando su producción, de esta manera cuenta con mayor número de clientes y considera haber realizado un gran cambio para mejorar la rentabilidad.
texts.en:
Oscar is requesting a new loan because he needs to improve his bakery's production. With the borrowed funds he will buy butter, flour, firewood, yeast, eggs and other supplies that are needed for the preparation and baking of bread. With these supplies he hopes to be able to continue offering his customers a quality product at his business. 

The effect that the previous loan had on his business was positive. He is already improving the quality of his products and increasing his production. In this way he will have a greater number of customers and will consider a great change fulfilled to improve his profitability.

loans.use: to buy butter, flour, firewood, yeast and eggs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase corn and oil

loans.name: Maua

texts.en:
Maua is a 39-year-old married woman with four children. 

She would like to start growing vegetable to earn a living. Maua has requested a loan to purchase a rake, a spade, barbed wire, fertilizer, cucumber seeds and tomato seeds to start her business.
  
She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Maua will spend her profits to increase her garden.

loans.use: to purchase a rake, a spade, barbed wire, fertilizer, cucumber seeds and tomato seeds

loans.name: Kpongbede

texts.fr: Madame Kpongbede est une jeune dame de 35ans. Elle est mariée à un chauffeur de taxi et a en charge 03 enfants tous sur les bancs de l’école. Ils sont âgés de 12,09 et 06ans. Depuis 1994, elle s’est donnée à l’activité de produits congelés, de sucre et sel dans un marché de la ville de Lomé. Elle est à son premier crédit de WAGES et ce montant lui servira à s’approvisionner en marchandises pour mieux vendre aux clients. Elle veut avoir une chambre froide pour la vente des produits congelés et multiplier ses points de service. Sa difficulté est la concurrence sur le terrain.
texts.en: Madame Kpongbede is a young 35 year old lady. She is married to a taxi driver and has 03 children in her care who are all in school. They are 6, 9 and 12 years old. Since 1994 she has been selling frozen products, sugar and salt in a market in Lome. This is her first loan from the microfinance institution WAGES. She will use the amount to buy supplies so that she can better serve her customers. She would like to have a cold room for the sale of frozen products and open more points of sale. Her main difficulty is the competition in the area.

loans.use: to buy frozen products

loans.name: Poh Gending Lestari Group

texts.en:
Like many Balinese women, Ni Nengah and the other members of the Poh Gending Lestari group raise pigs in their yards to supplement their families’ incomes. Though many women support their families in this way, they may not know the best way to raise pigs to maximize income. Ni Nengah hopes that, through the MUK Pig Breeder Loan program, she will not only get capital but will also get training from MUK on the best way to feed and care for pigs. 

Ni Nengah will use her share of the loan to purchase piglets and pig feed. She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as pork. With her profits, she will help support her family of four by supplementing the income of her husband, who works as a farmer. Ultimately, Ni Nengah hopes that increased income will enable her to improve her house.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store at wholesale.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is a 33-year-old married woman with four children.
 
She would like to start growing vegetable to earn a living. Lita has requested a loan to purchase a garden hose, a rake, gloves, cabbage, and cucumber and tomato seeds.
 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Lita will spend her profits to increase her garden.

loans.use: to purchase a garden hose, a rake, gloves, and cabbage, cucumber and tomato seeds

loans.name: Ayao

texts.fr: Revendeur de boissons de façon ambulante, Mr Ayao est marié à une revendeuse et ils ont en charge 02 enfants dont 01 scolarisé. Ils sont âgés de 05 et 1an 6 mois. C’est en 2010 qu’il a commencé par exercer cette activité et cela lui génère de fruit qui lui permet se prendre en charge. C’est pour cela il sollicite l’aide WAGES pour stocker de la boisson en quantité afin de mieux subvenir aux demandes des clients. Il veut injecter les profits supplémentaires dans l’activité, ouvrir une boutique pour mieux s’installer et les profits seront à l’avantage de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ayao works reselling drinks on the street, and is married to another reseller. Together they have two children under their care, one of whom is at school. The children are aged 5 and 1 year 6 months. 

Ayao began this business in 2010, and it generates income to provide for his children. He has requested assistance from WAGES to buy drink stocks in sufficient quantities to meet his customers’ requests. He wants to inject his additional profits into his business, and to open a store so he has a better location. He will use the profits for his family.

loans.use: To buy drinks.

loans.name: Mauai

texts.en: Mauai is 40 years old and married with five children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pork buns in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to purchase mutton flap meat, flour, garlic, onions and soy sauce to make her pork buns. In the future, Mauai hopes to improve the quality of her food production. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase mutton flap meat, flour, garlic, onions and soy sauce

loans.name: Zokirjon

texts.ru: Зокирчон 1965 года рождения,женат имеет 1 ребенка. Зокирчон работает в средней школе учителем трудового обучения. Он обучает в школе мальчиков строить и чинить мебель. Также он работает водителем городского такси . Он развозит пассажиров по городу. Его жена работает в детском саду педагогом. Зокирчон в первые обратился за финансовой поддержкой в 2010 году. Тогда он получал кредит для ремонта своего такси. С тех пор он сотрудничает с нашей организацией и очень благодарен за поддержку. Настоящий момент Зокирчон получил кредит что бы оплатить за обучение единственного ребенка.Он и в дальнейшем платинирует продолжить сотрудничество с нашей организацией.
texts.en: Zokirjon was born in 1965, is married and has one child.  He works as a shop class teacher at a secondary school.  He teaches school boys how to build and repair furniture.  Zokirjon also works as a municipal taxi driver.  He transports passengers within the city.  His wife works as a teacher at a kindergarten.  Zokirjon first requested financial support in 2010.  At that time, he obtained a loan to repair his taxi.  He has been partnering with our organization since then and is very grateful for the support.  Currently, Zokirjon obtained a loan to pay for his only child's education.  He plans to continue the partnership with our organization in the future.

loans.use: to pay for his child's education

loans.name: Alba Nellys

texts.es:
la señora. Alba habita en San pablo comunidad de san rafael nicaragua, es casada tiene treinta y cinco años de edad. tiene dos hijos uno en edad escolar y el otra una niña menor de una año. su esposo tiene trabajo fijo trabaja para una empresa que presta el servicio de vigilancia.
La senora Alba se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortilla suave. desde muy joven empezo realizando las tortilla en el molino donde habitaba su tia. Un dia normal de doña alba es se levanta a las cinco de la mañana a la preparacion de la alimentacion de su esposo para ir al trabajo, luego atiende a sus hijos. despues comienza a la preparacion del maiz para despues empezar a realizar la elaboracion de las tortilla realiza de cien a ciento setenta tortilla diaria y sus clientes llegan a comprarle a su casa de habitacion.
el credito lo solicita para la compra de maiz en grandes cantidad cuando el precio esta en temprada bajo precio y almacenarlo para asi tener siempre para hacer sus tortillas. en caso que le sobre una pequeña parte del credito lo utilizar en el primer cumpleaño de su niña con una pequeña piñata con sus familiares y vecinitos.


La señora Alba No tenia casa propia siempre andaba alquilando pero con los pequeños creditos que se le han otorgado y las pequeñas ganancias de su negocio y los ingresos de su esposo ha podido comprar un terreno y tener su propia casa.
su mejores sueño son hacer su cocina y tener para darle estudio a sus hijos
texts.en:
Alba lives in San Pablo, a community of San Rafael, Nicaragua.  She is married, 35 years old, and has two children, of whom one is in school and the other is a little girl who is just one year old.  Her husband has a regular job working for a company as a security guard.

Alba is involved in the creation and sales of soft tortillas.  When she was very young, she began making tortillas in the mill where her aunt lived.  A regular day for Alba is one where she gets up at five in the morning to make food for her husband before he goes to work in the morning.  She then takes care of her children before beginning to prepare the corn which she will later use to make her tortillas.  She makes between a hundred and one hundred and seventy tortillas each day and her customers come to buy them at her home.

The loan she is asking for will be for buying corn in bulk quantities while the prices are lowest and housing the corn so as to always have enough to make her tortillas.  If a part of her loan money is left over, she will use a small part of it for her daughter's first birthday to celebrate with a small piñata along with her family and the neighbor children.

Alba didn't have a house of her own and was previously forced to rent, but with the previous loans she has been granted, and the bit more income from her business, and the income her husband brings in, they have been able to buy a parcel of land and have their own house.

Her greatest dream is to make a kitchen for herself and to have enough for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy corn for making soft corn tortillas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es:
María Estela, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada, tiene 4 hijos y vive en Chamelecón, San Pedro Sula.
María Estela, tiene su propio negocio desde hace 4 años donde vende todo tipo de productos cosméticos por catálogo y por pedidos como ser: cremas, desodorantes, lociones, etc. y adicionalmente vende medicinas básicas y vitaminas. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa y sus clientes son de su comunidad quienes le hacen pedidos. Con el préstamo que está solicitando va surtir de mas productos de cosméticos y medicinas, es su quinto préstamo que va invertir en el negocio y espera aumentar las ventas y su meta es seguir creciendo en el negocio para poderles dar el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María Estela, 36, is married and has four children; she lives in Chamelecón, San Pedro Sula.  María Estela has had her own business for the last four years where she sells all types of cosmetics via catalogue and based on prior orders like creams, deodorant, lotion, etc. and she also sells basic medicine and vitamins.  Her business is home-based and her customers are from her community; they place orders from her.

She will use the loan she’s requesting to stock up on more cosmetics and medicine.  This is her 5th loan that she’s going to invest in her business.  She hopes to increase sales and her goal is to continue growing in the business in order to provide schooling for her children.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and medicine.

loans.name: Henry Alexander

texts.es:
Henry, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder surtir  el negocio, comprándose mercadería como lo son controles para televisores, bocinas, cd, dvd, con películas y música nueva, esta inversión ayudará a aumentar los productos en el negocio.

Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo que le permitió a él mejorar su inventario y atender las demandas de los clientes, él nos comenta que en este período su familia ha contado con lo necesario, a futuro tiene la aspiración de construir su propia casa y espera lograrlo a través de su trabajo en el negocio.
texts.en:
Henry’s asking for a new loan in order to stock the business buying merchandise like television remote controls, speakers, CDs and DVDs with movies and new music.  This investment will help him increase stock inventory in the business.

He had a positive effect from the previous loan that allowed him to improve inventory and meet customer demand.  He comments that his family has been able to have what they’ve needed during this period and in the future he hopes to build his own house, something he expects to attain through his work in his business.

loans.use: to buy television remote controls, speakers, CDs and DVDs.

loans.name: Uatifoti

texts.en: Uatifoti is 50 years old and married with five children. She plans to start a business selling general goods and products to her community. She has requested a loan to purchase a box of chicken, sausage, mutton flaps, noodles, snacks, Vailima beer, soft drinks and toilet paper to she sell in her shop. Uatifoti will use her profits to increase and improve her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, sausage, mutton flaps, noodles, snacks, Vailima beer, soft drinks and toilet paper

loans.name: Lotoi

texts.en:
Lotoi is a 48-year-old married woman with three children. 

She would like to start growing vegetables to earn a living. Lotoi has requested a loan to purchase a garden hose, a rake, fertilizer and a spade to help her start her vegetable garden.
 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Lotoi will spend her profits to increase and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase a garden hose, a rake, fertilizer and a spade

loans.name: Lolakhon

texts.ru:
Лолахон трудолюбивая молодая женщина. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Муж Лолахон находится в Российской Федерации. 
Лолахон сама зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. В этой области Лолахон имеет богатый опыт. Он более шести лет занимается животноводством. 
Лолахон берет кредит для закупа телят. За счет полученной прибыли Лолахон намерена сделать капитальный ремонт в доме.
texts.en: Lolakhon is a hardworking young woman.  She is married and has three children.  Her husband is in the Russian Federation.  Lolakhon earns a living by breeding cattle.  She has a rich experience in this area.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for six years.  Lolakhon is requesting this loan to buy calves.  She intends to use the resulting profit to make major repairs at home.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Tamara

texts.ru:
Тамара родилась 1973 году. Она проживает в района Кубодиен. Тамара живет с мужем.  
Тамара имеет среднее образование. Она занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота. Тамара разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. В этой области она пять лет. 
Тамара просит кредит для закупа двух бычков с целью увеличения крупнорогатого скота и получения хорошей прибыли. Она хочет купить автомашину.
texts.en: Tamara was born in 1973.  She lives in the Qubadiyon district together with her husband.  Tamara has a secondary education.  She is involved in breeding cattle.  Tamara breeds cattle for subsequent sale.  She has been in this business for five years.  Tamara is requesting this loan to buy two bulls in order to increase the cattle headcount and make a good profit.  She wants to purchase a car.

loans.use: to buy two bulls

loans.name: Sidémého

texts.fr: Femme d’un mécanicien chauffeur et mère de 02 enfants dont 01 à l’école (03ans et 06 mois), Madame Sidémého est âgée de 29ans.  Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de glaçon, pure water (eau minérale en sachet) et du jus à domicile depuis 1an. Vu que son activité s’améliore de jour en jour et que les clients viennent de part et d’autres pour s’approvisionner chez elle à cause de la qualité de ses produits, elle sollicite l’aide de WAGES par un premier prêt pour stocker des matières premières (sucre, bissap) et de l’eau minérale afin de les satisfaire plus. Son approvisionnement se fait au grand Marché de Lomé. Elle voudrait à l’avenir ouvrir une boutique  et bien entretenir les enfants au coté de son conjoint.
texts.en:
Sidémého is 29 years of age and is married to a mechanic and driver. She has two children, one of whom goes to school (the children are aged 3 and 6 months). To generate income she works selling ice, pure water (bags of mineral water) and juice from home, and has done so for the past year. 

As she saw that her business was improving each day, and as she has new customers recommended by other customers, who get supplies from her because of her quality products, Sidémého has requested her first loan from WAGES. She plans to use this loan to buy stocks of raw materials (sugar and hibiscus flower) and mineral water, to satisfy her customers even more. She gets her supplies in the Grand Market of Lomé. In the future, she would like to open a store, and to better care for her children along with her spouse.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and pure water.

loans.name: Paraiso Nuevo Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento PARAISO NUEVO está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón, la presidenta del  banco es la Sra.  Cristina vive por la localidad de la Guardia,  La Sra. Cristina  se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la misma zona donde vive,  este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Cristina  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para su negocio y  de esta manera brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Cristina va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener un restaurante y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. La Sra. Cristina  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras del grupo ya que en muchos casos son personas que sacan adelante solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The “Paraíso Nuevo” (New Paradise) communal bank has 8 members: seven women and one man.  The bank president is Cristina who lives in La Guardia.  Cristina sells food in a stand located in the same neighborhood where she lives.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Cristina will use the loan to buy tables and chairs for her business thus offering improved comfort to her customers.

Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving her business.  Cristina will use the profits to continue buying supplies to improve her income.  Her business wish is to have a restaurant in order to offer still better customer service.  Cristina is a very hardworking person who feels happy for the opportunity being given to her and to her fellow group members because in many cases they are people raising their families by themselves.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is a 28-year-old woman who is married with three children. She runs a business selling snacks, frozen goods, drinks and many other general goods and products in her community. She has five years of experience with this business. Elena has requested a loan to purchase a box of chicken, sausage, mutton flaps, a box of noodles, toilet papers, snacks, soft drinks, Vailima beer, cigarettes and a box of tinned fish. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and help with her kid's education. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, sausage, mutton flaps, noodles, toilet paper, snacks, soft drinks, Vailima beer, cigarettes and tinned fish

loans.name: Jurabek

texts.ru:
Журабек житель района Кубодиен. Ему 51 год. У него семеро детей. Старший сын Журабека уехал на заработки в Россию. 
Сам Журабек имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Он более 12 лет работает по профессии. Кроме того Журабек зарабатывает путем разведения мелко - рогатого и крупнорогатого скота. Журабек в свободное от работы время разводит скот у себя дома. В этой области он уже шесть лет.
Журабек просит кредит для закупа бычков, телят и коз.
texts.en: Jurabek is a resident of the Qubadiyon district.  He is 51 years old and has seven children.  His oldest son left to work in Russia.  Jurabek has a higher pedagogical education.  He has been working in his field for over 12 years.  Besides this work, Jurabek earns a living by breeding small livestock and cattle.  He breeds livestock at home during his free time from work.  He has been in this business for six years.  Jurabek is requesting this loan to buy bulls, calves and goats.

loans.use: to buy bulls, calves and goats

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru:
Нигина родилась 1972 году в районе Шахритус. Нигина замужем. У нее трое детей. Муж Нигины находится на заработках за рубежом. 
Нигина уже четыре года как арендует не большую торговую точку на рынке. Она занимается торговлей продуктов питания. В торговле ей помогают ее сыновья. 
Нигина просит кредит для закупа всех необходимых продуктов, напитков и хозяйственных товаров с целью увеличения ассортимента товара. Она хочет получить хорошую прибыль и вложить в бизнес в целях расширения своей деятельности.
texts.en: Nigina was born in 1972 in the Shahrituz district.  She is married and has three children.  Her husband is working abroad.  Nigina has been leasing a small retail outlet at a market for four years.  She is involved in selling food products.  Her sons help her with the sales.  Nigina is requesting this loan to buy all of the necessary products, beverages and household goods in order to expand her merchandise selection.  She wants to make a good profit and invest into her business in order to expand it.

loans.use: to purchase cold beverages, sausage, cheese, sugar, butter and household goods

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es:
Don Roberto, reside en el departamento de Masaya, casado, de oficio mecánico, tiene de experiencia en el ramo 18 años, su núcleo familiar conformado por cuatro sus dos hijos aun menores y su esposa. Menciona que el  servicio que ofrece  con respecto a sus ingresos son de contado, por lo que son muy buenos porque por lo general diario llegan a su taller sus diferentes clientes, también cuenta con clientes fijos y que conocen su trabajo y ellos mismo se encargan de darle la propaganda a su negocio, ya que consideran que es un buen servicio. Don Roberto trabaja de lunes a sábados,   y si es necesario los domingos ya que cuenta con el taller que lo tiene ubicado en el mismo lugar donde habita, por eso también sus clientes no se quejan. Aparte que el es una persona amable, y muy responsable en su trabajo.
Se acerca a nuestra oficina Ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento que le permita comprar los siguiente materiales  llantas de bicicletas, llantas de carro, neumáticos para  moto, otros repuestos. el quiere dar siempre un buen servicio que le permita dar lo mejor de el en su trabajo y con la calidad que el cliente  se merece.
texts.en:
Roberto lives in Masaya Department.  He’s married and is a mechanic.  He has 18 years’ experience in his line of work.  His nuclear family is composed of four: his two minor children and his wife.  He mentions that the service he offers to earn money is cash based which makes it very good because generally customers come by his workshop daily.  In addition, he can rely on his regular clientele that know his work and are his best publicity for his business since they deem he provides a good service.  Roberto works Monday through Saturday and if necessary on Sundays too since his shop is located at home which is another reason his customers can’t complain.  In addition to that, he’s a kind person who is very responsible with his work.

He came by the Ceprodel office to request a loan that will make it possible for him to buy spare bicycle parts, auto tires, motorcycle tires and other spare parts.  He always wants to provide good service that in which he gives his best and with the quality his customers deserve.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other supplies.

loans.name: Tito Esau

texts.es:
Tito, esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque necesita invertir en la sastrería y en la venta de desinfectantes, se comprará material de costura como telas, hilos, broches, además de los materiales que son necesarios para la producción de desinfectantes.

Con el préstamo anterior logro realizar una compra de materiales para el negocio, en este periodo se ha comprado una máquina de coser que actualmente utiliza, con esta nueva herramienta es permitido continuar realizando su trabajo y manteniendo la producción de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Tito is asking for a new loan so that he can invest in his tailoring and sales of disinfectant supplies.  He plans to buy sewing materials like fabric, thread, fasteners, and also the raw materials that are necessary for the production of disinfectants.

With his prior loan he was able to buy materials for his business, and during this time he was able to buy a sewing machine that he is currently using.  This new loan will permit him to continue doing his work and keeping up his production of clothes.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, fasteners, and cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Griselda Marisol

texts.es:
Griselda, necesita surtir más la tienda y comprar maíz y leña para la venta de tortillas, para esto ha solicitado un nuevo préstamo que le permite invertir los fondos en la compra de boquitas, granos básicos, leña, maíz, bolsas, entre otros materiales y productos domésticos que son demandados en el negocio, esto le ayudará para tener una mejor solvencia en el negocio y atender mejor también a los clientes.

Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, ya que le permitió mejorar el negocio y hasta el momento se ha mantenido un buen nivel de venta, con su familia su situación también está mejorando, ya que el negocio ha contribuido con mejores ingresos, ella desea a futuro agregar otros rubros en la tienda.
texts.en:
Griselda needs to stock her store more and buy corn and firewood to sell tortillas.  To do this she has requested a new loan that would allow her to invest the funds in snack foods, grains, firewood, corn, bags, and other domestic products in demand at her business.  This will help her to have a better income in the business and better tend to her customers.

The previous loan she received had a positive effect which allowed her to improve the business and maintain a good sales level through the present.  Her family situation is also improving as the  business has contributed higher earnings.  In the future she would like to add other products to the store.

loans.use: to buy snacks, grains, firewood, and corn.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia is married and has a pottery business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. Cynthia has asked for a loan of PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more materials needed for her pottery business. She has been in this business for 38 years now, and also earns additional income from her sari-sari store. In the future, Cynthia would like to expand her business to increase the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials needed for her pottery business.

loans.name: Fortunita

texts.en:
Fortunita is married, with six children. She is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Fortunita is a farmer who grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 16 years, and every month she earns PHP 17,000 from this work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.  She has been a member of GDMPC since 2007. 

In the future, Fortunita hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назира 1960 года рождения замужем имеет 3 детей. Она сотрудничает с нашей организацией с 2011 года. Назира работает в средней школе более 32 лет. Она преподает в начальных классах. Её муж  работает в государственном учреждении.Они оба работают но не могут накопить денег чтобы отремонтировать свою квартиру так как их квартира нуждается в обновлении. Во время отпуска она  планирует провести капитальный ремонт с мужем. В настоящий момент она получила кредит для проведение ремонта дома, тем самым  улучшить условия проживания. Также в дальнейшем планирует сотрудничать с нашей организацией и надеется на дальнейшее сотрудничество и поддержку со стороны "Арванд"
texts.en: Nazira was born in 1960, is married and has three children.  She has been partnering with our organization since 2011.  Nazira has been working at a secondary school for over 32 years.  She teaches elementary school classes.  Her husband works at a municipal organization.  Both of them cannot save enough money to repair their apartment, which needs renovations.  They plan to make major repairs during their vacations.  Currently, Nazira obtained a loan to make housing repairs and improve her living conditions.  Also, she plans to partner with our organization in the future and hopes for a continued partnership and support from "Arvand."

loans.use: to make housing repairs

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maritza, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para poder surtir el negocio el cual lo tienen bien diversificado con plásticos, ropa nueva, gorras, cinchos, y con este préstamo espera comprarse focos, lámparas, carteras, utensilios de cocina,gorras, cinchos, entre otros productos que le aumenten la variedad para poder atender la demanda de sus clientes.

Manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le permitió crear un efecto positivo frente a sus clientes, ya que ha agregado nuevos productos al negocio mejorando cada vez más y creciendo en el mercado, su número de familia se mantiene y sus condiciones económicas han mejorado todo a través del crecimiento del negocio.
texts.en:
Maritza’s decided on a new loan in order to stock her business and keep it well diversified with plastic items, new clothes, caps and belts.  She expects to buy light bulbs, flashlights, wallets, kitchen utensils, caps and belts, among others with this loan in order to increase variety and be able to meet customer demand.

She states that the previous loan made it possible for her to create a positive effect for her customers because she added new items to the business improving each time and growing in the market.  The size of her family has remained constant and her economic conditions have improved through the growth of her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Arnel is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married, with one child. 

Arnel is providing motorela, or motorcycle, transport services. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline that he consumes in his business.

Arnel has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Arnel hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline used in his business.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy  is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Ivy has a small food/retail shop, a "sari-sari" store, that sells canned goods, snacks, personal-care products, home-use products, and beverages. She has had this business for four years. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store. 

Ivy is a new member of HSPFI.   In the future, Ivy hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo specializes in leather bags and accessories. He would like to invest in the purchase of leather and fixtures to expand production.

Arturo has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

Arturo has specialized in hand-tooled leather since 1995. His parents are in the clothing industry, and it was from them that he learned many of the techniques he applies to leather. The father of two children, Arturo gets many design ideas from his wife, Veronica. "My favorite creations are desk accessories, handbags, briefcases and luggage. Over the years, I've been able to form a community of artisans who collaborate with me. Our designs are lovingly crafted by hand, and we feel a personal attachment to what we create," he says.

"Many thanks for your support through this interest-free microcredit. I love to hear from customers how much our design and quality is appreciated, and I look forward to continuing to grow the business."

Use the link below to view Arturo's leather handbags on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=3957

loans.use: to purchase leather and fixtures for his handbags and accessories

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma, 27 years old, is married and has 2 children who are in school. Alma works very hard to provide for them. For the past 5 years, Alma has operated a sari sari store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store. In the future, Alma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is a 57 year old resident of Lilo-an, Bonifacio. She provides her four children's needs from the little amount of 8,000 PHP (Philippine Peso) she gains monthly from her own five year piggery business as an aid to the income gained from her husband.

In 2009 she became a member of GDMPC. Florita applied for a loan at GDMPC micro finance of 10,000 PHP to buy feeding supplies. Florita wants to make an expansion to her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 22 años, el habita en la comunidad villa dolores, su principal actividad es la siembra de Maíz y frijoles, pero además se dedica a la siembra de sandias, el inicio a trabajar desde muy joven con sus padres, aunque además trabajo por un tiempo de obrero en el Ingenio San Antonio y posteriormente se dedico al trabajo de la agricultura para poder independizarce.
Es un hombre con deseos de superación, y de igual forma les inculca a sus hijos que se superen y con su esfuerzo ellos se están preparando profesionalmente
texts.en:
Miguel has been involved in agriculture for the past 22 years.  He lives in the community of Villa Dolores, and his primary activity is the growth of corn and beans, but he also grows watermelons.  He began his work as a young boy with his parents, though he also worked for a time as a day laborer in Ingenio San Antonio and later began working in agriculture in order to become more independent.

He is a man with dreams of success and in this same way he has taught his children to overcome their obstacles and with this strength, they are now preparing to work in professional careers.

loans.use: with agricultural expenses.

loans.name: Marina Isabel

texts.es:
Marina, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en la tienda y al mismo tiempo comprarse materiales para realizar la venta de pupusas, su compra específicamente será en gaseosas, boquitas, jugos, granos básicos, maíz, leña, aceite, bolsas.
Con la compra espera crear un negocio más productivo, ya que con la inversión anterior logró mejorar la rentabilidad en el negocio y aumentar la mercadería, ella ha ido agregando otros rubros al negocio buscando la manera de mejorar, hasta el momento han logrado instalar un nuevo negocio cerca de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marina’s asking for a new loan to invest in her store and at the same time buy ingredients she needs to make pupusas [grilled, filled corncakes].  Specifically, she’ll buy soft-drinks, snacks, juices, basic grains, corn, firewood, oil and bags.

With this purchase she will create a more productive business because with the previous investment she attained better profitability in the business and increased merchandise.  She’s been adding other lines of work to the business looking for ways of improving.  To date, she’s managed to open a new business near her home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, firewood and bags.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Gladys works hard to support her family. She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from an internet cafe.  Gladys is borrowing 15000 PHP (Philippine Peso)  through NWTF to buy more blouses, pants, and other ready-to-wear clothing. 

Gladys has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more blouses, pants, and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Blanca Daisy

texts.es:
Doña Blanca tiene 49 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos y vive en la Ciudad de Puerto Cortes.
Doña Blanca ejerce una actividad  tiene un taller de Ebanistería, donde elabora  diferente tipos de muebles de madera. Este negocio ha sido su fuente de ingresos desde hace 13 años. Manifiesta que poco a poco se fue haciendo de su propia clientela, el negocio ha sido rentable para ella y sus familia le ha generado buenas ganancias. Y con la ayuda de los préstamos que ha recibido de Odef lo ha mantenido estable.
Actualmente esta solicitando su noveno préstamo de 21000 lempiras para compra de materia prima para  elaborar los muebles y así seguir ofreciendo variedad.
Su meta es que su negocio siga creciendo y así en el futuro llegar a tener mejor solvencia económica.
texts.en:
Blanca, 49, is married and has two children; she lives in the city of Puerto Cortes.  Her business is a carpentry shop where she manufactures various types of wood furniture.  This business has been her source of income for the last 13 years.  She states that she gradually attained her own clientele and the business has been profitable for her and her family; it’s generated good profits.  With the help of loans she’s gotten from ODEF, she’s kept it stable.

She is currently asking for her 9th loan for 21,000 lempiras to buy raw materials to make the furniture and to continue offering variety.  Her business goal is to continue growing in order to attain economic solvency in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Lorelyn

texts.en:
Lorelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell for her rice retail business. Lorelyn has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from clothing sales.

Lorelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a paper sales business in the Philippines.

Johna requested a 19000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more school supplies to sell. She has been in this business for five years now and also earns additional income from frozen foods.

In the future, Johna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines. Evelyn has been in this business for 30 years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

Evelyn requested a 12000 PHP (Philippine Peso) loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Roseta

texts.en: Roseta is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 8 children. For the past 20 years, Roseta  has operated a food/retail shop (sari-sari), buying and selling canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Roseta  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en: Ginalyn, 28 years old, is married and has 1 child. She works hard to provide for her family. Ginalyn has operated a general store in the Philippines for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari sari store. Ginalyn has already borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa, 61 years old, is married and has 3 children. She is in the agricultural business and has been raising pigs in the Philippines for 8 years. Elisa has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for the pigs. She has previously taken out 8 loans from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Elisa would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for the pigs.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es una mujer de 51 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, con sus 2 hijas y sus nietos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que ha dedicado todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a sus hijas, lastimosamente por diversas razones desde hace muchos años se separó de esposo, desde entonces ella ha sido padre y madre para sus hijas; en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar con sus nietos y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos deliciosos postres para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, desde hace 4 años Yolanda puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, día a día desde tempranas horas de la mañana asiste a su puesto en un mercado de su ciudad a realizar su labor, ella se siente a gusto con su negocio y cree que le va bien ya que sus clientes la recomiendan por sus buenos productos, precio y trato amable. 
Yolanda se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como: camisas, polos, casacas, pantalones, buzos, entre otras prendas de vestir; de esta manera Yolanda contará con su negocio mejor abastecido, con ello espera poder aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales desea poder utilizar para terminar de construir su vivienda y apoyar en la educación y bienestar de sus nietos.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a 51 year old woman living in the city of Ica with her two daughters and her grandchildren .  She is a very nice, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has dedicated herself to helping her children get ahead with all her strength.  Sadly, and for a variety of reasons, she separated from her husband many years ago, and since then she has been both father and mother to her daughters.  In her free time, she loves to play with her grandchildren and at times she likes to make delicious desserts to share with her family.

By her own initiative, 4 years ago, Yolanda began her own business in clothing sales.  Every day from the early hours of the morning, she is at her place in the market of her city doing her work.  She feels happy with her business and thinks that it's going well with her customers, who recommend her because of the good products, prices, and kind service.

Yolanda feels very thankful to the lenders at Kiva, since thanks to the help they have given her, she will be able to buy new merchandise like shirts, polos, jackets, pants, sweaters, and other clothing items.  In this way, Yolanda will keep her shop fully stocked, with which improvement she hopes to increase her sales and grow her income.  She hopes to use her income to finish the construction of her house and help with the education expenses and support the education of her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like shirts, polos, jackets, pants, sweaters, etc.

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es:
Roberto, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder invertir en su negocio con productos de temporada, se comprará un pedido de cocos, mariscos variados en pescado, conchas y camarones, también se comprará ropa blusas, ropa interior, y también ropa para baño, su intención con el negocio es mantener un nivel de mercadería adecuado para que sus clientes se mantengan.

El efecto que tuvo un préstamo anterior fue positivo, ya que le ha mejorado sus ventas y sus clientes han mantenido la preferencia atendiendo la demanda, las mejoras en el negocio le han dado la oportunidad de comprar bienes para lograr y también hacerle unas reparaciones al vehículo.
texts.en: Roberto is requesting a new loan to buy seasonal products for his business: an order of coconuts and a variety of seafood, shellfish, and shrimp. He will also buy blouses, underwear, and swimwear so that he can stock enough merchandise to service his customers. The prior loan was successful in that he was able to increase sales and meet the demands of his customers. Stronger business has given the opportunity to buy parts to make some repairs to his vehicle.

loans.use: to buy coconuts, a variety of seafood, shellfish, and shrimp.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es: La Señorita María tiene 23 años y es soltera ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de ropa y edredones, sabanas y electrodomésticos en su puesto  que se encuentran en la zona de San Antonio este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  La Srta. María va a usar este préstamo para la compra de variedad de electrodomésticos para surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que le hicieron algunos pedidos y no contaba con el capital necesario para de sus productos, María enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y la alta demanda por la época y va a utilizar los beneficios en aumentar su mercadería y por ende sus ventas.
texts.en:
María’s 23-years-old, single and sells clothes, comforters, sheets and electric appliances in her stand located in the San Antonio zone.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution.

María will use the loan to buy a variety of electric appliances to stock her business.  The reason for requesting the loan is that she got some orders but she did not have the necessary capital to get the products.  María’s business challenge is competition and high seasonal demand so she will use profits to increase her merchandise and thus her sales.

loans.use: to buy home appliances.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Socorro is 56 years old and married, with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Socorro is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Socorro has been raising pigs for nine years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jezza Lynda

texts.en:
Jezza Lynda works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a business making and selling juice in the Philippines.

Jezza Lynda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her juice and paraphernalia for packing.

She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Jezza Lynda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her juice and paraphernalia for packing.

loans.name: Vilma Elizabeth

texts.es:
Vilma, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder realizar una nueva inversión al negocio, se comprará utensilios plásticos y también utensilios de loza o barro como ollas, sartenes, que son los que ofrece su clientela, esto le permitirá mantener surtido el negocio para atender la demanda.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue positivo, ayudándole fortalecer el negocio con los cuales ha logrado mejorar sus ganancias, ayudando mejor a su familia, sus condiciones familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Vilma is asking for a new loan to reinvest in her business.  She will buy plastic utensils and also kitchen utensils made of china and pottery, like pots, skillets, and those which she wants to sell to her customers.  This will allow her to keep her business well-stocked to keep up with demand.

The effect of her prior loan was positive, helping her to strengthen her business with which she has been able to make greater profits, helping her family to do better and improving their economic condition.

loans.use: to buy plastic products and pots, and pottery pans.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 45 years old and married, with seven children.  Five of her children are in school.  She and her family live in the Philippines.

Josephine is in the agricultural business of raising pigs.  She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and medicines for her pigs.

Josephine has been raising pigs for ten years now.  She has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her pigs.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en las mejoras para la vivienda, él con su familia se han trasladado a una nueva vivienda, por eso volvera a construirle a su esposa el rancho al interior de la vivienda,se comprara láminas, clavos, alambre, madera, que son materiales para poder realizar el trabajo, ya que es una necesidad de su esposa para realizar la venta, esto le ayudará dando los recursos necesarios para que el pueda cumplir con este objetivo.

El préstamo anterior le ayudó a mejorar el lugar donde anteriormente su esposa vendia tortillas, ademas se ha comprado unos bienes para el hogar, su aspiración es mejorar su empleo para aumentar su salario, ya que esto le dará una mejor solvencia para poder cubrir todas las necesidades de la familia.
texts.en:
Juan is requesting a new loan to make improvements to his home. He and his family have moved to a new house, and he is building out the interior of the house for his wife. He will buy sheet metal, nails, wire, and wood, which are the materials he needs to create the space his wife needs to sell her products. The loan will give him the resources necessary to meet this goal.

The prior loan allowed him to upgrade the space where his wife sold tortillas and buy some household items. His goal is to have better work so that he can earn more and have money on hand to meet the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, nails, wire, and wood.

loans.name: Neojali

texts.es:
Neojalí  tiene 51 años de edad, es padre de familia, él y sus dos hijos trabajan la tierra, son  agricultores desde hace muchos años,  vive en una comunidad  situada en  la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas, llamada La Danta.  La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.
El está solicitando un préstamo de un millón treinta y cinco mil colones (¢1.035.000) para la compra de árboles pequeños de rambután , esta es una fruta de agradable sabor y de mucha aceptación en el país, además debe comprar un sistema de irrigación para atender la siembra, necesita también  abono y fungicidas para proteger sus cultivos durante el proceso de producción . 
El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal denla Danta S.A, una de las 110 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica .
texts.en:
Neojalí is 51 years old, the father of a family, and he and his two sons work the land and have been agricultural laborers for many years.  He lives in a community situated in the South of Costa Rica in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas, called La Danta.  The local economy is based on agricultural activities where the principal production is tubers, coffee, corn, beans, and small animal production.

He is asking for a loan of one million thirty five thousand Colones (¢1.035.000) to buy sapling lychee trees.  This is a small fruit with an agreeable flavor which is very popular in this country.  He also wants to buy an irrigation system to help with the planted trees, and he will also need fertilizers and fungicides to protect his plants during the production process.

He is a member of the Community Loan Group of Denla Danta S.A, one of 110 community loan groups in Costa Rica .

loans.use: to buy lychee trees, fertilizer, and irrigation equipment.

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn is married and has two children. She is 52 years old and resides at Bonifacio. 

Charlyn owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting corn for sale to earn a living. She has been 14 years in this business. Each month, she earns PHP 18,000 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. 

In 2010, Charlyn joined GDMPC. She wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: El Marjon

texts.en: El Marjon lives in Tugas, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. He has earned a living by providing transportation services for seven years to support the needs of his two children. He gets an income of 15,000 PHP a month from this business. For a 25-year-old father, there’s nothing more that can make him happy than to see his children successful in their studies. Without hesitation, El Marjon is borrowing 17,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories and provide his children a better education. He joined GDMPC in 2011. His plan in the future is to hopefully improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Ernesa

texts.en:
This is Ernesa, 26, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Reniel, her business partner, and she is a mother to her two children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Ernesa operates a food stall where she sells mami.  Mami is a noodle soup, which refers to a variety of soups with noodles and other ingredients served in a light broth. This is served in the morning and for snacks. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a  PHP 10,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of products like noodles, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Ernesa dreams of having her own house and giving all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products

loans.name: Rosa Ines

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 37 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona  con sus 2 pequeños hijos, lastimosamente por diversas razones desde hace varios años se separó de su pareja; ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; ella ha trabajado desde muy joven para apoyar a sus padres y para poder solventar sus gastos, por tal motivo no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar la carrera de Enfermería, en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones cuando visita a sus padres cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, día a día Rosa trabaja brindando servicios de limpieza en una empresa de su ciudad, ella trabaja un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y se siente a gusto realizando su labor, ya que sus jefes la consideran mucho por su buen desempeño y por su trato amable hacia los demás.
Rosa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como: polos, chompas, casacas, pantalones y entre otras prendas de vestir; de esta manera Rosa podrá contar con la mercadería necesaria para iniciar su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, ya que de esta manera podrá conseguir ingresos económicos, los cuales desea utilizar para poder asegurar la educación y bienestar de sus pequeños hijos, ya que su gran sueño es verlos convertidos en grandes profesionales y en hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 37 year old woman. She lives in the city of Ica in the district of Parcona, with her 2 small sons. Unfortunately due to several reasons she separated from her partner several years ago. She is a very friendly, hard working and enthusiastic person who dedicated all her strength to moving her family forward. She has worked since she was very young to support her parents and be able to cover her expenses. Because of this, she could not study for a professional degree but has liked being able to study nursing. In her free time she lives to spend a little time reading and sometimes when she visits her parents she cooks the delicious dish "arroz con pollo" (rice with chicken) to share with her family. 

By her own initiative, Rosa works everyday providing cleaning services with a business in her city. She works about 10 hours daily and feels happy to do her work because her bosses hold her in high regard for her work performance and friendly manner to others. 

Rosa is very thankful for the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help provided, she will be able to buy merchandise including polo t shirts, sweaters, jackets and pants, among other articles of clothing. In this way Rosa will be able to have the necessary merchandise to begin her small clothing business and be able to receive income. She hopes to use this money to secure the education and well being of her small children. Her largest dream is to see them become great professionals and good men.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as polo shirts, sweaters, jackets, pants, etc.

loans.name: Juan Gilberto

texts.es:
Juan, solicita un nuevo préstamo porque necesita invertir en el negocio, ya que la actividad agrícola está por iniciar, el quiere la siembra de granos básicos, para esto invertirá una parte del préstamo en abono y herbicidas, la otra parte la invertirá en la compra de pescado y camarones para continuar con sus ventas, este préstamo servirá para que continúe en su trabajo y al mismo tiempo puede realizar la siembra de maíz, Juan busca aquellas actividades de las cuales pueda obtener dinero, aunque implique cambiar de negocio cada cierto tiempo.

El préstamo anterior le ayudo a generar más confianza a sus clientes y le permitió atraer a nuevos, incluyendo zonas donde no tenía acceso, esto le ha permitido crecer y al mismo tiempo generar una mejor condición más estable a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is requesting a new loan because he needs to invest in his business, since he is about to begin farming. He wants to sow basic grains, so he will invest part of the loan in fertilizer and herbicides. He will invest the rest in purchasing fish and shrimp to continue selling them. This loan will allow him to continue with his work and grow corn at the same time. Juan looks for any work where he can make money, even if it means changing businesses every so often.

The previous loan helped him gain trust with his customers and allowed him to attract new ones, including areas to where he had no acces. This has allowed him to grow and, at the same time, to provide his family with greater stability.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and herbicides, fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.en:
Carlota works hard to support her family. She is married and has a computer rental business in the Philippines. Carlota has asked for a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy an additional unit and more computer supplies. She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Carlota would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional unit and more computer supplies.

loans.name: Gaudencio

texts.en: Gaudencio, 45 years old, is a married entrepreneur from Bolinsong, Bonifacio with five children. He is earning an income from his rice production business. It has been in operation for almost eight years now and he earn 3,000 PHP a month. To improve his business, Gaudencio is borrowing 2,800 PHP from GDMPC micro credit, which he just joined recently, to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Before long, he’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: Luz is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Luz has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home-use products and beverages. She had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to increase her stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Luz has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Luz hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to increase her stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Gilber

texts.es:
Gilber es un joven  agricultor   de  25 años de edad , soltero, vive con sus padres en la zona sur del país, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas en la provincia de Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.
El está solicitando un préstamo de ochocientos cincuenta mil colones (¢850.000) para la compra de semilla de maíz,  abono granular y fungicidas para proteger sus cultivos durante el desarrollo y evitar también que aparezcan hongos en sus plantaciones, El vende la cosecha en una asociación de la localidad y de esta manera ayuda a sus padres, cubre los gastos de sus estudios  y hace frente a otras obligaciones económicas, desea llegar a ser un productor grande y prosperar y tener mayores ingresos y comodidades para él y su familia y para ello hace el mayor de sus esfuerzos en la actividad agrícola 
Gilber es  socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal denla Danta S.A, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Gilber is a young agricultural worker of 25 years of age, single, and lives with her parents in the Southern region of the country, located in Concepción de Pilas in the province of Puntarenas. The local economy is based on farming and agriculture, where there is planting of root vegetables, coffee, corn, beans, and small animal raising.

He is asking for a loan of eight hundred and fifty thousand Colones (¢850,000) to buy corn for seed, solid fertilizers, and fungicides to protect his plants during their development and avoid the appearance of mushrooms or fungus in his fields.  He sells the harvested crops in an association in his locale and in this way he helps his parents, covers the costs of his studies, and makes headway in his other economic obligations.  He wants to become a large scale producer and prosper and have a greater income for himself and his family and for this he needs to make his strongest effort toward his agricultural activities.

Gilber is a member of the community banking group Denla Danta S.A, one of the 150 community credit banking groups in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy grain fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, and a day laborer to plant the corn.

loans.name: Maria Higinia

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para realizar la compra de materiales para la producción de tortillas, obteniendo los productos como la leña y el maíz a un precio más cómodo, ya que realizara una compra por mayor, esto le permitirá tener a la mano lo necesario continuar realizando las ventas.

Con el préstamo anterior logró mejorar la disponibilidad en el negocio, ya que realizó una buena compra y de sus ganancias ha logrado mantenerse en este tiempo reinvirtiendo en el negocio, su familia cuenta con una condicion mas favorable.
texts.en:
María is requesting a new loan in order to purchase materials to make tortillas. This will allow her to obtain products such as firewood and corn at  affordable prices, since she will purchase wholesale, and everything she needs to make her sales will be at hand. 

With the previous loan she managed to improve her business' liquidity, because she made a good purchase and has been able to support herself with the profit during this time. She has reinvested in the business and her family is now in a more favorable situation.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and corn.

loans.name: José Miguel

texts.es:
José Miguel es un señor  de 45 años de edad,  es ganadero vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos pequeños  en una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería, y otros productos.
José Miguel tiene esta actividad ganadera como la única fuente de ingreso para mantener a su familia.
El necesita un préstamo por  ochocientos cincuenta mil colones (¢850.000) para comprar ganado de engorde y revenderlo en las ferias ganaderas  trimestrales locales.
Con este préstamo él piensa preparase con más cabezas de ganado para la próxima venta que ya se avecina, José Miguel es socio de la  Empresa de Crédito Comunal de La Danta S.A.  y manifiesta estar muy agradecido porque este es un medio de adquirir financiamiento de acceso rápido y a plazos aceptables para gente trabajadora y que desea superarse.
texts.en:
José Miguel is a 45 year old man, a rancher who lives with his partner and two small children in a community in the southern region of Costa Rica.  He is located in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas.  The local economy is based on agricultural activities  among which are the growth of tubers, coffee, corn, beans, and small animals and other products.

José Miguel works as a cattle rancher, and it is his only means of supporting his family.

He needs a loan of eight hundred and fifty thousand Colons (¢850,000) to buy cattle to fatten and resell them at the cattle fairs which happen three times a year in his area.

With this loan, he thinks he will be well prepared with more head of cattle for the next cattle sale that is coming up.  José Miguel is a member of the community credit group of La Danta S.A.  and he says he is very thankful because this is a way of acquiring financing quickly and at good rates for working people who want to be successful.

loans.use: to buy cattle to fatten.

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Constancia has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for eight years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. 

Constancia has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.es:
