Ruth vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja de forma independiente, su madre y su hijo de 23 años de edad quien se encuentra  trabajando. Sus sueños son tener un local establecido donde pueda atender a su clientela y agregar la venta otras provisiones.
Ella está muy contenta  y agradecida de  la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que el crédito le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Además se siente cómoda con el grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, lo cual la motiva a seguir participando en la institución. Comenta además que las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones le han servido para invertir mejor en su negocio.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
This communal bank named “ Inversión ” [Investment] comprises 20 entrepreneurs of various professions including: dressmaking; selling food, eggs, chicken, kites, and bread dough; and other services. All the members live in the city of Valparaíso.

Ruth is the communal bank member in the photo seated in the first seat from left to right of the first row, wearing a red jacket, black pants, and brown boots and wearing her brown hair down. She has been selling clothing for a year. She says she works alone from Monday to Friday on a schedule subject to her availability. She displays her merchandise in a daycare, where her clientele is steady. She usually buys the merchandise in Santiago at a discount so that her business is profitable. She will use the loan to buy winter clothing for women, men, children, and infants. Her goals are to keep growing her business and increasing her earnings so that she can offer her family and herself a better life.

Ruth lives with her husband, who is self-employed, her mother, and her 23-year-old son, who is working. She dreams of having an established store where she can serve her customers and stock other merchandise. She is happy and grateful for the opportunity offered through Fondo Esperanza, as the loan allows her to invest in her business. She is comfortable with her communal bank and, therefore, wants to continue participating in the institution. She says that the group's training and meetings have led her to better investing. 

Valparaíso is 120 kilometers northeast of Santiago. It is the regional capital, the seat of the country's legislature, and its main port. There are also numerous beautiful, picturesque places such as the home of Nobel Prize winner Pablo Neruda.

loans.use: Comprará ropa para damas, varón, niños y bebes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase kiosk products, such as coffee, tea, instant noodles, cigarettes, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia, 45 years old, has five sons and two daughters, all of whom contribute financially to the family through their jobs. Razia supports her husband by helping him make paper envelopes to fill the orders for them that he receives from various grocery and general stores in the market.

Razia is requesting a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further expansion of her family business. With the loan, her husband will buy paper and gum in bulk that will allow him and Razia to complete their orders on time and increase their income.

Note: In the photo the lady raising her hand is Razia.

loans.use: to buy paper for paper envelope business.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Mariée à un staffeur, mère de 02 enfants (7 et 4ans) tous sur les bancs de l’école, Madame Akou est une jeune dame âgée de 31ans. Pour contribuer au besoin du ménage au coté de son mari, elle fait du yaourt depuis 02ans et les revend à domicile et de façon ambulante à ses clients. A son absence, son conjoint l’aide à servir les clients. Sa difficulté est l’insuffisance d’appareils frigorifiques c’est pour cela elle sollicite de WAGES ce premier crédit pour en acheter un. Elle veut augmenter son chiffre d’affaire, ouvrir plus tard une crémerie et construire une maison.
texts.en:
Married to a plasterer, Ms. Akou is the mother of two children (4 and 7 years old), who are both in school. She is a young woman of 31. To help cover household needs along with her husband, she has been making yoghurt for two years and sells it at her home and door to door. In her absence, her spouse helps her serve the customers. 

Her difficulty is the inadequate refrigerator. This is why she is requesting this initial WAGES loan to buy one. She wants to increase her sales, open a creamery later, and build a house.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El Comite Kuña Aty está ubicado en Chaco, estan en el primer ciclo, y están trabajando y aprendiendo a hacer trabajos en equipo y a ser solidarias las unas con las otras.
La Sra. Sonia se dedica a la venta de ropas cosmeticos etc, y cuenta que con gran esfuerzo y sacrificio está saliendo adelante y ayudando a los suyos, para que cada día vaya mejorando las condiciones de su familia y tengan una vida digna.
La Sra. Sonia solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas y también de cosméticos, para que de esa forma pueda seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Kuña Aty communal bank is located in Chaco.  They are in their first cycle, and they are working and learning to work as a team and to be supportive of each other.

Sonia sells clothes and cosmetics, etc.  She says that with great effort and sacrifice she is getting ahead and helping her loved ones.  She does this so that her family’s living conditions improve every day and so that they have a decent life.

Sonia is requesting the loan to buy clothes and cosmetics.  This way she will be able to continue working and meeting her customers’ demand.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina de 28 años de edad,  se dedica a la comercialización de prendas de vestir exterior e interior, artículos que una amiga le envía desde los Estados Unidos y ella vende a crédito, para recuperar la inversión en plazos pactados con su clientela. Su negocio lo realiza desde hace 4 años a clientes especiales que les gusta vestir con prendas traídas de ese país. Con su negocio genera ingresos que aportan al bienestar personal y de su hogar, conformado por su esposo   y sus dos  hijos de 2 y 9 años. Paulina  de origen Ecuatoriano y está casada con un médico Colombiano, también comercializa víveres, a otra clientela ubicada alrededor de su vivienda,  como leche en polvo, aceite, azúcar, que le envían  desde otro municipio del país, de  donde es oriundo su esposo. Su meta es tener un gran almacén de ropa y finalmente terminar de construir su casa con el producto del trabajo de ella y su esposo. Su negocio aunque es pequeño, tiene un buen potencial de crecimiento y ella cuenta con una capacidad de trabajo inigualable, heredada de su madre quien es también comerciante en el vecino país de Ecuador. En la actualidad su mayor desafío es tener un capital de efectivo, para comprar en mayor volumen  y ganar cada vez más descuentos, por eso ha recurrido a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará, blusas, pantalones, calzado y víveres. Con su credikiva aumentará su capital de trabajo y así mismo su volumen  de ventas, lo que hace que este sea una inversión exitosa y que la mantenga activa en el mercado.
texts.en:
Paulina, age 28, sells clothes and underwear.  A friend sends her the items from the United States, and Paulina sells them on credit in order to recuperate her investment in payments that are agreed upon by her customers.

She has been in this business for four years, and her customers especially like wearing clothes from the United States.  With this business she generates income that contributes to her personal well-being and that of her household.  Her household is comprised of her husband and their two children, ages two and nine.

Paulina is from Ecuador, and she is married to a Colombian doctor.  She also sells provisions to other customers located around her home.  She sells things like powdered milk, cooking oil, and sugar.  These things are sent to her from another municipality in the country that her husband is from.

Her goal is to have a large clothing store, and to finally finish building her house as a result of her and her husband’s work.  Even though her business is small, it has good growth potential, and she has an unparalleled capacity for work.  She inherited this from her mother, who is also a merchant in the neighboring country of Ecuador.

Her biggest challenge now is to have cash in order to buy in bulk and to get more discounts.  That is why she has turned to a Kiva loan, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy blouses, pants, shoes, and supplies.  With her Kiva loan she will increase her working capital and her volume of sales.  That will make this a successful investment that will keep her active in the market.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, shoes, and supplies.

loans.name: Rudolof

texts.en:
Rudolof is a 51-year-old, married man. He has four children between the ages of 15 and 21.  One of his children works and the other three children are students.  Rudolof supports his family needs by selling crops, such as corn, rice, beans, and soybeans, at the local market. In addition, he sells animal feed to generate more income. Rudolof is required to meet his customers’ increasing demands for the products he sells.  

Rudolof requested an IDR 4,500,000 loan from Kiva partner Tanaoba Lais Manekat Foundation (TLM) to meet his customers’ demands. He will use the loan to buy two tons of corn, one ton of chaff and animal food. Rudolof hopes that the business will grow and bring more benefits for his family.

loans.use: to buy corn, chaff and animal feed to sell

loans.name: Wellars

texts.en:
Wellars is 31 years old and married with a two-year-old child. He sells various goods including, avocados, lotion, biscuits, sugar, juice, and soap. Wellars has three years of experience in this work and employs one person to help him. He works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day except during the weekend.

Wellars has requested a loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company to buy various goods for resale. With any profits he earns, he will be able to save money for his future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy various goods for resale.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 37 years old and has five children, all of whom attend school. She makes beer from bananas but wants to start selling bananas.

Clementine is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more bananas to sell. With the profits from her business, she wants to save more money.

loans.use: to purchase bananas.

loans.name: Futuro Para Todos Group

texts.es:
Esta Banco Comunal se llama “Futuro para Todos” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de ropa nueva y usada, restaurant, pastelería, venta de leña, zapatero, servicios entre otros. Todos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Angol.
Ruth delegada del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste un chaquetón a cuadros de color café oscuro y claro, encima lleva puesto una bufanda de color blanca una cartera de color negra, su cabello es castaño oscuro y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la estética, desde hace 6 meses. Comenta que trabaja en su casa y otras veces se dirige a los domicilios de su clientela, trabaja por horas y su horario lo distribuye según su disponibilidad, ya que tiene niños pequeños.
Su mercadería la compra en una distribuidora que se especializa en vender productos de estética.
Con el crédito comprará cremas y loción para masajes y yeso para reducir y reafirmar.
Una de las metas de Ruth en su negocio, son tener la oportunidad de abrir un local como centro de estética, en el cual pueda atender a sus clientes.
Ruth vive junto a su padre, hermana y 2 hijos de 12 años de edad y de 6 meses de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral y familiar son crecer como persona y darle un buen pasa a su familia y logra tener su casa propia para vivir con su familia que son sus hijos.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal que forma parte se siente muy cómoda ya que existe respeto y unidad.
Angol se ubica a 128 km. al noroeste de Temuco (capital de la novena región) y a 608 km. al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). Su nombre significa en mapudungun (lengua del pueblo mapuche) “subida a gatas”. Sus habitantes se dedican fuertemente a labores agrícolas y silvo agropecuarias, áreas en las que actualmente han adquirido relevancia, particularmente, aquellas vinculadas a la producción frutícola y hortícola.
texts.en:
The name of this communal bank is Futuro Para Todos. It comprises eighteen entrepreneurs who work in different businesses, such as selling new and used clothing, a restaurant, a bakery, selling firewood, shoemaking, and other services. They all belong to the city of Angol.

Ruth is group delegate for the communal bank. In the picture, she is the second person from the left, sitting in the front row and wearing a plad coat in brown tones and a white scarf. She is carrying a black purse, has dark brown hair, and is wearing it down.

She has been in the esthetics business for six months. She says she works from home and other times she goes to her customers' homes. She works by the hour and organizes her schedule according to her availability, since she has small children. She buys her merchandise from a distributor specializing in beauty supplies. She will use the loan to buy creams, massage lotion, and slimming and toning plaster. One of Ruth's business goals is to have the opportunity of opening a beauty salon where she could serve her customers. 

Ruth lives with her father, her sister, and her two children. One is twelve years old and the other is six months old. Her dream, on a business as well as a family level, is to grow as a person and provide means for her family, and to have her own home so that she can live with her family, who are her children.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza, because it will allow her to invest in her business. She says the trainings have been vital for her business and also for her personal development, because she has learned how to better organize and distribute her income and investments. Regarding her communal bank, she is very comfortable being a part of it because there is respect and unity. 

Angol is located 80 miles northeast of Temuco, which is the capital of the ninth region, and 378 miles south of Santiago, Chile's capital. The name means "upward crawl" in mapudungun, which is the language of the mapuche people. Its residents work hard in agriculture and forestry, which are sectors that have currently gained relevance, particularly regarding the production of fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase creams, massage lotion, and slimming and toning plaster.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 49 years old and married to Rose.  They are blessed with one child who is 14 years old child. Peter sells building materials in a business he started four years ago and earns 64,000 KES per month. 

He has requested his first loan of 30,000 KES to purchase more bricks, iron sheets, glass, timber, and sand for sale. The profit he earns will help with pay his child's school fees. Peter's dream is to practice farming and give his child a good education.

loans.use: To purchase more bricks, iron sheets, glass, timber, and sand for sale

loans.name: Bekmurod

texts.en:
Bekmurod is a careful father and a loving husband. He has a beautiful wife and three clever children. For more than five years, he has served as a local taxi driver, using his own car. Bekmurod has a lot of customers and a successful business because he is very industrious and hardworking. He is the only family member who earns a living. 

Bekmurod is requesting a loan to buy building materials to repair his house, which is currently in bad condition.  He and his children await your support. Please, help them to repair their house.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair his family house

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 30-year-old, married woman. She has three children between the ages of 6 and 13 years old. Beatrice describes herself as a determined woman. She operates a restaurant selling food, tea, and snacks. Beatrice has been involved in this business for six years and employs one staff member. Her business is located in a market and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition. 

Beatrice will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more ingredients for preparing meals for sale. Her business goal is to expand her business into a bigger restaurant within 5 years. She hopes to have improved her restaurant business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare meals for sale.

loans.name: Absalom

texts.en:
Absalom is 35 years old, married and a business man in Mombasa, Kenya. He sells clothes through a business that he has been involved in for the past twelve years with great success.

Absalom is requesting his second business loan from Kiva partner Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) to finance his business. He plans to purchase more shirts, skirts, trousers, and tee shirts for sale. Absalom will use the anticipated profits to purchase more stock and repay his loan. He hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en: Julienne is 55 years old. She is a widow with three children, all of whom go to school.  Julienne requests the loan to buy more clothes to sell. With the profits from the business, she will pay her children’s school fees. Juilenne’s first loan with Kiva helped her to boost her business and she has managed to enroll all of the children in school.

loans.use: to purchase traditional cloth called bitenge to sell

loans.name: Ret's Group

texts.en:
Ret is a 49-year-old mother of three children.  Her children live with her n Tbaung Khmum District of Kompong Cham Province and help with the family's business. Ret grows beans on two hectares of farmland as her main source of income. She also works for others for pay to earn additional income for her family. Ret has been in both businesses for several years and can earn about 23,000 KHR per day. 

Ret received her first loan from Kiva partner VisionFund in 2011 and has completely repaid the loan. She has managed to use the loan successfully to support her family. Ret confidently leads a group of three to seek a new loan.  The other group members have joined VisionFund for one funding cycle.  Ret is requesting a new loan for 1,200,000 KHR, while the other two members are applying for 1,000,000 KHR each. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. Ret hopes to grow her beans well so that she can earn more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a 49-year-old charcoal dealer in Utange Mombasa. She is a married mother of three. She buys and sells charcoal to the residents of Utange, a business she has done for the past five years. She is doing great.

This is her fifth borrowing from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more sacks of charcoal with the loan. 

She will use the proceeds to educate her children and repay her loan. She hopes to have a more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Senglong

texts.en:
Senglong is a 35-year-old mother of two dependent children. She is originally from the Dambae district of Kompong Cham province, in which rice farming is a common business as the main source of income for the villagers as well as Senglong. 

For her children's sake, she grows cassava on two and a half hectares and plants paddy rice on two hectares of farmland. It is the business that she has been with for seven years and earns her about 35,800 KHR per day. 

This is the second loan for Senglong. She has used her first loan successfully in maintaining her household and her business. She is now requesting a new loan in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR. She will use her loan to pay for weeding fees for her cassava field and some portion of it to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to pay for weeding fees and buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
La Sra. Elva es comerciante se dedica a la compra y venta de productos traído de la Argentina, está casada y dos hijos todos ya adolecentes que ayudan en el negocio y también estudian.
 Es una persona muy trabajadora, y cuenta que tiene su despensa hace más de 10 años. Cuenta que por medio del arduo trabajo ha podido dar a sus hijos todo lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones ni limitaciones como las que ellas tuvo que pasar.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, gaseosas, comestibles y demás insumos, para que de esa forma pueda seguir creciendo y el día de mañana sea una gran microempresaria.
texts.en:
Elva buys and sells products brought from Argentina.  She is married and has two children.  They are adolescents that help in the business, and they go to school.

She is a very hard-working person.  She has had a grocery store for over ten years.  Through her hard work she has been able to give her children everything they need to have a life without the deprivations or limitations that she had to experience.

She is requesting the loan to buy drinks, sodas, food, and other supplies.  This way she will be able to continue growing, and soon she will be a great small businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy drinks, sodas, food, and other supplies.

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.en:
Umedjon is married and has two small children.  He is gentle and laborious.  Umedjon likes to work very hard and tries to do the best for his family. He has had his own business for more than 14 years, selling vegetables like onions, carrots, potatoes, and cabbage.  His wife doesn’t work outside of the home, so Umedjon manages his business alone. 

Umedjon has a lot of customers and wants to develop his business further.  He is requesting a loan to buy goods for the new season. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy vegetable goods to sell in the new season

loans.name: M'ringera

texts.en:
M’ringera is a farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya where he lives with his wife his children, who are already adults. 

He has been in farming for thirty years and currently produces mainly cereals like maize and sorghum, and vegetables for the local market. He also runs a cereals retail business in the local market.

M’ringera has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds. He says the venture into the poultry business will help improve his living standards. He is optimistic he will earn more income to purchase more land as well.

He mentions poor climate and undeveloped local markets as the main challenges in the farming business.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 48 years old, married to Said, and blessed with five children aged 18, 17, 12, 9, and 3 years respectively. 

She is a wholesaler who sells fruits at Eldoret main market. She ventured into this business 20 years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

She wants to purchase more fruits and has requested a first loan of KES 30,000. The profit she makes from her business will aid her in buying additional stock. She dreams of owning a large electronic shop in town.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits for sale.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 47 years old. She has six children and all go to school. 

She sells local beer made out of sorghum. She has been selling these products for eighteen years. With the loan, she wants to buy more sorghum to make more local beer and she wants to add a new item of selling beans with this new loan. 

The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to purchase more sorghum to make local beer for resale.

loans.name: Ghaleb

texts.en:
Ghaleb is a 43-year-old, married man and father of four children. He owns a bobcat machine and has 15 years of experience using it to transport different requested items. His services are highly requested in his area because of the projects that villagers are developing since the end of the war.  Ghaleb is a hard worker and he does his best to develop his business and keep his family satisfied.

Ghaleb is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development to buy an asphalt "Tar" grinder to start a new business that will help increase his income and improve his family's social and financial situation. This is his sixth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower and he is proud that his previous loans helped to improve his business. He will continue to improve his work as much as he can for his children.

loans.use: To buy a tar grinder to start a new business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
El crédito anterior me permitio poder ofrecer un plazo mas amplio a mis clientas, con lo que he logrado ampliar mi mercado, porque anteriormente el problema que afrontaba, es que los proveedores me daban crédito a un plazo de 30 días, eso me limitaba a poder ofrecerles a mis clientes un plazo que se ajustara a la capacidad de pago de ellas.
En este momento estoy participando en un proyecto de vivienda, por el momento estoy viviendo en una casa que me facilito mi hermana, despues de mi divorcio; es de esperarse que para este Diciembre se de ya la adjudicación de las casas, pero mi participación en este comite de vivienda no hubiese sido posible, sin la ayuda financiera que me ofrecio fundación Mujer, porque con la ganancia del desarrollo de mi actividad de comercio ambulante, es que he podido hacerle frente a gastos que he tenido que realizar en pos de adquirir una vivienda para mi hijo y yo.
texts.en:
The previous loan allowed me to be able to offer my customers longer repayment terms.  With that I have managed to expand my market.  The problem I previously faced was that the providers gave me credit terms of 30 days.  This limited my ability to offer my customers adjustable terms according to their capacity to pay.

Now I am participating in a housing project.  At present I am living in a house that my sister  provided me with after my divorce.  

It is hoped that this December they will award the houses.  However, my participation with this housing committee would not have been possible without the financial help that the Fundación Mujer gave me.  With the income from developing my business activity of itinerant sales I have been able to get in front of the expenses.  These are the expenses that I have had to make in pursuit of a house for my son and me.

loans.use: to purchase sports clothing and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Lydia's Group

texts.en:
Lydia's group is comprised of six hard working women. Lydia is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge, in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has four children.  Three attend school.  For the past few years, Lydia has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells dry food. 

To help expand her business, Lydia has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy maize, and will help Lydia generate greater profits and pay school fees and medical expenses.  Lydia hopes to build a house in the future. 

Lydia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides a safe place for young Ugandan women and a forum to promote life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Lydia's future prospects by helping her save money and budget for her family.

loans.use: to buy maize.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia  is a married woman with five children, ages 15 to 26 years old.  She describes herself as a determined woman. 

She operates a grocery store where she sells potatoes.  Teresia has been in business for 10 years and employs one staff member.  Her business is located along a road near a market and her primary customers are local residents.  Teresia says her biggest business challenge is stiff competition within the area. 

Teresia will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy potatoes to resell.  Her business goal is to run a wholesale grocery store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she hoped her business will be more successful.

loans.use: to buy potatoes to resell.

loans.name: Martha Esther

texts.es:
Con un prestamo de 15,900 pesos Martha Esther ha podido comprar pupitres, mesas y pizarras para su sala de tarea. Hace dos años que Martha abrió las puertas de su casa para ayudar a los niños a relizar su tarea o reforzarlos en alguna materia en la que necesiten ayuda especial. República Dominicana es uno de los países con peor calidad de educación en el hemisferio. Muchas profesoras, al igual que Martha inician en casa su propio negocio facilitando tutorías a niños que necesitan reforzar algún área de la educación que reciben ya sea en la escuela pública o algún colegio privado de bajo costo al que asisten. Martha tiene pasión por enseñar y aunque cobra una tarifa muy baja por las tutorias que brinda a sus niños, muchas veces los recibe en su sala de tarea aunque no tengan cómo pagarle. 
Martha es casada y tiene dos hijos, una de 12 años y uno de 10 años.
El sueño de Martha es desarrollar su sala de tarea hasta que se convierta en una escuela privada donde pueda ayudar a una mayor cantidad de niños
texts.en:
With a loan for 15,900 pesos Martha Esther has been able to buy desks, tables, and blackboards for her homework room.  Two years ago Martha opened the doors to her house in order to help children do their homework or to reinforce some material with which they needed special help.

The Dominican Republic is one of the countries with the worst quality of education in the hemisphere.  Many teachers, like Martha, start their own businesses in their houses.  They tutor children who need reinforcement in some educational area.  This could be for students in public school or some private school that costs little to attend.

Martha has a passion for teaching.  Even though she charges a very low fee for tutoring the children, she often takes them into her homework room even though they do not have a way of paying her.

Martha is married and has two children, ages 12 and 10.

Martha’s dream is to develop her homework room and convert it into a private school where she is able to help more children.

loans.use: to buy furniture and equipment.

loans.name: Meen

texts.en:
Meen is 44 years old and married.  She lives in a rural village in the Dambae district of Battambang.  She has four children, two of whom depend on her and are still in school.  

She has been involving in rice farming on two hectares of farmland, for 20 years and it is her main source of income.  Meen supplements her income via cassava growing. She is able to earn about 52,000 KHR per day. Her main challenge is the declining price of cassava. 

Meen has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle. With success, she has paid back the entire loan which helped her support the daily expenses of her household, especially having decent food.  

Now, she is applying for a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fee for her field.  Meen hopes that the prices of her crops will increase soon, so she can earn more income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fee for her field.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Hanifa is very beautiful woman with a kind-nature. She is a woman of tasty and fashion. Fore more than five years she has own a sewing business that makes national dresses. 

She has a lot of clients.  All of them are glad because Hanifa sews very wonderful dresses. 

Hanifa has four children and brings them up alone as she is divorcee.  Her daughter helps her with the business. 

Hanifa wants to develop more business and that's why she needs to buy a new sewing machine and fabrics.  Kiva lenders can help her.  She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and fabrics.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 31 years old.  She has been selling items such as sugar and rice for two years.  With the loan, she wants to add more new items to her inventory, such as fruits and vegetables.  The profits from the business will be saved.

loans.use: to buy  fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Elvira tiene 29 años está casada con el señor Bernardino, tienen 3 hijos pequeños que dependen de sus ingresos , están en la es cuela en el nivel primario, viven en su casa en la comunidad de Monte Canto en la ciudad de Cochabamba, a pesar que la casa no está totalmente terminada ya se fueron a vivir porque Vivian en la casa de sus padres en una sola habitación donde se sentían muy incomodos, su principal actividad es la producción de la leche cruda, cuenta con cabezas de ganado lechero cuyo producto vende a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos.
El destino del crédito es para la compra de forraje ya que esta temporada hay bastante escases de forraje y lo que la cliente quiera hacer es acumular y de esa manera no le faltara forraje en el tiempo de sequía y su ganado seguirá alimentándose de la misma  manera y  continuara produciendo la misma cantidad de leche.
Entre sus sueños y  mentas es seguir creciendo en su actividad lechera y lo más importante terminar la construcción de su vivienda ya que falta la obra fina.
texts.en:
Elvira is 29 and married to Bernardino.  They have three small children who depend on their income.  The children are enrolled in primary school.  They all live in a home in the Monte Canto community in the city of Cochabamba, Bolivia.  They live there even though the house is not completely finished because they were very uncomfortable all living in a single room in Elvira's family's home.  Elvira's principal business activity is the production of raw milk from dairy cattle, which is sold to a company that produces dairy products.

The loan is to purchase fodder during this season of shortage. Elvira wants to accumulate fodder in order to not fall short in times of drought.  Her livestock will be able to continue eating the same amount and producing the same amount of milk.

Her dreams and goals include growing her milk business and completing construction of her home with respect to the finishing touches.

loans.use: to buy fodder.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is a 30-year-old married man, and a father of two children. He has owned a convenience store for 6 years. He also works in agriculture, planting and selling apples, in addition to working in construction, specializing in cement work.

All of Maher's businesses are very important to his family's living, and he works herd to develop them as much as he can. Maher has been an Al Majmoua Kiva partner borrower for six cycles. All his previous loans were invested properly in his businesses, and at the same time he was a good standing borrower.

To increase his business merchandise with necessary summer beverages, Maher applied for a Youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, and he is very excited to get it because he has made many plans to expand this sector as much as he can. He hopes to expand and develop his three sectors in a well managed way, and to request employees to help in supporting these businesses expansions.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with necessary summer beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Yelica

texts.es: La Sra. Yelica tiene 31 años y tiene un hijito de 13 años,  se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan empanadas y variedad de repostería, su panadería  que se encuentra ubicado  en la zona Guapuru,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Yelica  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de un horno de mayor capacidad Sra. Yelica enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia de una panadería que produce en mayor cantidad  ya que  la capacidad de su panadería es pequeña, la Sra. Yelica es una persona  con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Yelica is 31-years old and has a 13-year old son. She makes and sells empanadas and a variety of pastries. Her store is located in the Guapuru area.

This will be Yelica's second loan with this institution. She plans to use it to buy a bigger oven. The biggest problem she faces is competition from a large bakery that produces much more than she does. Yelica is the type of person who wishes to find solutions to any problems. She is happy and grateful for the support that the institution provides.

loans.use: Buy an oven for her bakery

loans.name: 74-Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento 74-NUEVO AMANECER, Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Wilma tiene 22 años, y no tiene hijos,  La Sra. Wilma se dedica  a la actividad de elaboración y  venta de pan y de empanadas, ella tiene un puesto fijo donde ofrece sus productos este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Wilma va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para su puesto de venta,  de esta manera brindar comodidad y un mejor servicio a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Wilma va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando utensilios e insumos para la elaboración de sus empanadas, la Sra. Wilma  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en: The communal bank "74-Nuevo Amanecer" (74-New Dawn) is made up of eight members, six women and two men. The president of the group is Wilma, who is 22 years old and does not have any children. Wilma makes a living making and selling "empanadas" (a filled pastry) and bread. She has a stall from where she sells her products. This is the first loan she has taken out through the communal bank. She will use the loan to buy tables and chairs for her food stall. This will allow her to provide comfort and better service to her customers, which will lead to increased profits. The reason she took out the loan is to continue improving her business. She will use the benefits that come from the loan to continue buying utensils and ingredients needed to make her "empanadas". Wilma is a very hard working woman. She is thankful for the opportunity that has been given to her and her fellow group members, as it is common that they are the only ones supporting their families.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for their business.

loans.name: Heisen

texts.es:
Heisen tiene 31 años, es un hombre empeñoso y trabajador, además de tener muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su pareja es Jessica, con quien tiene un hijo de 4 años. Viven en la casa que logró construir con mucho empeño.

La actividad que realiza es el alquiler de videojuegos, para esto cuenta con cuatro equipos instalados en su vivienda donde tiene un ambiente con mesas y sillas para la comodidad de sus clientes. Obtuvo experiencia aprendiendo de sus hermanos que también tienen el mismo negocio hace 5 años. Juntó un pequeño capital y comenzó con la compra de sus televisores y ahora le va muy bien, le gusta, pues le permite contar con un ingreso económico para solventar los gastos de su hogar, además que tiene una ocupación. Viendo la rentabilidad que le deja su negocio tiene planes de terminar sus estudios técnicos en construcción civil y constituir una oficina de asesoría de estudios técnicos de planos.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y se siente contento con el apoyo financiero que le están brindando para concretar sus planes. También agradece el apoyo de los integrantes de su banco comunal donde se siente cómodo y en confianza.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1200 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de una computadora para empezar a implementar su oficina de asesoría en construcción civil.
texts.en:
Heisen is 31 years old and he is a hardworking man with a great desire to progress in life. His lifetime’s partner’s name is Jessica, and they have a 4-year-old child. They live in the house he has succeeded in building thanks to his great dedication.

He rents videogames, and he has installed four play stations in a room of his house where equipped with chairs and tables for his customers’ comfort. He has a 5-years’ experience in this activity, and he has learnt it from his brothers who work in the same field. He has started by putting together a small working capital to buy his TV sets, and now things are going very well for him, as this activity provides him with an economic income to pay for his household expense, and because he has a job. Seeing how profitable his activity ism he plans on completing his civil engineering studies and to open a consulting business to draw up design plans.

This is the third loan he is requesting to MFP and he feels deeply grateful for the economic support he has received to achieve his goals. He is also grateful to the support received by the members of his Communal Bank as he trusts them and feels at ease with them.

The 1,200 PEN he has requested will be invested in the purchase of a computer to start implementing his consulting business in civil engineering.

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha de 40 años de edad es soltera, no tiene hijos, vive con su mamá a quien cuida con esmero, labora como docente de educacion primaria en una escuela rural de San Patricio desde hace mas de 20 años. Esta solicitando su 10mo credito con el objetivo de ver terminado su sueño de coronar su carrera universitaria, pagando el curso de titulacion de la carrera de Licenciatura en Pedagogia en la UNIVAL, cabe señalar que el credito anterior le sirvio mucho porque pudo comprar material didactico que necesitaba para sus clases pero que tambien le servira para la realizacion de su trabajo como maestra. Su mayor sueño es poder tener su titulo y que su mamá cuente siempre con buena salud.
texts.en:
40-year old Martha is single and doesn't have any children. She lives with her mother and takes great care of her. She has been a primary teacher in a rural school in San Patricio for more than 20 years. 

Martha is seeking her 10th loan so she can complete her dream of a university degree. She wishes to enroll in courses at UNIVAL to become a licensed teacher. It should be noted that much of Martha's last loan was used to buy teaching material that she needed for her courses and also used in her work as a teacher. Her dreams are to have a teaching degree and to see her mother stay healthy.

loans.use: Pay for her teaching degree courses

loans.name: Kenner

texts.es:
Kenner es un joven de apenas 21 años de edad y vive con su familia en la comunidad de Santa Teresita, en el cantón de Turrialba ubicado en la  provincia de Cartago. La ciudad de Cartago fue capital de Costa Rica hasta 1823, se caracteriza por tener un  relieve montañoso formado por dos cordilleras: la Central y la cordillera de Talamanca, su clima es frío la mayoría del año consecuencia de los dos volcanes que posee llamados  Irazú y Turrialba.
Kenner trabaja en la elaboración de productos lácteos como natilla, queso, mantequilla y otros, los cuales distribuye a lo largo de su comunidad y en lugares aledaños a esta, no cuenta con un vehículo propio para realizar esta labor, por lo cual está solicitando un préstamo de un millón treinta y cinco  mil colones (¢1.035.000) para adquirir un vehículo para agilizar su trabajo y ampliar su clientela.
Kenner forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de El Sauce de Santa Teresita Turrialba, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer crédito y con él espera poder seguir creciendo como microempresario y sacar su negocio adelante. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede sacar más provecho a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Kenner is only 21 years old and he lives with his family in Santa Teresita, a community located in the Turrialba canton of the Cartago province. The city of Cartago has been the capital of Costa Rica until 1823, and it is characterized by a mountainous terrain that has been formed by two ranges: Central and Talamanca. Given its proximity to two volcanoes, Irazú and Turrialba, weather is cold for most part of the year.
Kenner prepares dairy products such as cream, cheese and butter, and he then distributes them both in his community and in those nearby. As he does not have a vehicle of his own to do his job he is requesting a loan of one million and thirty five thousand Colones (¢1.035.000) to buy a vehicle, in order to speed up his job and to increase the number of his customers.
Kenner is a member of the Communal Bank “El Sauce de Santa Teresita Turrialba” (The Willow of Santa Teresita Turrialba), one of EDESA’s 150 social organizations in Costa Rica. This will be is first loan and he hopes that thanks to this he will keep on growing as a micro entrepreneur and that he will make his activity grow. He also points out that thanks to this type of organizations and means of facilitating credit he can get a better profit from his productive activities.

loans.use: To buy a vehicle to transport his products.

loans.name: Roel

texts.es:
Roel tiene 51 años, su pareja es Isabel, con quien tiene seis hijos, pero ahora sólo vive con cuatro de ellos, los de 25, 22, 18 y 11 años. Su casa es propia, él mismo la construyó y se ubica en la comunidad nativa. 

Él es un excelente agricultor, los años de experiencia no son en vano. Desde los 20 años se dedica a las labores del campo, por eso ahora cultiva con confianza siete parcelas de cacao, café, plátanos y yuca. Empezó con la siembra de yucas, cuando era joven, y como le fue bien, hasta ahora continúa con su producción. “Tengo como cuatro parcelas sólo de yucas y ya sé como negociar y en qué lugares”, comenta orgulloso de sus logros. Sus hijos también lo apoyan en las labores del campo y muchas veces comparten los terrenos y en el momento de las cosechas se reparten las ganancias. Esta vez está planeando sembrar un poco de maíz que cosechará en cuatro meses, y algo de plátanos en los espacios vacíos.

Esta es la primera vez que Roel trabaja con MFP, por eso da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Acaba de ingresar al banco comunal “Sol Naciente” y menciona que espera mucho del grupo, en cuanto al logro de objetivos personales y de grupo.
Invertirá este dinero en el pago del personal que contratará para la limpieza de una parcela para así sembrar maíz.
texts.en:
51-year old Roel is married to Isabel with whom he has six children, although only four (aged 25, 22, 18, and 11) are still living with them. Roel owns his house: he built it himself and it is located in the town where he was born.

He is an excellent farmer--his years of experience have not been in vain. He's worked in agriculture for 20 years, and grows seven parcels of cocoa, coffee, plantain bananas, and yucca. He started growing yucca as a young man, and as it went well, he has continued with this crop. "I have four parcels dedicated solely to yucca. I know how and where to sell it," he notes proudly. His children also help him in the fields, and they often share land. Currently they are sharing the profits from the harvest.

Now Roel is planning to grow some corn which he will harvest in four months as well as plantains in empty spots.

This is the first time that Roel has worked with MFP. He gives his word that he will be punctual with the monthly repayments. He has just joined the Sol Naciente Community Bank and notes that he expects to learn much from the group both about personal objectives and group goals.

He will use the loan to hire laborers to weed his land and sow corn.

loans.use: Pay laborers to weed his fields

loans.name: Villa Huequen Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Villa Huequen” está conformado por 17 emprendedores que se dedican al rubro del comercio, específicamente venta de ropa, venta de leña, abarrotes, comida rápida, venta de frutas, pastelería, panadería, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Angol.
Rosa, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste una chaqueta de color burdeo, usa aros, su cabello es de color castaño claro y lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de comida rápida, desde hace 5 años. Comenta que trabaja en un carrito que lo ubica fuera de su casa, le ayuda su hermano en las ventas y su horario de trabajo es durante las tardes todos los días.
Su mercadería que va necesitando la compra en supermercados y distribuidoras a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará papas, kétchup, mostaza, mayonesa, aceite y gas.
Una de las metas de Rosa en su negocio es seguir creciendo para poder comprar una freidora que hasta el momento le hace falta en si carrito.
Rosa vive junto a sus 2 hijas de 4 y 14 años de edad. Sus sueños son tener la posibilidad de instalar un local en su propia casa, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual le ha servido como un momento de distracción. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Angol se ubica a 128 km. al noroeste de Temuco (capital de la novena región) y a 608 km. al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). Su nombre significa en mapudungun (lengua del pueblo mapuche) “subida a gatas”. Sus habitantes se dedican fuertemente a labores agrícolas y silvo agropecuarias, áreas en las que actualmente han adquirido relevancia, particularmente, aquellas vinculadas a la producción frutícola y hortícola.
texts.en:
The Villa Huequen communal bank has 17 entrepreneurs who are in business, specifically selling clothes, firewood, groceries, fast food, fruit, pastries, bread, offering services, etc,  All of the members are from Angol. Rosa, a member in the communal bank, is shown seated in the first row, the first place going from left to right in the photo.  She is dressed in a burgundy colored jacket, wearing rings, and she has brown hair pulled back.
She has sold fast food for the past 5 years.  She says that she works with a cart outside her house and her brother helps her with the sales.  She works every afternoon.

She buys her supplies from the supermarkets and distributors at a low cost which helps her expenses.
She will use the loan to buy potatoes, ketchup, mustard, mayonnaise, oil and gas.
One of Rosa's goals is to keep growing her business to be able to buy a fryer that she doesn't have in her cart.
Rosa lives with her two daughters, 4 and 14.  Her dreams are to have the possibility of installing a stand in her own house so that she can have a better quality of life.

She is very happy and thankful for the opportunity offered her by Fondo Esperanza since they have allowed her to invest in the business.  Besides, she feels very comfortable in the company of the other members of the communal bank since they share different activities, and interests that have served her as distractions.  The trainings given in the meetings have taught her to better manage her business.

Angol is located 128 kilometers northwest of Temuco (the capital of the ninth region) and 608 kilometers to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile).  Its name means climbing on all fours in Mapadungum (the language of the Mapuche).  Its residents work mainly in farming and fish production, an area that has currently become more relevant, particulary connected to fruit and plant growing.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, ketchup, mustard, mayonnaise, oil and gas

loans.name: Nermi

texts.es:
Nermi tiene 39 años, su pareja es Jorge, con quien tiene tres hijos, pero ahora sólo vive con dos de ellos, los de 18 y 6 años. Su casa está ubicada en la comunidad en Chanchamayo.
Con la agricultura ha sabido brindarles a sus hijos una calidad de vida cada vez mejor. De esa manera su hijo (el mayor) de 21 años aprendió a trabajar la tierra y ahora es independiente. Nermi cultiva café, achiote y frutas cítricas como mandarinas y naranjas. En las seis parcelas que administra, distribuye muy bien sus productos; sabe que el café le da mayores ganancias al año, por eso tiene tres parcelas sólo de este producto. Sus gastos diarios son solventados con la venta de las frutas, ya que las cosecha cada mes. Ya son como 10 años que lleva en esta actividad: “depende de los precios, hay años en que nos favorece cultivar de todo y hay otros años que ganamos muy poco”, manifiesta. A pesar de ello, Nermi no se queda atrás y continúa con su trabajo, porque confía en sus capacidades de negociación. 

Este es su crédito número 6 con MFP y como en los créditos anteriores promete ser puntual en los pagos mensuales. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente” y se siente contenta de tener compañeros responsables y muy activos.
Con este dinero podrá realizar la limpieza de sus parcelas, pagará a tres personas para ellos alrededor de 1200 soles. Lo restante será para adquirir mamones de plátanos y bolsas de abono para iniciar una nueva siembra.
texts.en:
Nermi is 39 years old, her partner is named Jorge, and together they have three children, but currently only two of them are living with them, the 6 year old and the 18 year old.  Their house is located in the community of Chanchamayo.

With their agriculture, they have been able to give their children a better quality of life.  In this way, their son (the oldest) who is 21 years old learned to work the land and is now independent.  Nermi grows coffee, achiote (annatto), and citrus fruits like mandarin oranges and oranges.  On the six parcels of land that she manages, her products are very well distributed; she knows that the coffee is one of her greatest profits each year, and so this year she is growing three parcels of just that product.  Her daily costs are covered by the sale of her fruits, which she harvests every month.  It has been ten years since she started this activity.  "It depends on the prices.  There are years when we do well with the cultivation everything, and other years when we make very little profit," she says.  Even so, Nermi doesn't lose hope and continues to do her work, because she trusts in her business abilities.

This is her sixth loan with MFP, and just as with the previous loans, she promises to be on time with her monthly payments.  She is a part of the community bank "Sol Naciente" (the Rising Sun), and she is happy they have responsible and very active members.

With this money, she will be able to clean up her parcels of land, and she will pay three people to do so for around 1,200 Soles.  The rest of the money will go to acquiring plantain seedlings and bags of fertilizer to start a new planting cycle.

loans.use: to pay the people who will work on her land and also to buy plantain seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en: Immaculee, age 48, is widowed. She sells charcoal and has spent 6 years in the business. With the loan, she wants to buy more charcoal to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings for the better future of her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mwirigi

texts.en: Mwirigi is a 32-year-old married woman. She has a son who is 2 years old. She describes herself to be an aggressive woman. She operates a tailoring store where she sells clothes she makes. She has been involved in this business for 6 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located along a busy street and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high prices of clothing material. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy clothing material. Her business goal is to expand her business where she will start selling school uniforms within 5 years. She hopes that in the future her business will be successful.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making clothes for sale.

loans.name: Bobonosir

texts.en: Bobonosir has his own lorry and has been busy with transportation of building materials for more than 30 years. He has good ideas and always tries to realize them. He has a lot of friends and they help him to realize his ideas. As he is very sociable, he has many customers. He has a lovely wife and 4 smart children. His son helps him with business. He wants to develop his business, but his lorry is broken. He is asking for a loan to repair his lorry. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To repair his lorry

loans.name: Gladys Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora Gladys tiene 26 años de edad, vive en la zona de Machajmarca un canton de la Provincia de Quillacollo de la ciudad de Cochabamba , esta casada con el Señor Jose con quien tiene dos hijos pequeños.
Gladys se dedica la producción de maíz, saca dos producciones al año y de la misma manera en la producción de leche y su esposo trabaja en la construcción como albañil, ellos trabajan desde muy jovencitos ya que se casaron cuando tenían dieciocho años y salieron adelante ellos cuanta que primero vivieron en la casa de sus padres de Jose, donde tuvieron problemas con su hermana de Jose y por esa razón buscaron un terrenito y empezaron la construcción de su vivienda, el crédito solicitado es para la compra de materiales de construcción de sus vivienda. 
Gladys y Jose trabajan todo los días para salir adelante y poder ofrecer un futuro mejor para sus hijos ya que ellos no culminaron el colegio
texts.en:
Gladys is 26 years old and lives in the area of Machajmarca, a canton in the province of Quillacolloin the city of Cochabamba.  She is married to a man named Jose with whom she has two small children.

Gladys is a grower of corn; she has two harvests per year, and also keep cow for their milk and her husband works in construction as a mason.  They have both worked since they were very young, since they got married when they were only 18 years old but worked to get ahead.  They tell us they started out living with Jose's parents in their home, where they had problems getting along with Jose's sister.  For that reason, they looked for a little bit of land and began building their own home.  The loan is for buying construction materials for their house's construction.

Gladys and Jose work all day to do well and to be able to offer a better future to their children, as they themselves never finished high school.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en: Francoise is 31 years old. She is married and has four children, and all the children attend schools. Francoise has spent years selling different items in the boutique, such as sugar and other items. She has realized that her customers are in need of shoes for the children. Therefore, after successful repayment of the previous loan, she decided to request a loan to add shoes in her existing business. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy shoes for sale

loans.name: Thyn's Group

texts.en: Originally from Prey Chhor district of Kompong Cham province, Thyn is the breadwinner of the family and has no children. She has been growing paddy rice for 23 years to earn a living, and she can earn about 12,000 KHR per day. Her main challenges are the drought that made her crop fruitless and the lack of working capital for her current business. To tackle these challenges, she forms a group of four to apply for a new loan. This is the second cycle for Thyn and another group member, and the first cycle for the remaining two members. Thyn has repaid the entire loan of the first cycle from VisionFund already and she has managed to have a decent house and set aside some money for future needs. She and the other three members are applying for 1,000,000 KHR each. She, as the leader, is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pay the harvesting fee for her rice farm. She hopes to improve her current business gradually, better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay the harvesting fee for her rice farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Milca

texts.en: Milca is 55 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 children. To earn a living, Milca has a business baking and selling snacks, particularly “puto”. She earns about 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Milca has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to be used in purchasing additional ingredients for her puto baking and vending business. Milca has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Milca would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional ingredients for her puto baking and vending business

loans.name: Servete

texts.en:
Servete lives in Kosovo. She is single. She is a very communicative and hardworking woman. She works at a travel agency. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Over 30% of Kosovo’s population live and work in different countries of Europe, America, Canada, Australia and most of them spend their holiday in Kosovo. Because of this, travel agencies are very busy especially in a summer season when they come to Kosovo for booking tickets and reservations for vacations in the seaside.

Also, Servete's business has expanded from the time that visa liberalization was made in Albania and now she has clients from Albania too who make reservations through her agency.

This is her second time that she requests a loan from KosInvest. Servete now will use a loan to renovate her office and to buy a computer. She also hopes to expand her business and to open another travel agency in order to increase profit.

She appreciates KosInvest support.

loans.use: To renovate her office and to buy a computer

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 48 years old and lives in Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 children. 

Editha has a sand and gravel quarrying business and earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to be used in paying the labor cost of the workers doing the quarry of sand and gravel. Editha has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Editha hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: To be used in paying the labor cost of the workers

loans.name: Sylvia's Group

texts.en:
Sylvia's group is comprised of 5 hardworking women. Sylvia is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is single. For the past 3 years, Sylvia has been working hard to manage her food stall, where she sells pork. 

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more pigs and goods to sell, and will help Sylvia to generate greater profits and pay for medical expenses. Sylvia hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build on it. 

Sylvia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Sylvia's future prospects by helping her to save money.

loans.use: to buy more pigs

loans.name: Yim's Group

texts.en:
Yim, 53, is residing in a remote area located in the Dambae district of Kompong Cham Province. She has four children, one of whom still depends on her and is still in school. To strive for her family, Yim grows cassava on three hectares of farmland to generate income. She also earns extra minimal income as a doctor in the village. Having been with this business for 12 years, she currently can earn about 30,000 KHR per day. 

This is the microloan for Yim's group of two; Yim is a second-cycle client and the other member is a first-cycle client. The first loan has helped Yim manage her business well and generate more income for her family. She and her group member are seeking 1,200,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR, respectively. As the leader, she will use her loan portion to pay for the weeding fee for her cassava field. She hopes that this loan will enable her to improve her business.

loans.use: To pay the weeding fee for her cassava field

loans.name: Nilson

texts.es:
Nilson tiene 35 años, está casado con Rosita, con quien tiene seis hijos. Esta familia vive en una casita rústica ubicada en una comunidad de Chanchamayo. 
Él se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 17 años, tiempo suficiente para trabajar con experiencia y predisposición dentro del campo. Cuenta con seis parcelas de terreno donde cultiva café, paltas, cacao y plátanos. Ahora ya concluyó con la cosecha de café, con la etapa de la “raspa” que consiste en coger los últimos granos de café rebuscándolos en los arbustos, por eso requiere de varias bolsas de abono para volver a cultivar; mientras tanto trabaja con el plátano y las paltas. Cuando ya tiene atendidas todas sus parcelas, también labora como jornalero en otros terrenos, de esta manera siempre obtiene ingresos para su familia; sino se dirige al río para pescar, luego negocia lo obtenido en el mercado. Nilson es muy trabajador. Estos días iniciará con la limpieza de su cafetal, por eso necesitará muchas bolsas de fertilizantes.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por eso agradece la oportunidad y la confianza que ponen en ella, no piensa fallar, pues pagará las cuotas a tiempo. Además es un socio activo y responsable dentro de su banco comunal “Sol Naciente”. 
Con el dinero que ahora solicita podrá comprar 15 bolsas de fertilizantes, de 120 nuevos soles cada una. Lo restante será para pagar a los operarios que contratará para la limpieza de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Nilson is 35 years old and married to Rosita, with whom he has six children.  This family lives in a simple little house located in the community of Chanchamayo. 

He has been in agriculture ever since he was 17 years old, enough time that he is now experienced and has knowledge to work in the countryside.  He has six parcels of land where he cultivates coffee, avocados, cacao, and plantains.  He has just finished his coffee harvest with the final "scraping" which consists of finding and picking the last coffee beans off of the bushes, so now he needs bags of fertilizer to start a new planting.  Meanwhile he's also working on growing his plantains and avocados.  When all of his lands are seen to, he works as a day laborer on other people's plots of land.  This gives him a steady stream of income for his family, as he also catches fish in the river and sells whatever he finds in the market.  Nilson is a very hard wroker.  These days he wants to start with the cleaning of his coffee plantation and for this he needs bags of fertilizer.

This is his third loan with MFP, and he is very thankful for the opportunity and the confidence that has been placed in him.  He does not intend to fail, and he plans to make his payments on time.  He is also an active and responsible member of his community banking group, "Sol Naciente" (the Rising Sun).

With the money that he is now asking for, he will be able to buy 15 bags of fertilizer, which cost 120 Soles apiece.  The rest will be used to pay the laborers he will hire to do the cleaning and preparation of his fields.

loans.use: to buy 15 bags of fertilizer and pay the day laborers who will work on his land.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señora Elizabeth tiene 35 años de edad, vive en Pucarita Chica en la zona sud de la ciudad de Cochabamba tiene tres hijos que aun dependen económicamente de ella, sus esposo Félix trabaja en la instalación de antenas en otro pais.
Elizabeth se dedica a la producción de leche, ella realiza el ordeño desde muy temprano todos los días y hace su entrega a la Pil todos los días por la mañana y la tarde, Elizabeth sufrio mucho cuando era niña ya que su mama murió cuando era muy pequeña y al ser ella la única mujer de su familia se dedicó a sacar adelante a sus hermanos y a su padre, ella es una persona responsable trabajadora. Su esposo les envía lo poco que gana a Elizabeth todos los meses y con eso paga los gastos de sus hijos.
Elizabeth solicita el crédito para la compra de soya, ya que se bien la temporada de escases y subida de este insumo para su ganado y de esa manera podrá obtener mayores ingresos y poder dar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elizabethis 35 years old and lives in Pucarita Chica in the southern part of the city of Cochabamba.  She has three children who are all economically dependent on her, and her husband Félix is a worker installing antennas in another country.

Elizabeth works in the production of milk, she begins working very early most days and takes her deliveries to the Pil every day in the morning nad again at night.  Elizabeth suffered greatly when she was a small girl, since her mother died when she was very small, and being the only woman in her family, she decided to work hard to help her brothers and her father.  She is a responsible and hardworking woman.  Her husband sends the little that he makes to Elizabeth every month to cover the children's expenses.

Elizabeth is asking for this loan to buy soy beans, because she knows it is currently the season of scarcity, and will supplement the feed for her cattle and in this way be able to gain better income and be able to give a better future to her children.

loans.use: to buy feed for livestock.

loans.name: Jahongul

texts.en: Jahongul is a woman with strong character and a kind heart. For more than 22 years she has been busy sewing traditional Tajik dresses for local people. Many women of fashion like to wear the dresses Jahongul makes. Jahongul tries to successfully manage all her deals. She has two children, and they help her with the business. Jahongul wants to develop her business and use the profits to improve her living conditions. She needs your help to do this. She is asking for a loan to buy fabrics for sewing dresses in new fashions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for sewing dresses in new fashions.

loans.name: Margueritte

texts.en: Margueritte is a mother of three children, all of whom attend schools. She owns a shop and has been running that business for 12 years. With the loan she has requested, she plans to add more items to her shop, such as cooking oil, sugar, and soaps for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more items such as cooking oil, sugar, and soap for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 32 years old. She sells shoes and has spent five years in this business. She has requested a loan to buy more shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay for her children's school fees. She is very thankful for the previous loan, which helped her to meet her family's needs. She hopes to use this loan wisely to make her business better for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand shoes

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
Living in a remote area of Dambae district (Kompong Cham province, Cambodia), Phally, aged 43, is a mother of six dependent children who are all still in school. She grows cassava and paddy rice on two hectares of farmland each. She has been farming for the past 12 years; currently, she is able to earn about 16,000 KHR per day from her farms. 

Phally took her first loan with KIVA's partner VisionFund in 2011. The loan, which she completely paid back, has helped her to better support her big family. Now she leads a micro-loan group of two in requesting a new loan. Her requested amount is 1,400,000 KHR, and the other member is applying for 1,200,000 KHR. Phally is going to use her loan portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her rice farm. In addition, she will use a portion of the loan to pay for the weeding fee for her cassava field. She hopes to receive more cash-crop so she can generate more income to support her big household, especially in order to keep her six children in school.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her rice farm, and to pay for weeding for her cassava field.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 38 años, su pareja es Augusto, con quien tiene cinco hijos, pero ahora sólo vive con tres de ellos. Esta familia habita una casita rústica, pero propia, en la comunidad nativa Boca del Ipoki, Chanchamayo.
A sus cortos 16 años, Sonia dio a luz a su primer hijo, desde entonces se dedica a la agricultura, y aprovechando los terrenos que sus padres y la comunidad le otorgaron empezó a cultivar café, plátanos y kión; “tengo cinco cuadras de terrenos y todos los días trabajo en la limpieza y cultivo”, menciona. Su rutina diaria es cansada, empieza atendiendo a sus hijos, que todavía están en edad escolar, luego cocina para los trabajadores que contrata para que la ayuden en las labores agrícolas y finaliza con el trabajo en el campo. Sonia tiene sus metas claras: mejorar su producción con mejores fertilizantes y mayores cuidados para que sus ventas sean mejores.

Este es su crédito número 6 con MFP y da su palabra de pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente” y dice sentirse cómoda con sus compañeros, pues son puntuales y activos. 
Con este dinero podrá pagar al personal que contratará para la limpieza de sus parcelas de café y plátanos.
texts.en:
Sonia is 38 years old, and her partner is Augusto, with whom she has five children, but they currently live with only three of them.  Their family lives in a small and simple house, but one that they own, in the indigenous community of Boca del Ipoki, Chanchamayo.

At just 16 years old, Sonia gave birth to her first child and since then, she has been working in agriculture and using the lands that her parents and the community have given to her, she began to cultivate coffee, plantains, and ginger.  "I have five plots of land, and every day I work either preparing and cleaning or cultivating them," she says.  Her daily routine is tiring, as she begins by caring for her children, who are still of schooling age, she then cooks for the workers she has contracted with to help her with her agricultural work and she finishes her day working in the fields.  Sonia has clear goals: improving her production with better fertilizers and and better care for the crops so that her sales will be better.

This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she gives her word that she will pay her monthly payments on time.  She is a part of the community banking group "Sol Naciente" (Rising Sun) and she says she feels glad to be with the other members because they are timely and actively involved.

With this money, she will be able to pay the people she has contracted with to clean and improve her crops of coffee and plantains.

loans.use: to pay the people who will work on her cultivated lands.

loans.name: Gerson

texts.es:
Gerson tiene 36 años, su pareja es Irene, con quien tiene dos hijos de 7 y 3 años. Viven en una casa rústica, pero propia, ubicada en una comunidad nativa.
Hace 7 años que él llegó a la comunidad y le agradó, allí conoció a la madre de sus hijos. Lleva con 6 años en la actividad de la agricultura y en todo este tiempo la comunidad le otorgó una parcela de terreno donde cultiva café, palta y plátano. “Empecé con el café y para cosechar esperé como 2 años, pero ahora ya tengo buena producción”, menciona orgulloso. Además se esmera en el cultivo de plátanos porque le brinda frutos cada quince días, solventando sus gastos más urgentes. Su comunidad reparte terrenos a los pobladores de acuerdo a la antigüedad de tiempo de residencia, por eso Gerson esperará 2 años más para que la comunidad le otorgue más parcelas y así aumentar su producción.

Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y se responsabiliza de pagar con puntualidad las cuotas. Por otra parte, menciona que le agrada el trabajo con su banco comunal “Sol Naciente”, porque juntos han salido de apuros gracias a sus ahorros.
Con este dinero podrá comprar semillas de café, abono orgánico y bolsas para elaborar viveros de café, los que plantará en los espacios vacíos de su parcela.
texts.en:
Gerson is 36 years old. His partner is Irene, with whom he has two children, ages 7 and 3. They live in a rustic house, their own, which is located in an indigenous community. He arrived in this community seven years ago and he liked it. There he met the mother of his children. 

He has spent six years as a farmer and during this time the community gave him a plot of land where he grows coffee, avocados and bananas. “I began with coffee and waited two years for the first harvest, but now I have a good production,” he says proudly.  He also puts a lot of effort into cultivating bananas because they provide fruit every 15 days, paying for his most immediate expenses. His community distributes land to inhabitants according to their length of residence, consequently Gerson will wait two more years for the community to grant him more land and thereby enable him to increase production.

This is his fourth loan with MFP and he will take responsibility for prompt repayment of this loan. He notes that he enjoys working with his communal bank, “Sol Naciente” because together they have avoided trouble thanks to their savings. With this money, he will be able to purchase coffee seeds, organic fertilizer and bags to prepare nurseries for his coffee seedlings, which he will plant in the empty spaces of his parcel.

loans.use: to buy coffee seeds, fertilizer and to make nursery beds for his coffee.

loans.name: Darwin

texts.es:
Darwin tiene 24 años, es soltero, pero tiene una hija de tres años. Vive solo en una casita rústica que construyó en la comunidad nativa Boca del Ipoki, Chanchamayo.
