Hace 5 años que se dedica a la agricultura con el cultivo de café, plátano y paltas. Gracias a sus padres y a la comunidad consiguió ocho parcelas de terrenos. “Tengo ocho cuadras plantadas de café, pero solo dos parcelas se está cosechando”, menciona.  Las paltas las cultiva en media parcela y los plátanos que crecen entre el café. A veces por el intenso calor las hojas de café sufren quemaduras o enfermedades, pero gracias a las hojas grandes del platanal se puede mantener con cuidado estos cultivos. Este año obtuvo 25 sacos de café en la cosecha, el año pasado 20 y espera obtener para el próximo año como 30 o 35 sacos. Le va muy bien. Todo se lo debe a su esfuerzo. Entre sus metas están formalizar su familia, por eso piensa traer a su hijo y a su pareja a su hogar.

Este es su crédito número 6 con MFP y promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente”, un grupo de personas solidarias y trabajadoras.
Invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de bolsas de fertilizantes cuyo precio es de 125 nuevos soles por saco; requiere como 15 sacos para sus 8 parcelas de café.
texts.en:
Darwin is 24 years old and single, but he has a three-year-old daughter. He lives alone in a small rustic house, which he built in the native community of  Boca del Ipoki, in Chanchamayo.

He has been farming for five years. He grows coffee, plaintains, and avocados. Thanks to his parents and the community he was able to acquire eight plots of land. "I have twelve acres of coffee plants, but only two plots are being harvested," he mentions. He grows the avocados on half a plot, and the plaintains grow between the coffee plants. Sometimes, because of intense heat, the leaves of the coffee plants suffer burns or diseases, but thanks to the large leaves of the plaintains you can carefully maintain both crops. This year he obtained 25 sacks of coffee beans from his crops, last year it was 20, and next year he is expecting to obtain 30 to 35 sacks. Things are going very well and he ows it all to his effort. One of his goals is to formalize his family situation, which is why he plans on bringing his son and his partner to live with him. 

This is his sixth loan with MFP, and he promises to make his monthly payments on time. He belongs to the communal bank Sol Naciente, a group of supportive and hard-working people.

He will invest the money from this loan in purchasing bags of fertilizer, which cost 125 nuevos soles each. He needs about fifteen sacks for his twelve acres of coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
Yovana tiene 22 años, es una joven soltera que vive con su hermanito y su madre en una casita rústica, ubicada en la comunidad nativa Boca del Ipoki.
A su edad ya lleva la responsabilidad de apoyar en casa con los ingresos económicos. Con mucho esfuerzo y con la ayuda de su madre instaló una tienda de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad como víveres, comestibles, bebidas y golosinas en su misma vivienda. Con lo que obtiene puede solventar sus estudios, ya que ella anhela ser una profesora de niños. Y como si fuera poco, también mantiene a su hermanito con sus gastos escolares. Su madre posee terrenos de cultivos donde cosecha café y frutas cítricas, de esas ventas también cubren sus necesidades. Yovana no es conformista y sus metas son claras, para lograr concluir sus estudios tendrá que trabajar, por eso ahora piensa abrir un negocio de comidas para ofrecer alimentos a los profesores de su comunidad.

Este es su préstamo número 4 con MFP y confirma su compromiso de pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente”, del que se siente a gusto por tener compañeros con las mismas ansias de superación. 
Invertirá este dinero en la compra de productos de primera necesidad como víveres y comestibles (arroz, azúcar, aceite, enlatados, gaseosas, etc.). Además comprará platos, cubiertos y ollas para iniciar con su negocio de comidas.
texts.en:
Yovana is a 22-year-old single woman who lives with her mother and little brother in their rustic little house, which is located in the native community of Boca del Ipoki.

At her age she already is responsible for supporting the family through her income.  With a great deal of effort and with the help of her mother, she started a home-based grocery store that sells things such as produce, household products, candy and drinks.  With what she makes she is able to pay her college fees; she hopes to become a school teacher.  And if that wasn't enough, she also covers her little bother's school expenses.

Her mother has some land where she grows coffee and citrus fruits.  From selling these crops she also helps to cover the household expenses.  Yovana is not a conformist, and her goals are clear.  In order to finish her studies she will have to work; for this reason she wants to open a business selling food   to the local teachers in her community.

This is her fourth loan with MSP, and she has promised to make her monthly payments on time.  She belongs to the communal bank "Sol Naciente".   She is happy to be in the company of others who have the same strong motivation to reach their goals.

She will use the loan proceeds to purchase rice, sugar, oil, canned goods, sodas and other items to supply her store.  She will also buy plates and utensils as well as pots and pans so that she can start her food business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, canned goods and other items to supply her store.

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es:
Wilder tiene 29 años, su pareja es Nancy, con quien tiene dos hijos de 6 y 4 años. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en una comunidad nativa de Chanchamayo.
Se dedica a la agricultura desde los 21 años, con la producción de café y cacao. “Este año el precio del cacao no estaba tan bueno, de los 6 soles del año pasado bajo hasta 4 soles”, menciona, un poco decepcionado. Pero afirma que con el café y su esfuerzo siempre sale de esos inconvenientes. En el caso del café, este año cosechó 20 sacos y confía que para el próximo año será de 30. Wilder trabaja en otras parcelas cuando no tiene mucho que hacer. Así gana como 30 soles al día por apoyar en las cosechas o por hacer limpiezas de cultivos. Él ansía ver a su familia progresar, por eso se esmerará en la mejora de sus productos y en la ampliación de sus parcelas.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y agradece la oportunidad de trabajar con la entidad, por su parte se muestra entusiasta al formar parte del banco comunal “Sol Naciente”.
Con este dinero podrá comprar herbicidas para eliminar la mala hierba que crece alrededor de sus cultivos. Además pagará a jornaleros quienes limpiarán sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Wilder is 29 and lives with his common-law wife Nancy, with whom he has two children aged 4 and 6.  They live in their own house in the native community of Chanchamayo.

He has been a farmer since he was 21.  He grows coffee and cocoa.  "This year the price of cocoa was not very good; it went from 6 soles last year down to 4 soles this year", he says, a little bit disappointed.  But he affirms that with his coffee crops and his efforts, he always overcomes such inconveniences.  In the case of coffee, this year he harvested 20 bags, and he is confident that next year he will harvest 30.

Wilder works in others' fields when there is not much to do on his own land.  In this way he is able to earn 30 soles each day to support his own harvests or to hire workers to clear his parcels of weeds. He is anxious to see his family progress.  For this reason he will take pains to improve his products and to be able to expand his plots.

This is his first loan with MFP, and he is grateful for the opportunity to work with the organization.  He is enthusiastic about being part of the communal bank “Sol Naciente”.

With these funds he will be able to buy herbicides to eliminate weeds that grow among his crops.  Also, he will pay day laborers to help clear his fields of weeds.

loans.use: to buy herbicides to eliminate weeds that grow among his crops.

loans.name: Sherlyn

texts.es:
Sherlyn tiene 20 años, su pareja es Rubén, con quien tiene un hijo de 8 meses de nacido. Ellos viven en una casa rústica, pero propia, ubicada en la comunidad nativa Boca del Ipoki, Chanchamayo.

Hace 2 años que se dedica a la agricultura, con el cultivo de frutos cítricos de distintas variedades como: naranjas, mandarinas, tanyelo (híbrido) y tanyarinas (híbrido). Además tiene parcelas de plátanos que el año pasado sembró, ahora ya empezará a coger los primeros frutos.
El negocio de los cítricos le da muchas satisfacciones, pero hay meses en que el precio baja casi en un 50%, por eso esta vez está pensando iniciar un cultivo de café, para ello requiere de mucho apoyo. Pero para ver los primeros frutos de su cafetal tendrán que pasar 3 años. Ella esperará con paciencia mientras coseche el plátano y los cítricos.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se siente entusiasmada por la oportunidad. Además acaba de formar parte del banco comunal “Sol Naciente”, cree que con puntualidad y constancia sus metas como grupo se concretarán.
Con este dinero podrá comprar plantas de café en viveros, cuyo precio es de 30 céntimos por planta; comprará alrededor de 900 plantitas para una parcela.
texts.en:
Sherlyn is 20 years old. Her partner is Rubén, with whom she has an eight month old son. They live in a rustic house, their own, located in the indigenous community Boca del Ipoki, in Chanchamayo.

She has been farming for two years, growing different varieties of citrus fruits such as oranges, mandarins, tangelos (hybrid) and tangerines (hybrid). She also has plots of bananas she planted last year and she will already begin picking their first fruits.

The citrus business gives her great satisfaction but there are months when the price drops almost 50%. Consequently, this time she is planning to start growing coffee and to do so she will require a great deal of support. In order to harvest her first coffee crops she will have to wait three years. She is prepared to wait patiently while harvesting her bananas and citrus fruits.

This is Sherlyn’s first loan with MFP and she is enthusiastic about the opportunity. She just joined the “Sol Naciente” Communal Bank and believes that the goals of the group will be met promptly and consistently.

With this money, she will be able to purchase coffee plant nurseries whose price is 30 céntimes per plant; she will buy around 900 plants for her parcel.

loans.use: to purchase 900 young coffee plants.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Nuestro socio  es el señor  Arturo, él pertenece al banco comunal “Ricchary Runa” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestro socio sigue con su actividad de servicio de mudanzas, trabajo que realiza con su vehículo hace mucho tiempo y con este puede mantener a su familia y terminar de construir su casa, por ello en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar yeso y realizar trabajos de recubrimiento de paredes.
Arturo está muy agradecido con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse en su actividad y por apoyarlo con su familia y por concretar su sueño de terminar de construir su casa.
El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Our partner is Mr. Arturo. He belongs to the communal bank “Ricchary Runa” from the city of Cusco - Perú. Arturo keeps providing moving services, work he has been doing with his vehicle for a long time now, and that helps him to support his family and finish building his house. This is why, this time, he will invest the loan requested to buy plaster and cover the walls. Arturo is very thankful to Kiva for allowing him to keep doing his business activity and to support him with his family, and fulfilling his dream of finishing the construction of his house. Arturo is thankful for the loan and commits to making all the repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to finish his house and to buy plaster for finishings

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Rosa, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Ricchary Runa” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se dedica a la comercialización de productos de artesanías, ella compra y vende articulos como adornos, tapices y platería, actividad que viene realizando hace mucho tiempo y los distribuye en los centros artesanales mas representativos de la ciudad, y que le permite sacar adelante a su familia y proporcionar mejor educacion a sus hijos los cuales dependen de su actividad directamenrte. Rosa en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar elementos de plata y cerámica.
Rosa está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y ayudarla a mantener y desarrollarse en sus actividades económicas.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Rosa belongs to communal bank “Ricchary Runa” from the city of Cusco – Perú. Rosa sells handicrafts for a living. She buys and sells items such as, ornaments, tapestries and silverware. She has been doing this for a long time, and distributes the items in the most important crafts centers of the city. This allows her to support her family and provide a better education for her children, who rely directly on her activity. Rosa, this time, will invest the requested loan to buy silver and ceramic elements. Rosa is very thankful to Kiva for allowing her to provide her family with a better quality of living and for helping her to keep doing and developing her financial activities. Rosa is thankful for the loan and commits to making the repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as pottery ornaments

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor tiene 40 años, está casada y tiene dos hijos. Esta familia vive en la casa que construyeron con el esfuerzo de varios años de trabajo. 
Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde su juventud. Ahora, ella y su esposo cuentan con terrenos que compraron gracias a los años de trabajo constante, ahí siembran maíz, arvejas, papas, alfalfa, flores y otras verduras. “Los choclos (maíz tierno) de la zona son bien grandes y jugosos, por eso hay compradores que prefieren llevarse mi cosecha”, menciona orgullosa de sus logros.
Tiene pendiente sembrar un poco de arvejas y maíz, dentro de dos meses se inician las lluvias y deberá realizar mayor esfuerzo. Mientras tanto, mantiene a su familia con la venta de los cuyes que cría.

Este es su préstamo número 14 con MFP, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza de Huaylahuichán”, es una de las socias más antiguas, por eso muestra mucho agradecimiento por tanta confianza.
Leonor iniciará una siembra de arvejas y maíz, invertirá 2000 soles en semillas y 1000 soles en fertilizantes. Lo sobrante será para adquirir pastos y alimento balanceado para sus cuyes.
texts.en: Leonor is 40 years old, and is married with two children. Her family lives in the house that they built with a great deal of effort over several years of work. She has been a farmer since the days of her youth. Currently she and her husband have land that they were able to buy thanks to years of constant work. There they grow corn, peas, potatoes, alfalfa and other vegetables. "The choclo (tender corn) in the area grows large and juicy; because of this there are customers who prefer to buy from me", she proudly says. She is planning to plant some peas and corn. Within the next two months the rains will start and she will have to work harder. In the meantime, she is supporting her family by selling the guinea pigs that she raises. This is her fourteenth loan with MFP. She belongs to the communal bank “Nueva Esperanza de Huaylahuichán”. This is one of the oldest communal banks in existence. She is very thankful to have such support from them. She will start planting peas and corn. She will invest 2000 soles in seeds and 1000 in fertilizer. The rest of the funds will be used to by grass and balanced feed for her guinea pigs.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer, as well as feed for her guinea pigs.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 22-year-old single man who works in the power supply/generators business. He was very young when he started working to help his parents financially. He bought his own generator and started providing electricity to villagers. Hassan is well known in the region for his hard work and good reputation. He works hard to develop himself and his business. Electricity is a major problem in Lebanon, with no hints that it will end. Hassan applied for a Youth Loan in order to make necessary maintenance to his power supply cables. He wants to keep his customers satisfied with the best quality of electricity he can provide. Hassan hopes to expand his business through increasing his generators to cover nearby villages.

loans.use: To make necessary maintenance to his power supply cables

loans.name: Wa Keur Anta Group

texts.fr:
WA KEUR ANTA est un groupe de cinq femmes qui s'activent dans le commerce de produits ménagers tels que le savon, les détergents pour le nettoyage et d'autres articles divers.Trois des femmes sont mariées alors que les deux autres sont célibataires.Les revenus qu'elles tirent de cette activité leur permet de subvenir à leurs propres besoins mais également à certains besoins de leurs familles.Le chef du groupe (au milieu, qui porte un sac et qui a la main levée), tient une boutique au marché central.Elle est mère de quatre enfants dont elles paient les frais de scolarité et d'habillement.
Le groupe sollicite un pret de 500 000f pour renforcer son fonds de commerce en achetant des produits ménagers.
Le groupe ambitionne de faire des voyages de commerce dans certains pays de la sous- région.
texts.en: WA KEUR ANTA is a group of five women who are active in the sale of household cleaning products such as soap, detergents for cleaning and a variety of other items. Three of the women are married while the other two are celibate. The income that they receive from this business allows them to meet their own needs and equally to meet certain of their families' needs. The head of the group (in the middle, who is carrying a bag and has her hand raised), has a shop at the central market. She is mother to four children for whom she pays the school fees and clothing expenses. The group is requesting a loan of 500,000f to strengthen their business by buying household cleaning products. The group aims to make business trips in certain countries of the subregion.

loans.use: to buy household cleaning products.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 60 años, está casada con Félix, con quien tiene cuatro hijos, pero ya son independientes. Ella y su esposo viven juntos en una casita rústica ubicada en la comunidad nativa Boca del Ipoki, Chanchamayo.
Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en la misma carretera principal, en la entrada de su comunidad y por estar en un lugar estratégico sus resultados son favorables. Lleva 8 años en este negocio, ya que antes se dedicaba a la agricultura y consciente de que sus fuerzas ya no son las mismas decidió abrir su tienda. Por su parte, su esposo se dedica a las actividades del campo con el cultivo de café y cacao. Además, como descuidaron algunas parcelas prefieren alquilarlas a otros agricultores y así no perder ingresos. “Me va bien en mi bodega, porque también ofrezco verduras, carnes, queso, condimentos y otros; por eso siempre tengo clientela”, menciona orgullosa. Margarita espera tener los ahorros suficientes, producto de sus actividades, para asegurarse una vida plena en su ancianidad, mientras tanto trabajará como la hace hasta ahora, con mucho esmero. 

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por ello promete pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. “Sol Naciente”, es el nombre de su banco comunal, donde acude a las reuniones y participa activamente.
Invertirá este dinero en la compra de productos de primera necesidad como verduras y carnes, abarrotes, víveres, golosinas, gaseosas, etc., para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Margarita is 60 years old and married to Felix with whom she has four children, all of whom are independent. She and her husband live in a small rustic house located in the indigenous community Boca del Ipoki, Chanchamayo.

She has a grocery store on the main road at the entrance to the community, which is a strategic location and generates a favorable bottom line. She has had the business for 8 years. Previously, she was a farmer, however aware that her energy level was not the same, she decided to open her store. Her husband still works in the fields, cultivating coffee and cocoa. Moreover, as they neglected some of their parcels, they preferred to rent them to other farmers and thus not lose income. 

“My store is doing well, because I also sell vegetables, meat, cheese, condiments and other items. Consequetly, I always have customers,” Margarita says proudly. She expects to have sufficient savings, a product of her business, so that she can assure herself a full life in her old age. Meanwhile, she will work as she always has, very carefully. 

This is her third loan with MFP and she promises to repay it promptly according to the monthly timetable. “Sol Naciente” is the name of her communal bank, where she attends meetings and participates actively. She will invest this money in the purchase of staples like vegetables and meat, groceries, provisions, candy, soft drinks, etc. in order to stock her store.

loans.use: to purchase more products to stock her store (groceries, drinks, provisions, candy, etc.).

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Ibrahima est un homme marié, père de trois enfants.Il tient une boutique de vente de chaussures et de bonnets.L'activité lui rapporte des revenus assez importants surtout pendant les périodes de fête.Il parvient ainsi à subvenir à l'essentiel des besoins de sa famille et à ses propres besoins.Afin de renforcer son stock et bien préparer la fête de la fin du mois de ramadan, il sollicite un pret de 400000f pour acheter des caisses de chaussures et de bonnets.Il ambitionne de se lancer dans le commerce en gros.
texts.en: Ibrahima is a married man, father to three children. He tends a shop selling shoes and bonnets. The business brings in fairly significant revenue especially during holiday seasons. Thus he manages to meet his family's essential needs and his own needs. In order to strengthen his stock and prepare well for the ramadan festivities at the end of the month, he is requesting a loan of 400,000f to buy boxes of shoes and bonnets. He aims to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy boxes of shoes and bonnets.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is married and has three children. Linda sells onions and smoked fish in Adum Banso, near Takoradi. She has been doing this for 11 years. Her husband is a farmer. 

Linda uses her income to pay for her children’s school fees and other household expenses. Linda will use the loan to buy more onions in bulk. 

With the new profits, she intends to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more onions in bulk.

loans.name: Sombrerito Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento SOMBRERITO, Está  compuesto por diez integrantes ocho mujeres y dos varones,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Roxana tiene 32 años, y dos hijos que son de las edades de 5 y 8 años,  La Sra. Roxana se dedica  a la   venta de frutas según la temporada, ella tiene un puesto fijo en uno de los mercados más concurridos de la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Roxana va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de fruta de temporada por mayor como ser cítricos para combatir esta época de invierno y de esta manera brindar variedad de frutas  a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Roxana va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de frutas según la temporada, la Sra. Roxana es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en: The "Sombrerito" ("Little Hat") communal bank is comprised of ten members, eight women and two men. The leader of the group is Roxana, who's 32 years old and has two children aged 5 and 8. Roxana sells fruits that are in season. She has a regular stand in one of the busiest markets in the town of Santa Cruz, where she sells her products. This loan is her third one with the institution. Roxana will use this loan to purchase in-season fruits by wholesale, such as citrus fruit, in order to fight the winter. That way she'll provide a variety of fruits for her customers and increase her profits. The reason why she requests this loan is to keep on improving her business. Roxana will use the profits to continue buying various fruits according to the season. Roxana is a very hardworking person. She feels happy for the opportunity that she and her fellow group members are getting, since in some cases they support their families single-handedly.

loans.use: to purchase in-season fruits.

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr:
Aïssatou exerce un commerce de produits alimentaires.Elle tient une table au marché de sa localité et propose à ses clients divers produits.Cette activité lui permet de prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien de ses trois enfants notamment les frais de scolarité, de santé et les dépenses vestimentaires.Actuellement,elle sollicite un pret de 400 000f pour acheter des arachide, des haricots, des légumes et d'autres denrées de consommation courante.
Elle ambitionne de construire une boutique pour élargir sa capacité de vente.
texts.en: Aïssatou has a business selling food products. She tends a table at the market of her locale and offers a variety of products to her clients. This business allows her to take responsibility for the expenses to support her three children notably the school fees, healthcare and clothing expenses. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 400,000f to buy groundnuts, beans, vegetables and other regularly consumed foodstuffs. She aims to build a shop to expand her capacity to sell.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts, beans, vegetables and other regularly consumed foodstuffs.

loans.name: Habib

texts.en: Habib is 37 years old. He is a father of six children between the ages of 2 and 13. He sells charcoal and has been in the business since 2008. He has requested the loan to add more charcoal for resale. The profits from the business are expected to be used for renovating the house.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Georgine

texts.en: Georgine is a mother of one child who is 4 years old. She is 30 years old. She owns a boutique where she sells different items; she has been running the business for four years. With the loan she wants to buy more rice, maize flour, and sugar for resale. The profits from the business will be used for savings. She testifies that the previous loan helped her and the business to reach a good level of success. She hopes to use the new loan to invest in the business for a better future.

loans.use: to buy more rice, maize flour, and sugar to resell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is divorced and has five children. She operates a provisions store in Adum Banso, near Takoradi. She has done this for quite some time. Florence uses her income to pay her children’s school fees and other household expenses. 

Florence will use the loan to purchase more provisions in bulk, such as milk, eggs, Milo (a brand of malted milk), and other food items. With the new profits, she intends to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions in bulk, such as milk, eggs, Milo, and other food items.

loans.name: Las Luchadoras De Masisea Group

texts.es:
GRUPO LAS LUCHADORAS DE MASISEA
La señora Neida, es socia y presidenta del banco comunal “Las Luchadoras de Masisea” del Distrito de Masisea, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y tiene seis hijos,  solo dos de ellos están a  su cargo. Se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles. Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 700.00 comprará: 1 saco de arroz, 1 caja de aceite, 1 caja de leche, 3 sacos de sal, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 paquete de aceite, 1 paquete de harina, de esta manera estará asegurando el pago de las cuotas a Manuela Ramos. Este grupo está conformado por 22 socias, las cuales solicitan préstamos para poder comprar más mercadería para sus negocios, como por ejemplo: la señora Elida con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00, Maruja S/. 600.00, Earine S/. 400.00, Lucero S/. 500.00, Josefa S/. 500.00, Reyna S/. 500.00, Jeny S/. 600.00, Eroditha S/. 500.00, luz S/. 500.00, Danny S/. 1000.00, Teófila S/.300.00, Carmen S/. 800.00, Margarita S/. 500.00, Juana S/. 1,000.00, María Justina S/. 600.00, María Salome S/. 500.00, María Elsa S/.400.00, Cinthia S/. 500.00, Yrene S/. 800.00, Noly S/. 500.00, Ercilia S/. 800.00.
Casi todas viajan a la ciudad para cobrar sus préstamos y aprovechar en comprar su mercadería. Están muy agradecidas a Manuela Ramos porque gracias a los préstamos tienen el capital que tanto necesitaban para seguir trabajando y generando sus propios ingresos para que sus hijos tengan una buena educación y sean buenas personas.
texts.en:
Neida is a member and the leader of the communal bank "Las Luchadoras de Masisea" ("The Fighters from Masisea"). She's 43 years old and married. She has six children, only two of whom are under her care. She sells foodstuffs, and with her new loan of 700 nuevos soles she will purchase a sack of rice, a box of olive oil, a box of milk, three sacks of salt, a sack of sugar, a packet of olive oil, a packet of flour. That way she'll be ensuring her repayments to Manuela Ramos. This group is comprised of 22 members who request loans in order to buy more merchandise for their businesses, such as Elida, with her new loan of 500 nuevos soles; Maruja, 600 nuevos soles; Earine, 400 nuevos soles; Lucero, 500 nuevos soles; Josefa, 500 nuevos soles; Reyna, 500 nuevos soles; Jeny, 600 nuevos soles; Eroditha, 500 nuevos soles; Luz 500 nuevos soles; Danny, 1000 nuevos soles; Teófila, 300 nuevos soles; Carmen, 800 nuevos soles; Margarita, 500 nuevos soles; Juana, 1000 nuevos soles; María Justina, 600 nuevos soles; María Salome, 500 nuevos soles; María Elsa, 400 nuevos soles; Cinthia, 500 nuevos soles; Yrene, 800 nuevos soles; Noly, 500 nuevos soles; Ercilia, 800 nuevos soles.
Almost all of them travel into town for collecting their loans, and they take that opportunity to purchase their merchandise. They're very thankful to Manuela Ramos, because thanks to the loans they get the capital they so needed. They need it in order to keep on working and getting an income of their own, so that their children get a good education and become good people.

loans.use: to purchase varied merchandise.

loans.name: Franklin Rolando

texts.es:
A sus 21 años, Franklin tiene ya un negocio de 7 años. Actualmente reside en la ciudad de Latacunga. Latacunga es capital del la provincia del Cotopaxi que está en la Sierra Central del Ecuador. Latacunga cuenta con un clima templado y una temperatura promedio de 12°C. Latacunga está ubicada en las faldas del volcán activo más alto del mundo, el Cotopaxi, y ha sido destruida 3 veces por las erupciones del mismo de la fundación de la ciudad. Latacunga es conocida por su arquitectura colonial y su bello paisaje de la cordillera de los andes. 

Franklin es un joven emprendedor que se dedica a vender pintura y es también pintor. Por el momento, es soltero y no tiene hijos por lo tanto pone muchas de sus energías en su negocio. Frankiln trabaja 8 horas al día. Él solicita un préstamo a Kiva por medio de Fundación Alternativa para poder mejorar su taller y comprar más pintura para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y más variedad de productos. Así el podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida, ayudar a su familia, y quizá empezar la suya propia en un futuro.
texts.en:
At his age of 21, Franklin has already had a business for 7 years. He now lives in the city of Latacunga. Latacungs is the capital of the province of Cotopaxi, which is in the Central Sierra of Ecuador. Latacunga has a mild climate and an average temperature of 12°C (39°F). Latacunga is located on the skirts of the highest active volcano in the world, Cotopaxi, and has been destroyed to its foundations three times by its eruptions. Latacunga is known for its colonial architecture and its beautiful scenery of the cordillera of the Andes.

Franklin is a young entrepreneur who sells paintings and is also a painter. At this time, he is single and has no children, and so he puts much of his energy into his business. Franklin works 8 hours a day. He is applying to Kiva through Fundación Alternativa for a loan to improve his workshop and buy more paint in order to offer better service to his customers and have a greater variety of products. Thus he will be able to have a better quality of life, help his family, and perhaps begin his own (family) in the future.

loans.use: to improve his workshop and buy more paint

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna tiene 42 años, junto a su pareja tiene dos hijos. Su casa está ubicada en el anexo Huaylahuichán en Tarma.
Cada día, después de atender a sus hijos y esposo, se dirige a sus campos de cultivos, ya que se dedica a la agricultura hace 22 años. Sus principales cultivos constan de maíz y arvejas, para ello cuenta con terrenos que compró gracias a mucho esfuerzo. Pero hay temporadas de siembra que requieren más terreno, por eso también arrienda, especialmente en los meses de setiembre, octubre y noviembre. “Estos meses las ventas son buenas porque los compradores llegan de distintas partes del país”, menciona. Su esposo la apoya en esta cansada actividad, pero también contrata operarios, porque a veces ellos no pueden cubrir con todas las actividades.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y se siente contenta de trabajar con el banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza - Huaylahuichán”, porque puede ahorrar.
Reyna invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de semillas de maíz y arvejas (1500 nuevos soles), lo restante será para adquirir fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Reyna is 42 years old, and she and her husband have two children. She lives in the village of Huaylahuichán in Tarma.
Every day, after taking care of her children and husband, she heads out to her fields, which she's been working for 22 years. Her main crops are corn and peas, and she worked hard to be able to buy her land. But during some planting seasons she needs more land, so she also rents, especially from September to November. "I get good sales those months," she says, "because buyers come from all over the country." Her husband helps her with this exhausting work, but she also hires helpers because the two of them can't always take care of everything between them.

This is her third loan with MFP, and she likes working with the Nueva Esperanza – Huaylahuichán village bank because she is able to save money.
Reyna will use 1500 soles of this loan to buy corn and pea seeds; she will use the rest to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma tiene 63 años, está casada con Antonio, con quien tiene cuatro hijos, pero que ya son independientes. Ellos viven en la casa que construyeron a base de mucho esfuerzo y se ubica en el anexo rural Huaylahuichán.
Ella cuenta con parcelas de terrenos que heredó de su familia, ahí siembra maíz, papa, arveja y flores (gladiolos). También cría gallinas, cerdos y carneros, los que comercializa en mayores cantidades en las ferias semanales las ciudades aledañas. Su esposo la ayuda en cada actividad que realiza y se siente feliz de tener ese respaldo. “Ahora vamos a cosechar un poco de arvejas, pero ya empezaremos con la temporada fuerte”, menciona. Norma piensa en el futuro, sabe que su esposo y ella ya no tendrán las mismas fuerzas más adelante, por eso se esmeran en sus ahorros y en una actividad más descansada que es la crianza de cuyes.

Este es su crédito número 9 con MFP, por eso se siente comprometida en pagar las cuotas de manera puntual. “Nueva Esperanza - Huaylahuichán” es el nombre de su banco comunal y se siente contenta de pertenecer a uno de los grupos más sólidos de la provincia.
Norma iniciará con otras siembras este mes, por ello el dinero de este préstamo lo destinará a la compra de semillas de arvejas y bolsas de fertilizantes para sus cultivos de maíz y arvejas.
texts.en:
Norma is 63 years old. She and her husband Antonio have four adult children. They live in the house they built with great effort in the village of Huaylahuichán. Norma inherited some plots of land from her family. She uses them to grow corn, potatoes, peas, and flowers (gladiolus). She also raises chickens, pigs, and sheep, which she sells wholesale in the weekly markets in nearby towns. Her husband helps her with her business, and she is grateful for his support. "We're about to harvest some peas, but the really hard season is coming up," she says. Norma thinks about the future. She knows she and her husband will not be as strong in the years to come, so they make an effort to save money and also dedicate themselves to a less demanding business: raising guinea pigs.
This is her ninth loan with MFP, and she is determined to make her payments on time. She belongs to the Nueva Esperanza - Huaylahuichán village bank, and she enjoys belonging to one of the most supportive groups in the province. Norma will be planting this month, and she will use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her corn and pea crops.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 54 años, vive con su esposo Benjamín y dos de sus hijos.
Ella es agricultora. Todos los días empieza el día rodeada de su familia para atenderlos y luego se dirige hacia sus cultivos donde tiene sembrado arvejas, habas, maíz, papas, alfalfa y otros. Está contenta con su trabajo porque sabe que todo lo que obtiene es fruto de su esfuerzo. Ahora tiene pendiente la cosecha de una parcela de arvejas, las que después de cosecharlas, trasladará al mercado mayorista. Lleva más de 30 años en esta actividad y menciona que es demasiado sacrificada pero tiene su recompensa, pues de esa manera ha logrado educar a sus hijos mayores y hace lo mismo con los dos pequeños.

Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en pagar las cuotas mensuales con puntualidad. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza Huaylahuichán”, donde es la presidenta de la junta directiva e inspira a sus compañeros a participar.
María volverá a sembrar arvejas, por eso invertirá este dinero en la compra de cuatro bolsas de semillas de arvejas (usará 2400 soles), con lo restante adquirirá fertilizantes.
texts.en:
María is 54 years old. She lives with her husband, Benjamín, and two of their children.
She is a farmer. She starts every day looking after her family and then heads out to the fields, where she's planted peas, beans, corn, potatoes, alfalfa, and other crops. She likes her work because she knows that everything she produces is the fruit of her labor. The pea harvest is coming up, and after the harvest she will transport the peas to the wholesale market. She's been working as a farmer for more than 30 years, and she says it's difficult but rewarding work, because it's allowed her to educate all of her children.

This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she is committed to making her monthly payments on time. She is a member of the Nueva Esperanza - Huaylahuichán village bank, where she is the president of the board and inspires her fellow members to participate.
María will be planting peas again, so she will invest 2400 soles from this loan in buying four bags of seed; she will use the rest to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Reinaldo Eliecer

texts.es:
Reinaldo vive en la ciudad de Latacunga, capital de la provincia del Cotopaxi. Latacunga está ubicada en la Sierra central del Ecuador en las faldas del volcán activo más alto del mundo, el Cotopaxi. El mismo que ha destruida a la ciudad tres veces en su historia. Latacunga tiene un clima templado y una temperatura promedio de 12°C. La ciudad se caracteriza por su hermoso paisaje que consta de una mescla de arquitectura colonial y una vista privilegiada de parte de la Cordillera de los Andes. La ciudad es también reconocida por ser gran representante del folklor ecuatoriana en varias tradiciones y festividades tales como “La Mama Negra” que cuenta con una mescla de cultura española, indígena, y afro ecuatoriana. 

Reinaldo tiene 52 años y vive con su esposa de 47 y un hijo menor de edad. Reinaldo nunca continuó sus estudios secundarios, pero de todas formas decidió salir adelante sacando adelante un negocio que ya tiene 2 años. Reinaldo se dedica al servicio de taxi. El trabaja 12 horas diarias para sacar adelante a su familia por medio de los ingresos que proporciona su servicio. Lastimosamente, el carro que usa no está en las mejores condiciones. Por lo tanto, Reinaldo solicita un préstamos a Kiva por medio de fundación alternativa para poder arreglar y dar mantenimiento al su vehículo.  De esta manera, el podrá tener ingresos seguros e incluso incrementarlos. Así, el podrá brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y un mejor futuro a su hijo.
texts.en:
Reinaldo lives in the city of Latacunga, the capital of the province of Cotopaxi. Latacunga is located in the central highland of Ecuador at the foot of the most active volcano in the world, Cotopaxi, the same one that has destroyed the city three times in its history. Latacunga has a temperate climate and an average temperature of 12°C. The city is known for its beautiful countryside that consists of a mixture of colonial architecture and a beautiful view of part of the Andes mountain range. The city is also known for being a great representative of Ecuadorian folklore in various traditions and festivities such as "La Mama Negra" (The Black Mother) which depends on a mixture of Spanish, Indigenous, and African culture.

Reinaldo is 52 years old and lives with his spouse of 47 and his minor son. Reinaldo never finished high school, but nonetheless decided to push through by creating his own business that is now two years old. Reinaldo works as a taxi driver. He works 12 hours per day in order to provide for his family by means of the income he makes with his service. Unfortunately, the car that he uses is not in the best of conditions. As a result, Reinaldo is asking for a loan from Kiva by way of "fundación alternativa" in order to be able to fix and maintain his vehicle. This way, he will be able to have a secure income and be able to increase them. So, he will be able to bring a better quality of life to his family and a better future to his son.

loans.use: to be able to fix and maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Gabino

texts.es:
Gabino tiene 54 años, es un hombre soltero y vive con su anciana madre a la que cuida con mucho cariño. Además educa a su hermano menor, los tres viven en la casa que es propiedad de su padre y se ubica en el anexo de Huaylahuichán.

Toda su vida la consagró al cuidado de sus hermanos menores y ahora de su madre. Se dedica a la agricultura desde que era niño, por eso adquirió buena experiencia que se ve reflejada en sus buenas producciones. Cultiva arvejas, maíz y papas, pero las arvejas le traen mayores satisfacciones. Siembra en terrenos que arrienda de otros campesinos, por eso su producción es abundante. “Son muchos años que trabajo así, por eso tengo que contratar camiones para bajar mi cosecha hasta el mercado”, dice. Las ventajas que tiene son los contactos con los compradores, quienes ya lo conocen y trasladan las hortalizas hacia la ciudad de Lima. Le agrada su trabajo y piensa continuar labrando la tierra por mucho tiempo.

Este es su crédito número 7 con MFP, por ello se responsabiliza de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. 
Con el dinero solicitado podrá comprar tres bolsas de semillas de arvejas. Le faltará un monto de 400 soles que completará con unos ahorros.
texts.en:
Gabino is 54 years old. He is a single man and lives with his aged mother, whom he cares for with much devotion. In addition, he is educating his younger brother. The three of them live in the house that belongs to his father and is located in the annex of Huaylahuichán.

He has devoted all his life to the care of his younger siblings and now to his mother. He has worked in agriculture since he was a boy, and through this he acquired good experience which is reflected in his good production. He raises peas, corn, and potatoes, but the peas bring him the greatest satisfaction. He plants on lands that he rents from other farmers, and so his production is abundant. "I have worked like this for many years, and so I have to hire trucks to take my harvest down to the market," he says. The advantages that he has are the contacts with the buyers, who already know him and transport his vegetables to the city of Lima. He likes his work and thinks he will continue farming the land for a long time.

This is his seventh loan with MFP, and for this reason he takes responsibility for being punctual in making his monthly payments. With the money that he is applying for, he will be able to buy three bags of seeds for peas. He will lack an amount of 400 PEN, which he will make up with some savings.

loans.use: to buy three bags of seeds for peas

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La señora Esther es socia del banco comunal “Amigas Por Siempre” del Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos.
Lleva doce años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, tiene una pequeña bodega y su esposo trabaja en una cervecería.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 3 cajas de galletas rellenita, 2 cajas de chocolate,  2 cajas de galleta soda, 2 bolsas de caramelo, 1 caja de chicle, 3 tiras de chizitos, 2 tiras de papitas, 4 paquetes de gaseosa.
Es muy poco lo que tiene en su negocio pero lo está  surtiendo, cada vez va aumentando los productos necesarios y los más solicitados,  está contenta porque cuenta con la ayuda económica de Manuela Ramos que cada ciclo lE está brindando el crédito que pide.
texts.en:
Esther is a member of the "Amigas Por Siempre" ("Friends Forever") communal bank of the district of Yarinacocha, department of Ucayali. She's 51 years old and married, and she has four children.
She's been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for twelve years. She owns a small grocery store and her husband works for a brewery.
With her new loan of 2000 nuevos soles she will purchase three boxes of cookies with filling, two boxes of chocolate, two boxes of crackers, two bags of candy, a box of chewing gum, three strips of cheetos, two strips of potato chips, four packets of soft drinks.
She has very few items in her business, bus she's increasingly stocking it up with more of the products that are most requested and needed. She's glad to count on the financial help from Manuela Ramos, which has been providing the loans she requests in each loan cycle.

loans.use: to purchase candy and soft drinks.

loans.name: Shokirjon

texts.en: Shokirjon likes to drive a lot. When he was young, he had a dream of being the best, and a rich, taxi driver. Now, he is trying to realize his childhood dream. He has his own car and serves the local people as a taxi driver. He is very sociable, and that’s why he has many clients. All of his clients are glad for him. He has a lovely wife, who tries to help him in all of his deals. They haven’t had any children yet. Shokirjon must repair his car to increase the quality of his services. He is asking a loan to repair his car. He would be happy if you could help him.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to be able to invest in the purchase of more merchandise.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Nuestro socio  es el señor  Efrain, él pertenece al banco comunal “Ricchary Runa” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestro socio sigue con su comercio de ganadería, trabajo que viene realizando hace mucho tiempo y con el cual pudo mantener a su familia y desarrollarse, por ello en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para capitalizar su actividad y comprar ganado vacuno para su posterio venta.
Efrain está muy agradecido con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse y desarrollarse en su actividad y por apoyarlo con el fortalecimiento y crecimiento económico de su familia.
El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This communal bank member is Señor Efrain. He belongs to the communal bank "Ricchary Runa" in the city of Cusco, Peru. He continues with his livestock business, which he has had for a long time and with which he has been able to support his family and develop. That is why he will invest the loan he is applying for now to capitalize his business by buying cattle for later sale.

Efrain is very grateful to Kiva for allowing him to maintain and develop his business and for supporting him with the strengthening and economic growth of his family.

He appreciates the loan and promises to make his payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en: Robinah is married with three children, and two of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (her sister and brother).   She has a beauty salon and has been in this business for 12 years.  She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of cosmetics, braids, and weaves. She generates additional income through selling used clothes. She rents a shop and works seven days a week. She sells to all categories of people on a retail basis.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and the increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda. She aspires to own a bridal salon and to build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids

loans.name: Valeria

texts.fr: Valéria est une femme de 41 ans,marié,mère de 06 enfants âgé entre 10 et 25 ans.Trois de ces derniers vont encore à l'école.elle est commerçante dans un marché de la capitale depuis 16 ans déjà où elle vend des vivres frais(plantains,manioc,ignames,noix de palmes)selon les saisons.Son activité fonctionne bien ,mais cependant il se pose le problème de l'insuffisance de ses marchandises par rapport à la demande car son capital ne lui permet guère de satisfaire cette clientèle de plus en plus grandissante.elle sollicite dont ce crédit afin de pouvoir acheter ses vivres en grande quantité ce qui lui permettra d'éviter les ruptures de stock permanentes mais également de satisfaire et augmenter sa clientèle et par conséquent ses bénéfices.bénéfices qui lui permettront d'étendre son activité et d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Valeria is a 41-year old woman, married and the mother of six children ranging from 10 to 25 years of age. Three of her children are still in school. For 16 years, she has been working as a vendor at one of the markets in her country's capital city, selling fresh food products (plantains, manioc [cassava], yams, palm nuts) depending on the season. Her business is going well; however, her capital barely permits her to meet growing customer demand, and she has difficulty maintaining sufficient level of stock. Therefore she is seeking a loan in order to buy food products in large quantity, which will allow her to avoid running out of stock, increasing her customer base and consequently her revenues. These revenues will allow her to grow her business and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods wholesale (cassava, palm nuts, yams, plantains).

loans.name: Cruz Del Pilar

texts.es:
Cruz del Pilar vive con su esposo y dos hijos en Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas , ubicada entre la Sierra y Costa ecuatoriana. Santo Domingo cuenta con un clima tropical húmedo con una temperatura promedio de 25.5°C. La ciudad es el enlace de varias carreteras que pases por ciudades importantes tales como Quito, Cuenca y Esmeraldas haciendo de Santo Domingo un punto clave del comercio ecuatoriano. Es más, la ciudad abarca la mayoría del mercado ganadero del país. Santo Domingo es el hogar del los Tsáchilas, un grupo étnico que mantiene el idioma, vestuario, entre otras tradiciones desde antes de la época colonial. 

Cruz del Pilar tiene 57 años y tiene un negocio de plantación de cacao que empezó hace 5 años. A pesar de las largas horas de trabajo que le pone al trabajo y la ayuda de su esposo, los ingresos no son suficientes para mantener a sus dos hijos, uno ya asiste a la escuela. Cruz del pilar tiene mucha experiencia en el tema, y tiene fe de que si invierte dinero y trabaja fuerte su negocio podrá salir adelante. Por lo tanto, Cruz del Pilar solicita a Kiva un préstamo para poder agrandar sus plantaciones y producir más cacao incrementado sus ventas y por lo tanto sus ingresos. Cruz del Pilar sabe que no va a ser fácil, pero ella quiere luchar y sacar su negocio adelante por sus dos hijos pequeños.
texts.en:
Cruz del Pilar lives with her husband and two children in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, located between the Ecuadorian coast and highlands. Santo Domingo has a humid tropical climate with an average temperature of 25.5°C. The city is the junction of various highways that pass through important cities such as Quito, Cuenca, and Esmeraldas, making Santo Domingo a key point for Ecuadorian trade. What's more, the city holds the majority of the country's livestock market. Santo Domingo is the home of the Tsáchilas, an ethnic group that maintains the language, clothing, and other traditions since before the colonial period.

Cruz de Pilar is 57 years old and has cocoa planting business that she started 5 years ago. In spite of the long hours that she works and the help of her husband, her income is not sufficient to maintain two children, one of whom already attends school. Cruz de Pilar has a lot of experience on the topic, and still has faith that if she invests money and works hard her business will succeed. As a result, Cruz del Pilar is asking Kiva for a loan to be able to enlarge her plantation and produce more cocoa, increasing her sales and, as a result, her income. Cruz del Pilar knows that it won't be easy, but she wants to fight and succeed with her business for her two small children.

loans.use: para comprar semillas y fertilizantes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize

loans.name: Herondine

texts.en:
Herondine is 39 years old and single. She takes care of one abandoned child who is 3 years old. She purchases and sells clothes and bags. She has been in this business for six years, and she currently employs two people to help her.

Herondine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more clothes and bags for resale. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and she will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and bags for resale.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.en: Bahodur has owned his business for more than three years. He has his own car and serves the local people as a taxi driver. He is very kind. Many of his friends help with business and love him very much. He has many clients and serves them well. Bahodur has a lovely wife and a little child. His wife doesn’t work and that is why he is only the only provider in the family. He wants to develop his business, but his car is broken. He is asking for a loan to repair his car. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Zaliya

texts.en:
Zaliya is married and has one child who doesn’t go to school. She takes care of additional family members (mother and father). 

Zaliya has a business of selling and frying chapats (a type of flat bread). She has been in this business for one year. She works from her home on a retail basis only and she works seven days a week.

Zaliya has applied for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shilling from MCDT SACCO to buy more cartons of wheat flour, baking powder, and cooking oil.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and ever increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. She aspires to own a big bakery.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and medication.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of wheat flour, cooking oil, and baking powder

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia sells cooking items and materials (fabrics) in Adum Banso, near Takoradi. She has been selling cooking items and materials for the past six years. Cecilia has received schooling through senior secondary school.  She is married and has one child. Her husband is a worker at a local palm oil plantation. Cecilia is responsible for paying her child’s school fees. Her loan will be used to buy to buy materials. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric materials.

loans.name: Sokleap's Group

texts.en:
Dambae distict of Kompong Cham province is one of a rural area in which rice farming is the common business for the majority of the villagers as the main source of income. Not different from other villagers, Sokleap is also a farmer and has two hectares of farmland for growing paddy rice. She additionally supplements her income via planting mango trees. 

She is a mother of three children, two daughters and one son, who are still in school and dependent on her. She has been with these businesses for 15 years for supporting her big family. 

Sokleap has been with VisionFund for two cycles and successfully managed to pay back her entire loans. After the loans, she feels confident that she will improve her family's living gradually as her current business earns her about 25,000 KHR per day. 

Now Sokleap leads a group of two; they are seeking a loan of 1,200,000 KHR each. She is going to use some portion of her loan to buy fertilizers and rice seeds, and the remaining portion of the loan for purchasing insecticide for her farmland. 

She hopes that the price of her cassava will gradually increase so that she can earn more income and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, rice seeds, and insecticide.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia tiene 45 años, tiene tres hijos de 23, 19 y 17 años. Ella se hace cargo sola de sus hijos hace 4 años, pues se separó del padre de ellos. 
Se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de cuyes. Cuenta con parcelas de terrenos agrícolas donde siembra arvejas, maíz y flores. Mientras cosecha uno, va cultivando otros, de esa manera tiene asegurado ingresos en distintas fechas del año. “Me conviene sembrar arvejas y flores, porque se cosecha rápido y los precios son buenos”, comenta. Además, en la tranquilidad de su hogar se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes.  Cada ejemplar lo negocia entre 20 a 25 soles, dependiendo del tamaño. Gracias a esta actividad obtiene ingresos que solventan las necesidades de sus hijos, ya que se encuentran estudiando. Su mayor meta es ver a sus hijos profesionales, para ello trabajará con ahínco para darles lo que requieran. 

Con éste sería 14 créditos que Alicia obtiene de MFP y es una de las socias más activas, ya que es la tesorera del banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza - Huaylahuichán”.
Este mes es ideal para la siembra de arvejas, por eso invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de tres bolsas de semilla (2000 soles). Lo restante será para adquirir fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Alicia is 45 years old, she has 3 children of ages: 23, 19, and 17.  She's been caring for her children alone for 4 years since she separated from their father.  She farms and raises guinea pigs.  She also has some plots of farming land where she plants peas, corn, and flowers and as she harvests one she begins to plant others, this way she can count on income during various times of the year. She states, " It's beneficial to me to plant peas and flowers because they grow quicker and they sell at a good price.".  Also, from the tranquility of her home she raises small animals like guinea pigs.  She sells each animal between 20 and 25 soles, depending on their size.  Thanks to these means, she can provide for her kids since they are in school.  Her biggest goal is to see her children become professionals and to see it through she will work tirelessly to give them what they need.

This is Alicia's 14th loan from MFP and she's also one of the most active members acting as treasurer for the communal bank, "Nueva Esperanza Huaylahuichán" ( New Hope Huaylahuichán).
This month is ideal for planting peas which is why she'll invest her loan towards the purchase of 3 sacks of seed (2000 soles); the rest will be used to acquire fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Abdualy

texts.en: Abdualy is one of the successful businessmen in a local market. He has his own selling place and a lot of customers. For more than nine years he has been selling clothes for women and for children. He has a wide assortment of goods and attracts many customers. His wife helps him with the business. They have three children and try to do their best for them. He is asking for a loan to buy goods for the new season. He and his wife await your help and support.

loans.use: to buy goods such as children's clothes for the new season

loans.name: Progresando Juntos Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “ Progresando Juntos” está conformado por 21 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de sopaipillas, lencería, repostería, botillería, venta de perfumes, venta de ropa, confites, servicios entre otros. Todos pertenecientes a la comuna de San Bernardo ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Erna, presidenta del grupo del  Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste un pantalón y un chaleco de color negro, lleva cruzado un bolso artesanal y en sus manos sostiene una carpeta, usa aros grandes y su cabello es de color castaño claro y lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al  rubro de compra, venta y confección de ropa de vestir específicamente pantalones polares (tela abrigadora para temporada de invierno), desde hace 15 años. Comenta que trabaja con su mama en un carrito que lo ubica en el centro de la comuna de San Bernardo, su horario de trabajo es de 09ºº hasta las 19ºº horas de lunes a sábado.
Su mercadería la compra en la comuna de Independencia (ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago) donde se especializa en ventas de telas para confección de ropa, a bajo costo por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará ropa de temporada de invierno para varón y damas.
Una de las metas de Erna en su negocio, es poder arrendar un local, ya que de esta manera trabajaría de una forma mas cómoda, evitando el frio durante la temporada de invierno y el calor durante la temporada de invierno.
Erna vive junto a su madre, esposo y sus 2 hijos de 18 y 24 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral son tener la posibilidad de arrendar un local para generar mayores ingresos, y a nivel familiar ver a sus hijos que terminen sus estudios y se titulen, para ver su tares cumplida.
Erna está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que se siente muy cómoda con las reuniones y grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe generosidad y unidad.
San Bernardo es una ciudad, ubicada  a 18 km. en línea recta hacia el sur desde la plaza de armas de Santiago (capital de Chile). Es conocida como la capital del folklore, debido a que cada año, en  enero, se realiza el "Festival Internacional del Folklore", un evento en el que las raíces del país se dan cita y se reúnen  agrupaciones musicales de toda Sudamérica. También se desarrolla la "Feria de Artesanía Tradicional", en la que participan tanto artesanos chilenos como de otros países cercanos. Luego en abril se realiza el  evento “Abril cuecas Mil” que consiste en hacer bailar cueca (baile tradicional chileno) a toda la comuna.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Progresando Juntos" (Progressing Together) and consists of 21 entrepreneurs who work in different areas, including selling sopaipillas (a local bread), lingerie, confectionery, liquor store, perfume sales, clothing sales, candies, and services, among others. All the members are from the area of San Bernardo, located in the city of Santiago.

Erna, who is the president of the communal bank, is standing in the first row in the picture. She is the first one, going from left to right, and is wearing black pants and a black jacket. She wears a handmade bag over her shoulder and in her hands she has a folder. She has big earrings, and her hair is brown and is tied back.

She works in the area of buying, selling, and making clothing to wear, specifically polar (fleece) pants (pants made with a warm fabric for the winter season) and has been doing this for 15 years. She comments that she works with her mother from a cart that is located in the center of the San Bernardo area. Her working hours are from 9:00 am until 7:00 pm from Monday to Saturday.

She buys her merchandise in the Independencia area (located in the city of Santiago), where they specialize in the sale of fabrics for making clothing at low cost and thus economically convenient. With the loan she will buy men's and women's clothing for the winter season.

One of Erna's goals for her business is to be able to rent a shop, since in this way she could work more comfortably, avoiding the cold during the winter and the heat during the summer. Erna lives with her mother, her husband, and their two children, ages 18 and 24. Her dream for her work is to have the possibility of renting a shop to generate greater income, and her dream for her family is to see her children finish their education and graduate, and thus see her work completed.

Erna is very happy and grateful for the loan and the services offered by Fondo Esperanze. In addition, she comments that she feels very comfortable  in the meetings and in her communal bank group, since there is generosity and unity.

San Bernardo is a city located 18 km in a straight line to the south from the Plaza de Armas in Santiago (the capital of Chile). It is known as the capital of folklore, because every year in January, they hold the International Festival of Folklore, an event in which the ethnic groups of the country gather and meet with musical groups from all of South America. The Traditional Art Fair has also developed, in which Chilean artists as well as those from other countries participate. Then in April they hold "Abril Cuecas Mil," in which the entire community dances the cueca, a traditional Chilean dance.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothing for the winter season.

loans.name: Zulema

texts.es:
Zulema tiene 26 años, su pareja es Héctor, con quien tiene una hija llamada Sharmely. Viven en su casa propia ubicada en localidad de Tapo.
Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, habas, arveja y maíz. Lleva con 5 años en esta actividad y le agrada su trabajo, ya que sabe cómo negociar sus cosechas en el mercado mayorista, que está a 40 minutos de su localidad. Tiene varias estrategias de trabajo, una de ellas es sembrar asociada con otro agricultor; “yo puedo poner las semillas y el abono, y el otro, los terrenos y el personal, después en la cosecha repartimos la producción”, menciona. Pero lo que más le agrada es el cuidado de sus animales menores, como los cuyes, los cuales comercializa en el mercado modelo de la ciudad.

Este es su crédito número 4 con MFP, por eso se compromete en pagar con puntualidad las cuotas. Pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Rosa”, un grupo de socios agricultores con las mismas metas.
Zulema destinará este dinero en la compra de bolsas de semillas de papa, lo restante será para bolsas de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Zulema is 26 years old and her partner is named Héctor whom she shares a daughter with named Sharmely.  They live in their own home located in the town of Tapo.  Her primary crops are potatoes, lima beans, peas, and corn.  She's been farming for 5 years and likes her job.  She also farms with another person and states; " I can contribute seeds and fertilizer and the other person contributes land and personnel.  During harvest, we share what is collected.".  What makes her most happy is caring for her small animals like guinea pigs, which she sells at the city market.  This is her 4th loan with MFP, and commits to punctual payments.  
She belongs to the communal bank, "Santa Rosa", a group of farmers with the same goals.  Zulema intends to purchase bags of potato seed and fertilizer with what is left.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy utensils in bulk.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 52-year-old married man. He has five children with ages ranging from 18 years to 27 years. He describes himself as a patient man. 

Simon operates a butcher shop where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for six years and employs one staff member. His business is located within a market and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as the stiff competition within the area. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy cutlery for his butcher shop. His business goal is to diversify his business into a hotel business within five years. He hopes that in the future his business will be successful.

loans.use: to buy cutlery for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Antoinette is 48 years old.  She is a widow with seven children between the ages of 8 and 24 years old and she takes care of nine dependents. She purchases and sells cows. She has been in this business for eight years, and she currently employs two people to help her. 

Antoinette has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more cows for resale. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, pay school fees for her children, and build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more cows for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more food items to cook.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 27-year-old married man. He has two children, ages 3 and 7 years old. Julius describes himself as a diligent man. He operates a retail stall where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for four years and employs one staff member. His business is located on a busy street and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as the high prices of clothes for selling. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes for resale. His business goal is to diversify his business into a retail shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, his business will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira lives in Goghtanik village with her husband, Grigor, and a little 1-year-old daughter, Gayane. Naira's husband works at the village hall, but his salary is not enough to make ends meet. So the couple also runs a farm, where they raise sheep and chickens and grow different fruit trees (walnut, cherry, apple, peach and pear). 

Naira has applied for this loan to increase their number of sheep. The sale of sheep meat forms an important part of their income; so, by increasing their sheep, Naira will be able to make more income. It is important for this young and enthusiastic couple to cover costs and invest in the further development of their farm.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is married and has two children. She sells eggs, rice and water in Adum Banso, near Takoradi. She has done this for the past three years. Her husband is a farmer. Yaa uses her income to pay for her children’s school fees. Her husband is in charge of other expenses. Yaa will use this loan to purchase more eggs, rice and water. With the new profits, Yaa plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more eggs, rice and water

loans.name: Mama

texts.en:
Mama is married and has four children. She has received schooling through junior secondary school. 

Mama sells bread and tea in Adum Banso, near Takoradi, which she has done for quite a few years now. Her husband is a driver. Mama uses her income to pay for her children’s school fees. 

Mama will use the loan to purchase more bread and tea for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mama plans to invest in her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase more bread and tea for sale.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is married and has four children. She has received schooling through junior secondary school.

Nana sells corn dough and charcoal in Adum Banso, near Takoradi, which she has done for four years. Her husband is a mason. 

Nana uses her income to pay her children’s school fees. Nana will use the loan to purchase charcoal and maize in bulk. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana plans to invest in her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and maize in bulk.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 38 years old and a married mother of three children. Her children are 10, 12 and 16 years old.

She owns an agro-vet store where she sells agro-vet chemicals to the farmers in the region. This is a business she has run for the past one year, and she is optimistic that with this loan she will be able to expand it and get better returns.

She wants to buy more agro-vet chemicals and feeds so that her store can be well stocked.

loans.use: to buy more agro-vet chemicals.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is 35 years old and lives in the town of Likoni in the coastal region of Kenya. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Mwanajuma has been working hard to manage her charcoal business; she sells charcoal at the market. 

To help expand her business, Mwanajuma has requested a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings from Yehu. The loan will be used to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale and also to pay transport costs, and will help Mwanajuma to generate greater profits. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to incorporate firewood selling in her charcoal business so as to increase her monthly income.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale and also pay transport costs.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine lives in Shishkert village with her husband, son and daughter. Marine and her husband run a farm, where they raise cows and chickens and keep beehives. The main income Marine gathers is from the sales of meat, eggs, milk and honey. 

In order to make cattle breeding more profitable, Marine would like to purchase four calves. She also wants to purchase pigs and start pig breeding, too. Marine is full of hope to start earning more income, which is important for her to make savings for her children's future education.

loans.use: to pay for calves and pigs.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret sells kenkey (fermented maize dough) and fish in Adum Banso, near Takoradi. Margaret has completed junior high school. She is married to a farmer and has seven children. Margaret has been selling kenkey and fish for the past 10 years. She is responsible for paying all of her children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to buy bulk maize and fish. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in her children’s education, as she wishes to send them all to school.

loans.use: to buy bulk maize and fish.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Cansado de tanto arrendar un local, que generaba pocos ingresos durante un largo periodo de tiempo, Antonio, un hombre casado de 55 años y padre de 3 hijos, decidió por su propia cuenta emprender su  negocio; así fue que empezó  a comprar enseres para exhibir  y mercancía variada como artículos de uso doméstico, calzado informal ropa etc.   agregando poco a poco bienes de consumo diario de la canasta familiar y así mismo  Equipos  y herramientas de trabajo, hasta que conformó su pequeña tienda y gradualmente ha logrado estabilizar sus ingresos. Hoy necesita aumentar aun mas sus ventas, pero debe tener inventarios no perecederos, que rotan rápidamente,  para que sus clientes no recurran a la competencia, que les ofrece precios competitivos, porque compran en mayor volumen, por eso su mayor desafío es lograr reunir el capital de trabajo suficiente,  para obtener descuentos importantes de sus proveedores y por eso acude a un credikiva,  primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ranchos, víveres, bebidas, refrescos y enlatados. Con su credikiva espera lograr el éxito en sus ventas, pues invertirá hasta el último peso en su tienda y hará un ahorro en sus  compras a proveedores, quienes le ofrecen precios especiales por acceder a sus productos con el dinero en sus manos y en mayor volumen que el acostumbrado. Su meta es lograr hacer más fuerte su negocio y agregar el servicio a domicilio, para facilitar la tarea de compra diaria de sus fieles compradores.
texts.en:
Tired of always having to lease a business, which generated little income over a period of time, Antonio - a married man of 55 and father of 3 children - decided on his own to start a business. So it was that he began to buy goods to display, along with various merchandise such as household wares, casual footwear, and clothing. Little by little he added items for a family’s daily grocery needs, in addition to work tools and equipment, until he completed his small store. 

He has gradually succeeded in stabilizing his income; now he needs to increase his sales even more. However, he should have non-perishable goods that rotate through quickly so that his customers don’t turn to the competition, who offer competitive prices because they buy in greater volume. Therefore, his greatest challenge is raising enough working capital to receive important discounts from his suppliers. Because of this, he has come for a loan financed by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which he will use to purchase food, basic provisions, soft drinks, and canned goods. 

With his loan, he hopes to achieve success in his sales, as he will invest every last penny in his store and save on the purchases from his suppliers. They will offer him special prices for buying products with money in hand and in greater volume than usual. His goal is to strengthen his business and add a home delivery service in order to lighten the daily shopping work of his loyal customers.

loans.use: to purchase food, basic provisions, drinks, sodas, and canned goods.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis  is a 27-year-old single man. He describes himself to be aggressive and determined. He operates a carpentry workshop retail store where he sells furniture.
