He has been involved in this business for five years and employs one staff member. His business is located within a busy market and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high price of wood for making furniture. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to pay for the expansion of his carpentry workshop. His goal is to improve his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have become the best carpenter in his home town .

loans.use: to pay for the expansion of his carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour for her bakery.

loans.name: Maysara

texts.en: Maysara is a woman who likes to work very hard. She is very decent and strong-minded. She is a careful mother and is raising her two children alone because she is divorcee. She must work hard to provide them with modern conveniences. For more than 10 years, she has run own business selling fruits and vegetables in the local market. She has own selling place and a lot of customers. Her house has bad condition and Maysara must repair it. Her income isn't enough for repairing the house. She is asking for a loan to buy building materials to complete the repairs.

loans.use: to buy building materials for repairing her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase maize in bulk.

loans.name: Mafall

texts.fr: Mafall est un homme marié.Il est père de trois enfants dont les deux fréquentent l'école primaire.Il tient une boutique de vente de semences et de produits phytosanitaires.Il entretient sa famille avec les revenus tirés de ce commerce et parvient à subvenir également à ses propres besoins et à constituer une petite épargne.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 500 000f pour acheter des semences et du granox.Son ambition est de construire son magasin.
texts.en:
Mafall is a married man and the father of three children, two of whom attend primary school.  

He runs a shop where he sells seeds and phytosanitary products.

He supports his family with the income generated from this business.  He is also able to meet his own needs and to save a little money.

In order to boost his business, Mafall is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs for the purchase of seeds and granox (a pesticide).  His ambition is to build his own shop.

loans.use: to buy seeds and granox (a pesticide)

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 46 years old and lives in Baga, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 children.

Vilma has a hog fattening business and earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 19,000 PHP to be used to purchase feed.

Vilma has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, she hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: to purchase feed.

loans.name: Mounir

texts.en:
Mounir is a 26-year-old single man and the owner of an accessories shop since 2008. Mounir is very happy with his business, because he enjoys the variety of products that he serves in his shop to please his customers. He sells perfumes, beauty creams and cosmetics in addition to good quality accessories.

Mounir has expanded his business a lot in order to keep his customers satisfied. He applied for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to support his business with a new accessories collection.
 
This is his first time applying for a loan, but he is very excited that it will respond to his customers' needs and will increase his capital. Mounir hopes to start a wholesale trade in the future and to expand his working region.

loans.use: to support his business with a new accessories collection.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys sells bread in Adum Banso, near Takoradi. She has completed junior high school. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. Gladys has been selling bread for six years now. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy flour. Gladys hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy flour.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 26 years old and lives with her life partner in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. She has one child who is a source of joy in her marriage. She has been involved in a tailoring business for four years, has extensive experience and is successful in her career. Janet's husband works in one of the private companies.

In order to improve her family's finances, Janet is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to expand on her existing business. With this loan, she will use 40,000 KES to purchase textile materials, 5,000 KES to buy sewing threads and 5,000 KES to service her sewing machine. By doing so, she would earn extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and start a tailoring training unit. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house in her rural home to a permanent status.

loans.use: to purchase textile materials and thread, and to service a sewing machine.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena sells fish in Adum Banso, near Takoradi, Ghana. 

Abena has completed sixth grade in junior high school. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a driver. 

Abena has been selling fish for the past 11 years. She is responsible for paying her children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to buy fish in bulk. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish in bulk.

loans.name: Ajara

texts.en:
Ajara is married and has 4 children. She sells fish in Adum Banso, near Takoradi. She has been doing this for 6 years now. She uses her income to pay her children’s school fees. Her husband is a farmer.

Ajara will use the loan to purchase fish in bulk. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ajara plans to save up for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase fish in bulk.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 33 years old, from Nyahururu, and still single. 

Emmanuel has a potato business which he has been running in the last four years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET to enable him to buy more sacks of potatoes to add to his stock and sell to his customers.

He hopes to be the leading supplier of potatoes in Nyahururu town in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes to add to his stock.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 60 years old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children.

Rebecca has a general store. She has had this business for 30 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 which will be used to purchase more stock for her general store.

Rebecca has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years. In the future, Rebecca hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is married and has 6 children. She sells fish in Adum Banso, near Takoradi. She has been doing this for the past 15 years. Her husband is a farmer.

Esi uses her income to pay her children’s school fees. She will use the loan to purchase fish in bulk. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to invest in her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase fish in bulk.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara tiene 39 años, su pareja es José, con quien tiene tres hijos; de 23, 18 y 15 años. Juntos, viven en su casa propia ubicada en el anexo de Huaylahuichán.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura, aprovecha los buenos suelos que posee su localidad. Con mucho esfuerzo logró comprar terrenos de cultivo donde ahora produce choclo (maíz tierno), papas de distintas variedades y arvejas. “A veces también siembro flores y verduras, pero solo en mayo y noviembre”, menciona. Lo que le conviene más es la producción de arvejas y maíz y en todos sus años trabajando ya domina estas siembras. Solo cultiva las variedades más especiales y requeridas por el mercado y aunque necesiten más cuidados, ella no se hace problemas y se esmera con ahínco. Ahora tiene planeado sembrar maíz que cosechará, con suerte, en noviembre.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se siente contenta de pertenecer a un banco comunal muy sólido y responsable como lo es “Nueva Esperanza de Huaylahuichán”.
Invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de semillas de maíz (300 soles) y cuatro sacos de fertilizantes con 700 soles.
texts.en:
Clara is 39 years old and her partner is José, with whom she has three children: aged 23, 18 and 15. They live in their own house located near Huaylahuichán.

She makes a living through agriculture, taking advantage of the good soil in her area. With a lot of effort she managed to purchase land for farming where she now produces corn (sweet corn), a variety of potatoes and peas. "Sometimes I also plant flowers and greens, though only in May and November", she notes. The crops which are the most convenient for her are peas and corn and through all her years of work she has mastered these crops. She only cultivates the most special varieties demanded by the market and although they require more care, she doesn't have any problems and works her hardest with determination. She now plans to plant corn which she will harvest, with luck, in November.

This is her first loan with MFP and she feels happy to belong to such a solid and responsible communal bank as “Nueva Esperanza de Huaylahuichán”.
She will use the money from this loan into buying corn seeds (300 soles) and four sacks of fertilizers with 700 soles.

loans.use: purchase corn seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto tiene 40 años, su pareja es Flavia, con la que tiene tres hijos.
Se dedica a la agricultura con la siembra, principalmente, de maíz, arveja, papa y lechuga. Lleva como 20 años en esta actividad y menciona ser casi un experto en la producción de arvejas y maíz. Ha tenido dificultades para realizar bien su trabajo, como adaptarse a los horarios que la comunidad designa para utilizar el agua y regar sus plantas, a veces le toca en las madrugadas, pero a base de esfuerzo consigue sus objetivos. A su vez, su esposa se dedica a la crianza de cuyes y recibe la visita de compradores que llegan hasta su casa para adquirir estos animalitos. Ahora está pensando mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos para obtener mejores ganancias y de esa manera poder brindar un buen futuro a sus hijos.

Este es su crédito número 4 con MFP y al igual que los otros socios, es muy responsable en las reuniones y actividades del banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza - Huaylahuichán”, al que pertenece.
Alberto sembrará tres bolsas de semillas de arvejas en cuatro parcelas de terreno que ya tiene preparado; con el dinero de este préstamo le alcanzará para comprar tres sacos de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Alberto is 40 years old. His wife is  Flavia, with whom he has three children. 

He is a farmer who plants mostly corn, peas, potatoes and lettuce. He has been doing this activity for 20 years and says that he is almost an expert in growing peas and corn. He has had problems while doing his job, like adapting to the schedules that the community designated for using water to irrigate his crops. Sometimes his turn is before dawn, but with his hard work he meets his goals. His wife raises guinea pigs and is visited by buyers who go to the house to buy these little animals. Now he is planning on improving the quality of his crops to obtain more profits and thus offer a good future to his children. 

This is loan number 4 with MFP and like the other members, he is very responsible in the meetings and activities of the “Nueva Esperanza - Huaylahuichán” communal bank that he belongs to.

Alberto will plant three bags of pea seeds on four land parcels that he has already prepared. With the money from this loan, he will have enough to buy three sacks of fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy three bags of pea seeds and thress sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Nuestro socio  es el señor  Daniel, él pertenece al banco comunal “Ricchary Runa” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestro socio sigue con su actividad del servicio de mudanzas, trabajo que viene realizando hace mucho tiempo y con este pudo mantener a su familia y proporcionó educación para sus hijos, por ello en esta oportunidad invertirá en el mantenimiento de su herramienta de trabajo que en este caso es su vehiculo y le comprará repuestos,  accesorios y le dará un mantenimiento completo.
Daniel está muy agradecido con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse y desarrollarse en su actividad y por apoyarlo con el fortalecimiento y crecimiento económico de su familia.
texts.en:
This member's name is  Daniel. He belongs to the “Ricchary Runa” communal bank in the city of Cuzco - Perú, He is still doing his work with a moving service, work he has been doing for a long time. With it, he has been able to support his family and give his children an education. That is why, at this time, he will invest in maintenance of his work tools, which in this case is his vehicle. He will buy replacement parts, accessories, and do complete maintenance.

Daniel is very grateful to KIVA for allowing him to support himself and develop his activity and for supporting him with the financial growth and strength of his family.

loans.use: to maintain his car and buy some accessories that it lacks.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
Olinda tiene 37 años, tiene dos hijos; de 15 y 2 años de edad. Su pareja es Walter, con quien piensa casarse pronto. Olinda y su familia viven en la casa de su tía, en el caserío de Huaylahuichan.
Ella cuenta con terrenos propios donde siembra arvejas, papas y maíz; “en otros meses también cultivo flores y lechugas, cuando tengo chacras libres”, menciona. Olinda cuenta que a veces en la siembra de maíz sólo recupera lo invertido, “eso se debe a las heladas y enfermedades y por no saber cómo aplicar los insecticidas”, agrega; pero con las arvejas no tiene quejas. Adicionalmente, obtiene más ingresos por la venta de cuyes, pues hace 5 años se dedica a la crianza de estos animalitos. Ahora Olinda llevará a su hijo mayor hacia la ciudad de Lima para que empiece a estudiar allá, por eso trabaja con mucho esfuerzo para lograr sus metas.

Este es su crédito número 14 con MFP y se siente muy comprometida de pagar las cuotas mensuales a tiempo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza de Huaylahuichán”, donde colabora con las actividades como la preparación de comidas, los ahorros puntuales y otros.
Olinda invertirá este dinero en la compra de semillas de arveja y bolsas de fertilizante. Todo el préstamo tendrá fines agrícolas.
texts.en:
Olinda is 37 years old. She has two children, aged 15 and 2. Her partner is Walter, whom she plans to marry soon. Olinda and her family live in her aunt's hose in the community of Huaylahuichan.

She has her own land where she plants peas, potatoes and corn. “Other months I also plant flowers and lettuce, when I have available land", she says. Olinda says that sometimes with the corn crop she only makes back what she has invested. “This is because of the frosts and diseases and because of not knowing how to apply the insecticides", she adds. But with the peas, she has no complaints. In addition, she earns more income selling guinea pigs, which she has done for 5 years.Now, Olinda will take her oldest son to the city of Lima so he start going to school there. That is why she is working so hard to meet her goals.

This is her 14th loan with MFP and she feels very committes to making her monthly payments on time. She belongs to the “Nueva Esperanza de Huaylahuichán” communal bank, where she collaborates in the activities preparing food, making her savings on time and more.

Olinda will invest this money in buying pea seeds and bags of fertilizer. All of the loan is for farming purposes.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds and bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Gergette

texts.fr: Gergette est une femme mariée de 41 ans mère de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 8 et 27 ans, deux d'entre eux vont encore à l'école. Elle commerçante depuis 24 ans déjà ou elle commercialise le charbon qu'elle achète en gros  pour revendre en détail à ses clients. son accueil chaleureux et son expérience ont agrandit sa clientèle au fil du temps, alors la petitesse de son capital ne lui permet de plus de tous les satisfaire, d'ou l'importance de crédit qui permettre non seulement de satisfaire sa clientèles en augmentant les stocks, mais aussi ses ventes et son bénéfice. Elle réinvestira une partie de ses bénéfice dans son activité et aiderai son époux à subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de leur famille avec le reste.
texts.en:
Gergette is a 41-year-old married woman and the mother of 3 children aged between 8 and 27, two of whom still go to school.

She has been a retailer for 24 years already, selling charcoal that she buys wholesale to her retail customers. Her warm welcome and her experience have ensured that her customer base has grown over time, but the small amount of capital that she has means that she cannot satisfy them all - thus the importance of this loan, which will enable her to satisfy her clientèle by increasing her stock, and will also boost her sales numbers and profits. 

She will reinvest part of her profits in her business and will use the rest to help her husband in meeting their family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Dior

texts.fr: Dior est une femme mariée.Elle est mère de cinq enfants dont les trois fréquentent l'école.Elle exerce un commerce de poudre granox qui protège les graines d'arachide contre les insectes et les oiseaux.En début d'hivernage, son chiffre d'affaire est assez élevé du fait de la forte demande.Elle parvient ainsi à prendre en charge l'essentiel des dépenses d'entretien de sa famille ainsi que ses propres besoins.Afin de renforcer son stock, elle sollicite un pret de 400 000f qui lui permettront d'acheter 80 sacs de poudre granox.Elle ambitionne de construire un magasin pour bien conditionner son produit.
texts.en:
Dior is a married woman. She is the mother of 5 children, 3 of whom attend school. She sells Granox powder, which protects groundnuts from insects and birds. At the start of the rainy season, her turnover is quite large due to high demand. She therefore manages to take care of most of her family's living expenses, as well as her own needs.

In order to reinforce her stock, she is requesting a loan of 400 000 francs which will enable her to buy 80 bags of Granox powder. Her ambition is to build a warehouse in order to be able to package her product well.

loans.use: to buy 80 bags of Granox powder.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Nuestro socio  es el señor  Cesar, él pertenece al banco comunal “Ricchary Runa” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestro socio sigue con su actividad de agente de seguridad en la empresa privada, trabajo sacrificado que viene realizando hace mucho tiempo y con este puede mantener a su familia, por ello en esta oportunidad invertirá su préstamo en la educación de sus hijos para procurarles un mejor porvenir.
Cesar está muy agradecido con KIVA por permitirle mantener a su familia y por apoyarlo con la educación y el desarrollo de su familia
El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Our member, Cesar, belongs to the “Ricchary Runa” communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú. He continues working as a security guard in a private business. It’s demanding work that he has done for many years. With this work, he can support his family. He will invest his loan in his children’s education so they can have better future. 
Cesar is grateful to KIVA for allowing him to support his family by helping him with their education and development. 
He is grateful for the loan and promises to make the payments on time.

loans.use: pay for  his children's education

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou est une femme mariée qui vend des produits de soin et de parfum.Elle s'approvisionne en Gambie et place sa marchandise auprès de ses clients.Lorsqu'elle recouvre son argent au bout de deux mois, elle organise un autre voyage de commerce.Cette activité lui rapporte des revenus qui lui permettent de subvenir à ses besoins ainsi qu'à ceux de ses deux enfants.Afin de renforcer son stock, Fatou sollicite un pret de  300 000f pour acheter des produits de soin et des parfums.
texts.en:
Fatou is a married woman who sells beauty care products and perfume. She gets her supplies in Gambia and delivers her merchandise to her customers. After 2 months, when she gets her money back, she organises another business trip. Her business generates enough revenue to enable her to meet her needs and those of her 2 children.

Fatou is requesting a loan of 300 000 francs in order to restock on beauty care products and perfumes.

loans.use: to buy beauty care products and perfume.

loans.name: Topista's Group

texts.en:
Topista's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Topista is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past three years, Topista has been working hard to manage her shop, where she is a photographer. 

To help expand her business, Topista has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy another camera, and will help Topista to generate greater profits and improve herself and pay for medical expenses. Topista hopes that in the future she will be able to own her own studio. 

Topista is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Topista's future prospects by helping her to save money.

loans.use: to buy a new camera

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther tiene 47 años, junto a su pareja tiene cuatro hijos.
Desde hace 27 años trabaja en el campo, la agricultura es la actividad que la sustenta desde hace muchos años y la que le agrada realizar. “En el campo me siento libre, además todo lo que gane lo obtengo gracias al sudor de mi frente”, menciona. En sus parcelas de terrenos siembra arvejas, habas, maíz y papas, las que comercializa en el mercado mayorista (a 20 minutos de la zona). En estas labores recibe el apoyo de sus hijos mayores y de su esposo. Para cada siembra debe realizar una gran inversión, por ejemplo un saco de fertilizantes le cuesta entre 120 a 140 soles, ella requiere de 5 a 10 sacos. Además las semillas también son costosas, pero al final, recupera lo invertido gracias a un trabajo coordinado y sacrificado. 

Este es su crédito número 5 con MFP y da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza de Huaylahuichán” y es una de las socias más responsables.
Invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de dos bolsas de semillas de arvejas y lo restante lo destinará a la compra de bolsas de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Esther is 47 years old and together with her spouse, has four children.

She has worked in the fields for 27 years and agriculture is the activity that has supported her for many years and which she enjoys doing. "In the fields I feel free, and on top of that, everything I've earned, I've obtained thanks to the sweat of my brow," she notes. On her land she plants peas, beans, corn and potatoes which she sells in the wholesale market (20 minutes away). For this, she counts on the support of her eldest children and her husband. Each time she sows seeds she must make a big investment - for example a bag of fertilizer costs between 120 and 140 soles and she requires 5 to 10 bags. In addition, the seeds are also costly, though in the end she recovers the amount invested thanks to a coordinated and self-sacrificing work effort.

This is her fifth loan with MFP and she gives her world that she will pay her monthly repayments on time. She belongs to the communal bank “Nueva Esperanza de Huaylahuichán” and is one of the most responsible members.
She will invest the money from this loan in purchasing pea seeds and will use the rest to buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.use: purchase pea seeds and bags of fertilizers

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is married with three children. Arlene is 41 years old and lives in ZNAC, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Arlene owns a general store and has had this business for eight years. Each month, she earns 4,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 21,500 to purchase more stock for her general store.

Arlene has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Arlene hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is married and has one child. She has received schooling through the sixth grade. Esther is a seamstress in Adum Banso near Takoradi. She has been doing this for two years now. Her husband is a plumber. Esther uses her income to pay her child’s school fees. Esther will use the loan to purchase dress-making supplies. With the new profits, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase dress-making supplies.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is divorced and has four children. She has received schooling through junior high school. 

Cecilia operates a provisions store in Adum Banso, near Takoradi, which she has owned for 20 years now. Cecilia uses her income to pay her children’s school fees as well as all other household expenses, such as feeding and clothing her children. 

Cecilia will use the loan to purchase items in bulk for her provisions store. With the new profits from her expanded business, Cecilia plans to save up for her children’s education and to take care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items in bulk for her provisions store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy different kinds of fabrics.

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass, a 45-year-old married father of four children, has worked as a blacksmith for 30 years. A hard worker, Abbass is well known in the region and enjoys a good reputation for the quality of his work. He opened his own workshop in 2004 and employs two people to help him meet customer needs.

Abbass is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy iron for manufacturing. He hopes to keep on expanding his business as much as he can to support both his family and his employees' futures.

loans.use: to buy iron for manufacturing.

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr: Hélène est une femme de 50 ans célibataire mère de 5 enfants dont l'age varie entre 5 et 25 ans, deux de ses enfants vont encore à l'école. Elle a aussi à sa charge sa belle fille. Elle a ouvert un restaurant qu'elle gère depuis 20 ans déjà. c'est grâce à lui qu'elle s'occupe de sa famille. Le fait d'acheter les produit de restauration en détail ne rapporte vraiment grand chose pour elle. D'où l'importance de ce crédit pour son activité parce que ça lui permettra d'acheter 2 sacs de d'arachide, 1 sac de riz et dois pour cuisiner ses plats. Cela lui évitera les déplacements quotidiens et diminuera ses frais de taxi, ça augmentera aussi ses bénéfices. Elle réinvestira une partie de ce profit pour refaire les locaux de son restaurant, l'autre l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Hélène is 50 years old, single and the mother of 5 children aged between 5 and 25, two of whom still attend school. She is also responsible for her stepdaughter.

Hélène has opened and been running a restaurant for 20 years already. It's thanks to her business that she is able to take care of her family. Buying ingredients for her restaurant from retailers is not very profitable for her, thus the importance of this loan for her business because it would enable her to buy two bags of peanuts, one bag of rice and the wood that she needs to cook her meals. Buying in bulk would allow her to avoid daily trips and save money on taxi fares, which would increase her overall profits. She will reinvest part of the profit in renovating her restaurant, and the rest will help her to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of peanuts, 1 bag of rice and some wood.

loans.name: Mencho

texts.en:
Mencho, a 47-year-old married mother of three, lives in Bagacay, Larena, Siquijor where she has a business selling snacks, earning about PHP 2,000.00 each month.

A member of Pagalum Multi Purpose Cooperative since May 28 of this year, Mencho is requesting a loan of PHP 5000 to buy ingredients such as flour and milk for her business. She hopes to have continued success with her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like flour and milk for snacks business.

loans.name: Marie-Sylvie

texts.fr: Marie-Sylvie est une jeune femme celibataire de 33 ans, mere de 3 enfant dont l'age varie entre 5 et 15 ans. Deux de ses enfants vont a l'ecole. Elle est commercante et vend du bois de chauffage pres de son domicile depuis trois ans. Son activite fonctionne bien, mais son capital ne lui permet pas de se procurer un bon stock de marchandise. Elle est oblige d'acheter quelques fagots de bois pour pouvoir detailler. Grace a ce credit Marie-Sylvie pourra s'acheter un camion de bois, ce qui lui evitera les deplacements quotidienS et diminuera ses frais de transport pour achats de marchandise. Elle augmentera son capital, ses ventes, et donc son benefice. Elle economisera une partie de son benefice pour grandir son activite et s'ouvrir un depot de bois. Le reste l'aidera a subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie-Sylvie is a young, single woman, who is 33-year-old and the mother of 3 children aged between 5 and 15. Two of her children go to school. 

Marie-Sylvie is a retailer and has been selling firewood near her home for 3 years. Her business is going well, but her capital does not allow her to buy a decent amount of stock. She is forced to buy a few bundles of wood to sell retail. Thanks to this loan, Marie-Sylvie would be able to buy a lorry load of wood, which would enable to her to avoid the daily trips and would decrease the transport costs she incurs when buying merchandise. It would increase her capital, her sales and therefore her profits.

She will save a part of her profit so that she can grow her business and open a wood store. The rest will help her to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy a lorry load of wood.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha lives in Likoni, Kenya. Her house is made of concrete and has electricity and running water. Asha sells water from her compound for a living because she earns a good profit. Asha also owns a rental house which brings in her other source of income. She works very hard to ensure that her dream of establishing another rental house comes true. She is taking out another loan to expand her existing business.

Asha says she has both men and women customers, and her most popular customers are men who buy and sell water using their hand carts. She plans to use this loan to renovate her rental house. She says that some of her tenants are reluctant to pay on time hence posing a challenge to her.

loans.use: to renovate her rental house.

loans.name: Deli

texts.fr: Deli est un homme de 39 ans,marié, père de 04 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 07 et 20 ans.Ces derniers vont encore à l'école.il est commerçant dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 15 ans déjà où il tient une cafétariat.Grâce à son expérience et à sa qualité de bon commerçant,il a acquis au fil du temps une clientèle considérable et dont la demande augmente de plus en plus.D'où son problème d'insuffisance de son stock qui ne lui permet nullement de satisfaire cette demande ce qui crée de plus en plus une diminution importante de sa clientèle. Il sollicite donc ce crédit afin de pouvoir se ravitailler en quantité suffisante en riz(sacs),oeufs(alvéoles),et lait(boîtes) ce qui l'aidera à retenir et satisfaire convenablement sa clientèle mais augmentera aussi son bénéfice.Bénéfice qui lui permettra d'une part de réinvestir dans son activité afin d'ouvrir plus tard un restaurant et d'autre part de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Deli is 39 years old. He is married and the father of 4 children aged between 7 and 20, who still attend school. He is a retailer and has run a cafeteria in a district of the capital for 15 years already. Thanks to his experience and his reputation as a good business man, he has built up a large customer base over time, with demands that are increasing rapidly. Hence his problem of insufficient stock, which does not come close to allowing him to satisfy this demand and which is leading to a significant reduction in his customer numbers.

He is therefore requesting this loan in order to be able to restock on sufficient amounts of rice (bags), eggs (trays) and milk (cartons), which will help him to keep and satisfy his clientèle properly, and will also increase his profits. These profits will allow him to reinvest in his business, so that can open a restaurant at a later date, and will help him meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy some bags of rice, trays of eggs and cartons of milk.

loans.name: Al-Yasmin Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Yasmin and consists of seven members: Nourh, Sameera, Katbh, Amh, Fatima, Amirh and Eyman who live in Sana`a, Yemen.

Fatima is 28 years old, a married woman who has six children that live in Sana`a, Yemen. She has a house for her family and is working hard to offer a good life for them. She works and helps with the household expenses.  She applied for a youth loan of 60,000 YER from AMB.

With the support from this loan, she plans to purchase construction materials such as cement, blocks and other items. She is very grateful for the support she has received and is thankful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement and blocks for her house

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en: Mavluda is a woman who always finds a new way of earning income. She works hard to improve her living conditions but she has not got a good job. Now, she is going to organize a new business. She studied at a course called ‘To get success’ and learnt about business. She is going to buy cattle, care of them, and sell them to local people. She will be a good and successful businesswoman because she is very smart and industrious. She has two children and a kind husband. Her husband is a worker and his income isn’t enough to help his wife. That’s why you are the only one who can help her. Mavluda and her children await your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for organizing a new business

loans.name: Cornel

texts.en:
Cornel is 40 years old. He is married to Hellen and together they have three children aged 10, seven and three years old.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. He will use the loan amount to purchase panel beating materials for his business.

He hopes to educate his children to university level.

loans.use: to purchase materials for panel beating

loans.name: Nelson Yovani

texts.es: Nelson tiene 36 años de edad vive en Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara junto a su conyugue y sus 3 hijos. Nelson desde joven se ha dedicado a la elaboración de calzado y hace 11 meses consiguió un local alquilado donde tiene una sala de ventas. Vende zapatos de trabajo y de vestir para caballeros, como ser: botines, botas, y tipo burro. Este calzado lo elabora con cuero. Los vende en la comunidad y a sus alrededores. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 22,000 Lempiras para comprar materiales para elaborar calzado y surtir más el negocio ya que necesita incrementar las ventas. Su plan es crecer en el negocio, le gustaría abrir una nueva tienda, para incrementar los ingresos y poderle ayudar a sus hijos con el estudio y que tengan calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nelson, age 36, lives in Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara with his wife and their three children.  

Nelson has been making footwear for 11 months.  He got a rented place where he has a sales room.  He sells work shoes and dress shoes for men.  He sells footwear like ankle boots, boots, and work shoes.

He makes the footwear with leather, and he sells it in the community and surrounding areas.

He is requesting a loan for 22,000 lempiras to buy materials to make footwear.  He will stock the business more because he needs to increase sales.  His plan is to grow in the business.  He would like to open a new store.  He would do this to increase income, to be able to help his children with their education, and so that his children have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy material to make footwear.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is married and has 2 children. She sells charcoal and fish in Adum Banso, near Takoradi. She has been doing this for 6 years. Her husband is a driver. 

Agnes uses her income to pay her children’s school fees. Agnes will use the loan to purchase bags of charcoal. With the new profits, Agnes plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Sabera

texts.en:
Sabera, a married mother of two children aged four and nine, describes herself as ambitious. For the past three years she has been operating a retail store selling household items such as sugar, salt, margarine, gilette, snacks, etc. Her enterprise is located in an area conducive to business, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest challenge as high transportation costs when buying the household stock for her business.

Now requesting a Kes 20,000 loan to buy more household items, Sabera's business goal is to run a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have diversified her business.

loans.use: to buy more household items.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, a 51-year-old businessman married to Winfred, a businesswoman, is blessed with five children. He has been running a retail shop for the past year, earning a monthly income of KES 7,500 which he uses to support his family.

Stephen is requesting his first loan from KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. He will use the loan to buy more stocks of sugar, maize meal and cooking oil. With the anticipated profits from the business he will educate his children.

Stephen hopes to open a wholesale shop and improve the living standard of his family in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sugar, maize meal, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Sonik

texts.en:
Sonik is involved in agriculture. Together with her family she runs a farm where they breed pigs and chickens, cultivate potatoes and beans and grow fruit trees. Sonik would like to increase the number of pigs, for which she needs sufficient funds. With the help of this loan she plans to purchase three pigs. This is important for Sonik to increasing the number of pigs and get more income from the meat sales.
 
Sonik lives with her husband, son, two daughters and her grandmother. The family gets its main income from agriculture, the development of which is vital for them to make ends meet.

loans.use: to pay for pigs

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry has been in the motorcycle business in Nakuru town.   It has been profitable, thereby enabling him to provide for his family's needs.  He is 48 years old and married to Jane.   They have five children.

This will be his first loan.  He plans to buy motorcycle spare parts and repair his motorcycle, hence keep it in good condition for his business. With the anticipated profits, he plans to buy another motorcycle.

In the future, Henry hopes to open a wholesale business, make more income, and be able to provide good education for his children.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle parts and maintain his motorcycle.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina  is a married woman. She has two children, age 6 and 12 years. She describes herself as an aggressive woman. 

She operates a retail store where she sells cereals such as black beans, maize, beans, etc. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located at a conducive business environment and her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as high prices of transportation charged when buying cereals for resale. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more cereals for resale. Her business goal is to diversify her business into a retail shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, her business will have been successful.

loans.use: to buy more cereals to resell.

loans.name: Mwanatibu

texts.en:
Mwanatibu sells cashew nuts at the market. Selling these products has enabled her to support her family, especially her old husband who is jobless.

They have two adult children on whom they depend for their support since her current business is not enough to meet all the family needs. Thanks to their responsibility, Mwanatibu always receives a good contribution from her two sons every month.

She plans to use this loan to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for sale. She continues her efforts despite her advanced age.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for sale.

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna is 60 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Johna has a store that sells groceries and other consumable products. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Johna has been a member of PMPC for 10 years.  In the future, Johna hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki, 39 years old, lives in the town of Mombasa. She has been selling general food products in her retail shop for several years.She is taking out another loan in the amount of Ksh 10,000 to increase inventory in her shop. This is her first business, which she runs successfully on her own, since she is not helped by anyone, apart from weekends where her children assist her. 

Riziki says that the loan will help her because it will enable her to invest in her inventory and obtain a better income for her family. She plans to purchase beans, wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar.  Her plans for the future include having her own wholesale shop and being able to have a better standard of living and be independent. Her next goal is to establish her business in other places in the community, since she would like to become one of the most successful entrepreneurs in her area in order to increase her earnings and be able to give her children a better education.

loans.use: to purchase beans, wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Mounir

texts.en:
Mounir is a 55-year-old married man, father of six children; he has been working in transportation since 2002. He enjoys his business, since he comes in contact with different populations and listens to a variety of stories and problems.

Mounir is  a hard worker with a very good reputation; he is well known in the region. Mounir applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to do necessary maintenance on his van, to keep it in good shape to attract new customers.

Mounir will also invest part of the loan in doing necessary maintenance on his house to keep it a healthy living medium for his family members. This is his fifth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. He assures that his previous loans reflected positively on his family and business development.

He hopes to buy another van in the future and to open a touristic company that makes trips all over Lebanon.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance on his van

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 57 years old. He is a widower with three children who are all grown up. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past six years.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan amount to purchase seedlings and pesticides for his farm. He will also pay laborers  on his farm.

He hopes to purchase another  piece of tilling land.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is 40 years old and from Nakuru.  He is married, with four children, aged between six years and 17 years.   They are all in school.

Gilbert has a motorcycle business that he has operated for the past five years.. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him repair his motorbike.

He hopes to open up a transport company in the near future.

loans.use: To repair his motorbike.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 24-year-old, single, beautiful lady who operates a kiosk. She has been selling different products such as flour and rice, and other small, fast-selling products like sweets. The business has been active for the last three years. She lives with her parents in a family house, though she hopes to have her own home very soon.

Mariam buys her products in a city in the south-east of the country, two kilometers from where she lives. She also buys from suppliers who visit her business on Mondays and Fridays.

Mariam is requesting a loan from Yehu to increase her inventory. The loan will be used to buy stocks of maize and wheat flour, packets of sweets, salt, rice, etc. This will give her enough stock to meet her existing demand. This will make her more profits and improve her financial situation so that she can cover her expenses and that of her parents and siblings. Her aim is to open a retail shop even before she gets married and has a family.

loans.use: to buy stocks of maize and wheat flour and packets of sweets, salt and rice, etc.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik is involved in beekeeping.  Currently he keeps 13 beehives. Gagik likes beekeeping and his work very much, and he would like to keep more colonies of bees, to make more honey. 

Gagik will use this loan to purchase 15 colonies of bees, as well as hives, where he will keep these colonies. Gagik is very excited about developing his beekeeping, which will give him an opportunity to have more income and save money for purchasing still more beehives. 

Gagik lives with his wife and two daughters, Zarine (who is 16 years old) and Heghine (who is 18). As the family's main breadwinner, Gagik wants to gather and sell more honey, which is important for him to sustain his family.

loans.use: to buy more bee colonies and hives

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 22 years old and single, but he supports one of his siblings, who is still schooling. He sells snacks like doughnuts and pancakes and he has been in the business for the past one year where he gets a monthly income of KES 10,000.

This is his first loan with KADET Ltd. after he was introduced to us by one of our field officers. He will use the loan to purchase more stock of flour and cooking oil for making his snacks for selling in his shop.

He hopes to open a bigger shop in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Adrien

texts.fr:
Adrien est un père de famille qui vit avec son épouse et ses trois enfants.Depuis des années, il vit en location.
Afin de construire sa maison, il sollicite un prêt de 300 000 f pour acheter du ciment, du sable, du zinc et du bois.Son ambition est de terminer rapidement ses travaux afin de déménager sa famille.
texts.en:
Adrien is a father who lives with his wife and three children. 

For a number of years, he has been renting his house. In order to build his own house, he is asking for a loan of 300,000 francs to buy cement, sand, zinc and wood. His goal is to finish construction quickly so that his family can move.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, zinc and wood.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Abdoulaye est employé comme  conducteur de motocyclette de transport urbain.Il démarre ses activités à 07 heures et ne revient chez lui qu'20 h avec une pause d'une heure de temps entre 14 heures et 15 heures.Il parvient à obtenir des revenus qui lui assurent les dépenses d'alimentation, les frais de location et d'habillement de sa famille. Afin d'acheter sa propre motocyclette, il sollicite un pret de 250 000f.Son ambition est de constituer un parc de moto djakarta.
texts.en:
Abdoulaye is employed as a motorcycle taxi driver in the city. He begins his work day at 7 am and doesn't get home until 8 pm, with a one-hour break from 2 - 3 pm. 

He is able to generate income which he uses to pay for food, rent, and clothing for his family. 

In order to buy his own motorcycle, he is asking for a loan of 250,000 francs. His ambition is to own a fleet of "Djakarta" motorcycles.

loans.use: to buy a "Djakarta" motorcycle.

loans.name: Ndiogoye

texts.fr: Diogoye est un policier  en service.Durant l'hivernage, il cultive des champs d'arachide dans sa localité.Cela lui permet d'améliorer ses revenus mais également de renforcer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille.Il sollicite ainsi un pret de 300 000f pour acheter des semences et de l'engrais.
texts.en:
Diogoye is a police officer. During the rainy season, he grows groundnuts. This allows him to increase his income and also to improve his family's food supply. 

he is asking for a loan of 300,000 francs to buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past year, Annet has been working hard to manage her salon, where she treats and plaits hair. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add products to her hair salon inventory, and will help Annet to generate greater profits and develop the business to generate more income. Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to put up another salon. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Annet's future prospects by helping her to generate more income.

loans.use: buy beauty products for her hair salon

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This is Ali, who is 34 years old. He’s married, and he lives in Lebanon with his wife Kawakeb, the mother of their two school-aged children. Ali is doing the best he can to support his family and offer them a suitable life. 

In 1998, Ali opened his own garage. He started work painting cars, attracting customers from all over the surrounding areas. 

Even though he earns an okay income, Ali suffers from a bad financial situation. For that reason, he’s requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new electrical generator for his business. In that way, he will be able to do his work properly, without worrying about not having electricity. Not to mention that this will help him satisfy his clients anytime they ask for his help as well.  

In the future, he plans to open a bigger garage where he can serve more clients.

loans.use: to purchase a new electrical generator for his business.

loans.name: Maysoun

texts.en:
Maysoun is 26 years old and single. She lives with her parents and two working siblings. The whole family is facing bad circumstances and living in unpleasant financial conditions, which  is why Maysoun started selling clothes from her home. She also visits customers wherever they are located to provide them with her high-quality clothes. She offers a great variety of clothes at good prices. 

Maysoun is requesting her second youth loan from Ameen s.a.l., which she will use to purchase the new autumn collection so that she can improve her business operations and follow up on the new fashion.  To better support her family, Maysoun wishes to have her own boutique with several branches.

loans.use: to purchase the new autumn collection.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is 23 years old and lives in Likoni with her parents. She sells clothes door to door. She chose this business because demand for women clothes had risen. In addition, working in this manner enables her to work peacefully and still earn an income. Her business is open every day from morning to evening and she is able to provide uninterrupted service. 

Mwanajuma is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase bundles of clothes to sell. She is dedicated to her work and makes sure that she supports her parents.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes to sell.
